Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: justdeborah
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel you will continue to come back to! I have no complaints ever on any of my stays. The Oceanfront rooms are amazing! The rooms are very clean and the staff very friendly and helpful always! A great place for the entire family or a romantic weekend away. Any season, this hotel has so much to give you a fantastic time, no matter what the season!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for kids”
Reviews.Author: lyn91153
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Carousel Resort Hotel. Our room was an atrium room, overlooking the ice skating rink so I was able to enjoy the last show of the season from my balcony. My 11 year old son especially enjoyed the ice skating rink and the beach. I thoroughly enjoyed the indoor and outdoor pools although I was upset that the hot tub was not working until our last day there. The repairman kept telling us that the hot tub would be fixed "in an hour". The food was very good and we did take advantage of the nightly specials.

Reviews.Title: “Should be condemned.”
Reviews.Author: ltarazi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so old and dirty. Staff is unorganized and clueless. We stayed for 2 nights room 301, this is a room with a partial ocean view. The carpet is something you would find in an automobile very rough and dark navy so you will not see the dirt and grime....however I did. I had to do a full bed bug inspection which I did not find any evidence but still took every precaution so we would not bring anything home. I did discover a mis-match of box springs and mattresses...very odd....makes me wonder how they get them...are they seconds?? or used?? Sub standard linens and the pillows were the strangest things I have ever seen. Basically they were ball shaped and hard...like they washed them and dried them??? I requested replacement pillows which they did bring quickly but they were the same strange ball shaped mess....I asked if this was normal and the person didn't seem to care or understand. The sliding screen was off track and just leaning against the sliding door. In order to open the sliding door and see our very partial ocean view we had to deal with putting it back on the track...it never stayed. We had to get key replacements 3 times. I was told the door may have issues. I normally would just suck it up and go get new keys but this was not so easy. Getting an elevator is next to impossible....and I was ok with using the stairs but it was very hot and smelly in the stairwell and seemed like a dangerous place to be. Come to find out there are several other elevators in the building but all reserved for employees??? Once you got to the front desk there was usually a line with 15-30 people deep. Keep in mind....I just lugged my wet family up the stairs with all the beach crap and my key doesn't work. I have to trudge back down leaving wet kids and annoyed husband in the hot dark hallway while I try desperately to get a new key. The room included 2 beach chairs which was nice but they were not clear about who you get the chairs from....there is a stand on the beach and I assumed that was the place but was quickly told "no not us"....sorry we get this all the time....you have to get them back up at the hotel. When I finally found the chair person who was tucked away next to the trash?? I told her the front desk should be more clear and I told her I had went to the beach stand...she just said well you can get chairs at the beach stand but you have to pay for them.....no kidding....I want my free chairs Einstein! Caution....if you don't bring the chairs back to the person by 5:30 you pay $50.00 for 2 chairs. LOL....they were worth maybe $10.00....cheap,old and abused just like the hotel. We didn't eat at this hotel.....there is great food in OC...not sure why you would waste your time eating here. OK back to the room....the towels are so tiny....laughable.....same with the towels at the pool....they are so tiny and rough it is pathetic. You can't take them from the gated area so bring your own beach towels. The pool is old and cloudy.....nasty! Ice skating rink is a good plus if your kids are into that but we didn't have time to visit it...plus I wonder how many $$$ they would want to skate on their tiny rink. So here's my thought....OC is full of nasty places and you will get ripped off and feel gross. The beach is nice and my kids had a great time. I knew I wasn't going to get the Ritz Carlton experience but if this hotel and some of the other places in OC would just have a tiny bit of pride and clean their places up and have decent bedding, towels and furniture it would be a much more pleasant experience....and I would actually show up more often. You can't keep sucking the money and not put any back in your investment. I will mention that the ocean front rooms I did get a quick peek in on the 3rd floor did seem to have slightly and I mean very slightly better furniture...keep in mind you will pay way more for that ever so slight upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Property 1605 by Shoreline Properties Reality”
Reviews.Author: Menugirl12
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY AT THIS CONDO UNIT OR USE THIS REALITY. When we arrived there the rugs were filthy&full of stains, The wall paper was peeling in the bathroom, the painted walls were a mess and looked like they hadn't been updated in years. There was broken glass on the kitchen floor& after wiping down the countertops in the kitchen& bathrooms with a clorox wipe, you could tell it hadnt been cleaned at all. The absolute worst was the condition of the bedrooms. The pillows were yellow with sweat stains.The mattress covers were stained covered with body hair,& ripped (no bed bug covers were used just the regular kind),The mattresses themselves were also stained and worn out.I am still freaking out over this and praying that there were no BED BUGS!! When we called to complain we were told that we already signed the lease and there was nothing they could do.We asked Shoreline properties how they would feel staying at a place like this and they stated THEY ONLY STAY AT HOTELS WHEN THEY GO ON VACATION!! They said they would replace the pillows, mattress covers and bed spreads.They came to remove these items and only brought us pillows. The rest of the stuff were never replaced.We desperately tried to find a hotel with vacancy(no luck) and ended up only using one bedroom (which was barely acceptable) and sleeping on the floor of the living room and on 2inch thick pull out crumb filled couch. DO NOT STAY AT THIS UNIT EVER!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “August Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Donna H
Reviews.Content: Our group of seven stayed at the hotel from August 17 - 20 with very satisfactory results. The rooms were clean, and the staff went out of their way to help with any issues that arose during our stay. I used the indoor pool to exercise and found it to be clean and well maintained. Management took appropriate action when we had a problem with a noisy neighbor. Housekeeping even assisted us in helping move our luggage. The children in our party had a great time at the ice rink, both skating and watching the shows. We were very pleased with the hotel and would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Senior week”
Reviews.Author: Kait C
Reviews.Content: A group of about 10 friends and I stayed in a condo in this hotel. The condo (1202 i think it was.) that I guess is owned by other people and not the hotel itself, was really nice. It was clean, the bathrooms and kitchen were very nice. No problems there. The beds were clean, no bed bugs or anything nasty underneath the beds. It had just been updated so it was a truly nice, taken care of condo. A little loud, but that was because of all the loud obnoxious teenagers that were there. I can't see how that would be the hotels fault. I was afraid, after reading reviews that it was going to be gross, smelly, and dirty. But it was not. Over all it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty,Dirty, didn't even unpack.”
Reviews.Author: Jessica N
Reviews.Content: absolutely dirty and that is putting it mildly. The pool is filthy with sand and hazey, not one person swimming in it at 4 pm. Same with the indoor pool. White walls are black with years of handprints. Hairs on the pillow cases. Torn sofa couch, the only thing that looks updated it the TV. There is an odor in the room, the AC barely works and with a squeaky noise. Very disappointed with the service not at all what I had hoped for!

Reviews.Title: “Staff Really Doesn't Care About Guests”
Reviews.Author: leahdahl
Reviews.Content: Stayed there Halloween weekend, it was AWFUL. The first issue was that the ceiling in our room started leaking so we had to be moved. We were moved into the atrium...loud, loud loud. Aside from the fact that the music stays on late in the ice rink there was a large group of blind people staying at the hotel at the time for a convention. Once their convention let out they stood around the atrium talking loudly for over an hour, the staff did absolutely nothing to move them along even though it was nearly midnight. I do understand that it was the off season and they needed to cater to the convention guests but some consideration should be given to other hotel guests too. Maybe they should better plan on putting convention guests in the rooms adjacent the atrium so it is less disruptive to everyone. I also noticed while sitting in the cafe area that one of the blind hotel guests was asking for assistance to place an order and the woman working the counter was pretending not to hear. They were not standing in front of her but a few feet away, she was waiting on no one and the blind hotel guest was practically screaming so there is no way she didn't hear. She chose to ignore a handicapped hotel guest. Absolutely disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Average family resort”
Reviews.Author: Natasha896
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from the Carousel for a week's stay. This was our first stay and the children had a great time. PROS: * Excellent location - beachfront property. * Staff are courteous and polite, except for one icey front desk clerk (with red, straight hair). * Lots of amenities - FREE parking, two beach rentals, WiFi, family pictures, movies (outdoor/indoor). CONS: * Outdated. In DIRE need of a renovation - stuck in the 80s! * Elevators are very slow and small. * Ice skating is pricey. At check in, the package stated it was $4 but we were charged $6 the entire stay. When I inquired with the Front Desk, she stated it was due to the "rentals'. Well... yeah. You need "ice skates" to go "ice skating". In addition, the rink lack supervision - unruly young skaters are racing, some inexperienced going the wrong way, or hanging out chatting. * Maid service is spotty. Some days were good, while the last few days, the coffee service wasn't replenished (no coffee, no sugar/creamer, and no mugs). Microwave was left filthy. * Outdoor pool is TINY, the same size as a residential pool. Indoor pool was dirty, bordered by puddles. Again, there is no supervision with unruly kids, swimmers not rinsing sand off, etc.. * Seasons Restaurant - service was SLOW and food was mediocre at best! TIPS: * If you are on a lower floor, take the elevator if you don't have luggages. * There is a Food Lion, Burger King, Dunkin Donuts, and a pizza place across the street. * Get to the beach early (before 11AM) to get a good spot.

Reviews.Title: “Close to beach,great very,very aged property”
Reviews.Author: tellnobody
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week in a hotel condo ...Good and bad,,,will not return Parking staff was very well organized upon arrival. Parking was never an issue the whole week. Check in was great and before 4pm AC was very loud inside the condo. Called and repair man came within 30 minutes to fix. He also got us light bulbs as 2 were burned out. Informed us the wall switches do not work and we needed to use switches on lamps. As the week went on we noticed things that told us how aged this hotel/condos are...I made a decision that if we could live with it,,I was not going to make a stink..but all along deciding never again. Place is LOADED with kids that have No manners and invisable parents...we are an adult family. AC unit outside condo was very very loud and hot Toaster would only toast x1 and then had to rest 10 minutes...circa 1970's Condo had greasey dust on all doors and laundrey room area behind appliances was filthy.Mini blinds were caked.... Hair dryers are the kind that are on the wall..but they are not on the wall..but a have the wall unit attached. 8 sets of towels....we are average size,,,towels were small...bringyour own Soap and shampoo were out by day 3...bring your own Kitchen was poorly stocked,,,,mix and match ..circa 1980"s dishes,pots...no bowls Furniture is old and beat up,,,springs were broken on cushions... Extra pillows ...no pilllow cases...beds were average,,,linens gray in color. Carpet in commons areas old and dirty Exit to to beach smelled terrible outside of skating rink....like wetness....very hot Standing water where you rinse feet off,,,people just all walk in it.... Indoor pool and hot tube dirty.. Beach bathroom not useable..doors with out looks..paper towels empty Circa 1960's Toilet seat in room showed wear away with black spots The beach chairs were great and the staff working there were always happy.... The grill and bar was good,,and dispite no site of management this group of staff worked as a TEAM.... View from condo was wonderful.... Despite all these things we had great weather and used the condo as a place to sleep and eat breakfast..no toast..enjoyed the beach to the right of the property..which was more adults and less trash talk... We have decided we need a nicer,newer,cleaner more adult condo Namaste

Reviews.Title: “DON'T DO IT”
Reviews.Author: Thisisuttercrap
Reviews.Content: Hotel/rooms were filthy. The floor of my room had not been vacumed. There were Cheerios underneath the bed that looked like they had been there for years. I understand that four o'clock is check-in and true to that, I could not get in my room until four o'clock. I would be OK with that but my room wasn't even clean! Most of the staff I encountered spoke broken english and were difficult to understand. Skating in the ice rink was like skating in soup, it was so melted. Many of the games in the game room were broken. I do not think I can tell you one good thing about my stay at this hotel. The sad thing about it is that I have stayed there before and it was not remotely like this.

Reviews.Title: “Totally enjoyed our stay...”
Reviews.Author: Leemadeema
Reviews.Content: Just got back from week long stay at Carousel, we traveled quite a bit from Texas and really enjoyed our stay at hotel. Location was perfect, right on beach and the STAFF was really awesome. Housekeeping did great job each day, always friendly and helpful. Bar staff and front desk very accommodating and friendly. Our room was fine, was a bit disappointed that we didn't get room on higher level (as we were confirmed prior to arrival), but turned out just fine. Beach was incredible, outside bar and grill was perfect, we had a great time.... Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: Steelworkers00
Reviews.Content: We rented a condo maintained by the resort. To my delight, the condo was clean. Although I brought my own bleach for concerns regarding how clean it would be, I had to do minimal sanatization. When we had a problem with the air conditioning, maintenance was at the condo within a few minutes. Maintenance was excellent and fixed the air conditioning without incident. The ice skating rink was nice. The rented skates were dull, so if you are an experienced skater, bring your own skates. My only complaints were the restaurant, which has extremely slow service, the the hotel only has two elevators (which you can wait quite a while for). If you have kids that are hungry, I suggest eating somewhere else because the service is at a snails pace. However, with that being said, overall, I was quite surprised with the resort and had a wonderful vacation with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: reeselizabeth
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the good things about this hotel. First, it was right on the beach which was great. Second, there were tons of amenities in the hotel, an ice skating rink, saunas, indoor/outdoor pools, a restaurant, a cafe, a gym and more. You definitely wouldn't be bored on a rainy day in this hotel. Also, a few employees were very courteous. The rooms were pretty mediocre however. The bathrooms were a bit dingy and outdated. Also I didn't have a shower the entire first day because I was under the impression that there was no hot water (due to a large number of guests). On the second day I finally called maintenance and they explained since it was old plumbing that I needed to let the water run for a few minutes and wait for the hot to come through. I was glad they informed me of this but it was still a nuisance nonetheless. The sink was completely clogged, which is normal at the beach (because people clean the sand out in the sink). There was no cream for the coffee. We got service one day which was nice to return to but for whatever reason they didn't come the second day when we were out. The AC worked nicely, as well as the TV. The beds were also pretty comfortable. Also, it was very quiet at night (we were on the very end of the hotel) but it was still very nice considering the hotel was very very busy. The balcony was also nice to hang out on. The only real complaint I had about this hotel was the terrible service we got in the small outdoor cafe. A person in our party ordered a pizza but they never brought it or refilled their drinks. Everyone had finished their lunch and we had to ask for the pizza which they then brought with no apology or explanation. I've seen better value for this price. It was very far from the boardwalk (about a 20-25 minute carride) but being beachfront is excellent. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to a friend if other options closer to the boardwalk were totally booked and if amenities are important to you.

Reviews.Title: “A nice vacation”
Reviews.Author: rha1952
Reviews.Content: My family and i enjoyed our stay. The room was clean and met our needs. The food in the restaurant was good and my wife liked the seafood better than a seafood restaurant we went to. There were only two negatives. On some days it was well into the afternoon when we received maid service and this was a problem because it was at the time of our grandson's nap. Also, they advertise that kids eat free, but this is only at breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Great for families!”
Reviews.Author: beachbums87
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel away from the Boardwalk but right on the ocean. It has lots of amenities - indoor and outdoor pools, a small skating rink, and indoor and outdoor places to eat. We stayed there in July with our 3 teen-aged grandkids and it was perfect for us. It has a small refrigerator, microwave plus coffee maker in each room. Also a few empty cabinets. If you plan to have breakfast and lunch here, you'll need to bring paper products, and plasticware! None are provided! The kids considered this an upscale hotel and it is compared to Comfort Inn level. We mostly stayed there for the beach front location and amenities for the kids. Will return with the kids next summer!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for families with kids.”
Reviews.Author: CCinPA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Carousel in the past with my family in the late 80s and early 90s. I was excited to return, until I read the negative reviews on Trip Advisor, and because our recent trip was so fantastic, I am writing my first ever review. I think our stay was nearly perfect. We decided on a short stay because traveled with three young boys ages 6, 5, and 2. We called two days before our trip and booked an ocean front hotel room for two nights. We arrived two hours prior to check in and were quickly given our room keys. We had a perfect unobstructed ocean view and view of the pool from the third floor. The room was dated, but seemed appropriate for the sand, water, and chaos brought into the room by our children. The room was adequate and very clean. The cleaning staff was friendly and did a turn down and straightened the room in the afternoon too. The beach was wonderful The hotel gives you cards for free beach chairs during your stay There are movies and kids activities throughout the day. The kids loved all three pools including a nicely heated indoor pool. They had live entertainment, rides for the kids, and plenty of kid-ready snacks and food. We didn't get to experience everything because there was so much to do. Staff was friendly and helpful. Compared to my experience in the 80s, the Carousel is not exclusive and trendy (but neither am I anymore) and is now a fabulous family oriented ocean front resort.

Reviews.Title: “Carousel”
Reviews.Author: Stefanie K
Reviews.Content: It is a great spot to vacation with the kiddos and family, they could doing much more simplistic, you use a key card and have to carry cash around we're ever you go, no one needs that on there beach trip. They should have wrist bands that open and close the door and everything you get should be charged from the wrist band to your room during your stay. That way it would be convienent for the beach goers.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: summerfun52
Reviews.Content: I will admit, I was concerned about some of the reviews I read regarding this hotel but we had a great experience. I have been coming to Ocean City for 30+ years. Four of us traveled 7/30 thru 8/3 to this hotel. We checked in on a Monday at 1 pm and our room was ready!! The room is large with a nice size fridge, coffee maker and microwave. The extra sink outside the bathroom was very handy. The furniture could use a little updating but that is not a deal breaker for me. The beds were comfortable, carpet newer and our view from bayside 5th floor was quite lovely. When we first arrived in our room, I thought my fridge seemed warm and called for maintenance and someone arrived in 5 minutes! Turns out it needed to cool down as the maids had been cleaning it. In fact, another man showed up and when I said the first maintenance man had just left he asked if there was anything else he could help with!! The elevators are new and digital. Never had a problem getting on or off one. They are fast and efficient. Luggage carts are plentiful and must be checked out. This is a plus as guests would often confiscate the carts the night BEFORE checkout at other hotels and condos I have stayed at. Both indoor and outdoor pools were clean and towels are provided. The moon bounce and lawn games added to my kids beach fun. Loved that 2 free beach chairs were included each day. ( yes, they are the reclining type.) The beach bar has good food and the french fries were a hit and a bargain. There is a happy hour each day with live music. We did not take advantage of the daily restaurant specials as they are for the indoor restaurant with the exception of the beach bar-b-que on Wednesday. ( looked good!) I did use the fitness room several times and found it to be adequate for my needs. Do not miss the ice show. It is top notch!! The ice skating was fun! Make sure you bring socks and jeans. You will need them for skating. Honestly, every staff member I encountered from maids tto wait staff to maintenance to the front desk was so helpful and friendly. I have stayed in numerous hotels and condos in OC but this group was very gracious. AND FINALLY, I LEFT MY CELL PHONE CHARGER IN THE HOTEL ROOM OUTLET. I REALIZED THIS HALF WAY HOME AND CALLED THE HOTEL. I WAS CONNECTED TO SECURITY AND SPOKE WITH HARRY WHO LOCATED MY CHARGER AND SENT IT TO MY HOUSE FREE OF CHARGE. I HAD IT TWO DAYS LATER !!!!! I could have bought another one but my phone is 3 yrs old and I could not buy one for the model. Thank you Harry!! That truly is service. We will stay at this hotel again. I am staying at the Coastal Palms ( another hotel in the Carousel group) next week in OC and hope my experience is just as good.

Reviews.Title: “Family enjoyed the Carousel. You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: teresa f
Reviews.Content: I want to start off by saying that some of these reviews are unfair to the Carousel. Our family just returned from an Ocean Front accommodation August 5-9, 2012 and we had NO complaints with the Room or Cleanliness. All the Ocean front view rooms are newly refurbished. Bathroom was very small, but functional. Granite counters in the bathroom and Kitchen. Kitchen, had a mini fridge, microwave, sink and coffee maker. Flat screen TV, Cable and WiFi. It was Very clean, and housekeeping was there everyday. Whatever we asked for we received quickly from housekeeping staff. So saying that, I think when a guest leaves a review they should be specific as to what category they paid for!!! There are rooms that overlook the ice skating rink (that's not my thing, Yuk, tacky !), there are rooms that face the street. These rooms are NOT renovated and therefore are older and are less expensive. There are rooms that are Condominiums and are privately owned! I'm not 100% sure about this, but I think the owner is responsible for the conditions of their Condo! So if it's a Condo you stayed at and not a "hotel' room, reviewers should specify that! I feel strongly that $298 a night for this Ocean view "hotel" room was great considering that there are "dumps" in OC that charge the same. And then there are hotels charging 500 per night for a similar room. I have stayed at the 500 a night hotel and it did have some Pros, but not enough to justify the price difference. Also, many reviewers complain about the long wait to check-in and the slow elevators. First, the section of the building for the Ocean Front hotel rooms, floors 1-4 had NO issues with the Elevators. The slow elevators are on the other side for the Higher floors and the Condos. Check-in had a small line.. it went quickly! What I liked: The View in Ocean View Room The Grounds, beautiful. Loved the palm trees and gardens. The Pirate Ship. My 3 year old played in it for hours at a time while I sat on a lounge chair overlooking the grass and palm trees. Beach Access. At first I missed staying on the Boardwalk, but then I didn't miss the "shlep" down to the beach from the Boardwalk hotel... This was great, my older children safely went up and down from the beach to the pool. The Bar/Grill: Live entertainment daily weather permitting. Great Music playing all day. Fun atmosphere. Burgers and fries were great too! Staff: Friendly and helpful! Indoor Pool/Sauna/Spa: Hubby and my teenage girls liked this! What I didn't like: The Pool: Small, crowded, water not clear. Pool area is too small. Not enough seating, but you can get a lounge chair below near gardens (loved that spot!) and they need to put a slide or something fun for the kids in the pool area. Maybe make better use out of the area with the baby pool! Towels: Bring your own beach towels (but they do give you two comp beach chairs!). You can only get towels in pool area and you CAN NOT bring pool towels out, not even down to the lounge chairs by the pirate ship which makes absolutely NO sense! Ice Skating Rink: now this is a personal thing. Some people would love having an ice skating rink in the lobby of their Hotel... this just wasn't for me! but to each his own!~ The Atrium/Lobby. The railings outside the rooms are way too low, scary with little ones!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Erica W
Reviews.Content: This hotel was extremely kid friendly, HOWEVER, the rooms were SO outdated, old and not worth the rate. We just got back yesterday and will never stay there again. The food at the restaraunts was sub par. Check in was terrible, the line for the elevators was crazy. Our biggest issue was the DIRTY room, wallpaper peeling etc. Definitely not worth the money. Beach access was nice. Pool was small out doors, but the indoor pool was decent. Will not reccomend this to anyone for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Very functional hotel that served our purpose.”
Reviews.Author: CentralPATravelmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last week with a family of 5. I agree with the reviews. The hotel itself has seen its heyday...dated decor and rooms. Everything was clean and functional. (overlooking the peeling wallpaperand rusting ceiling tile in the bathroom).In need of a major renovation. We stayed fifth floor bayside. It is a good family oriented hotel with enough to keep my seven and nine year old busy. We tried the ice skating, but the big puddles on the ice made it tough to enjoy (we were splashing each other...not fun with shorts on). The pluses: Very helpful and courteous staff, location was convenient, the kids loved the indoor pool, ping pong table, beachfront is ideal Negatives: dated, SLOW elevators, wifi was crazy slow, my cellphone had ZERO reception in the room For what we paid, I'm not sure we would return, however,no regrets for this trip.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT rent Condo 1509”
Reviews.Author: Ellen R
Reviews.Content: First let me say the employees at the hotel are very helpful and attend to your every need. With that being said, that is probably the only positive thing we had at first. Check in was horrible. I have never waited in line for over 30 mins to check into a hote and yes I do travel. Once you are checked in, you need to wait for a cart to load your items onto. Then you hae the nightmare of the elevators. You wait in line yet again b/c there are only 4 elevators for this hote. There are 2 that go up to the 11th floor and 2 that go from the 11th floor to the top. Condo 1509 was not as pictured when we had to choose the one we rented. We paid over 2000.00 for the week and had these problems. We had a family of 4 adults and 3 children. We had alotted one set of towels for the week. When I called to ask if it was possible to had more towels I was told to do laundry. The sweeper did not work. With all the sand, we needed to clean the floor and when I called about this, I was told to see if we had a broom and dust pan. The condo itself was dirty. We found garbage behind the sofa, under the sofa and other areas. There was NO toaster. The fridge door did not close b/c the drawers were from another fridge and didn't fit and therefore the door was opened some of the time. The water heater went. Yep we had NO hot water for a period of time. In our bedroom we had a bed that was ok. The sheets and matress pad laid ontop of the matress with no tucking to keep them into place. I felt very uncomfortable laying on a bare matress during the night. Not to mention all the hair on the so called matress pad. YUCK Also, the airconditioner was located outside the door, Therefore you could not let the door opened b/c the hot air would come directly into the room. (there was a screen door on the main door) So if you do not want to do house cleaning on your stay, don't stay in condo 1509. The staff was great. Especially Jerry at the pool bar. Very friendly and actually all the staff took time to talk with us. It does not pay to check in early b/c you still need to stand in line for the key. So that isn't an option. There are many activities for kids which is good. I would suggest looking elsewhere. We spoke with people that have stayed many times and they indicated it depends on the owner. So how do you know if your going to get a nice room or a room like 1509? Not sure we would stay again. Probably not. I might add that I am not a fussy person, especially on vacation. Maybe one of the hotel rooms would be a better choice. DOn't know. Good luck if you have picked this condo. All in all we loved the city. We will return to OCMD in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: dcmetro123
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th season at the Carousel. July 29-August3; room 422. Prior to heading down I read many of the reviews on this site. Some were very positive; many "satisfied", and an alarming number downright hated the place: "dirty, bugs/bedbugs, mold and mildew; rude service" etc.... I can offer this: Our oceanfront room was Spotless and Huge (jazuzzi tub!!). With nary a bug/mold/mildew in sight. Staff were delightful and accomodating. Housekeeping did a thorough job each day. So where do all these negative reviews come from? Never once had an issue at the Carousel and very much look forward to next season. And I do agree with one point brought up in numerous reviews: check in is a Madhouse. That needs work.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it once was.”
Reviews.Author: rethlaw
Reviews.Content: We've stayed there off and on for a number of years. We went this week after a 2 year hiatus. Staff was very, very pleasant. Check in was a madhouse, but it was to be expected. Our room was overlooking the skating rink (I knew what I was getting when I reserved the room) but the lighting in the room was not the greatest. It always felt dark in there. There was a leak in the ceiling over the shower (with mold) not the thing I wanted to see. The flatscreen TV was great, but there are pop up ads that sprang up every few minutes to the left of the screen (annoying). I would have liked to have found a reputable station guide (after all the Olympics are on!). The restaurant was very disappointing. The food was really not good and the service was very slow. I understand why there was no line on a Saturday night. Access to the beach is great. I like the outdoor bar with live entertainment (service was slow at the table, but after that we sat at the bar, no problem). The outdoor pool is very cramped if you are looking to sun yourself after a swim. This "old girl" resort needs some serious money put into updating and revamping. It's a primo beach location but it's starting to look a little rundown in the halls. Everyone of the staff members I encountered were very, very pleasant. I have no complaints with personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Not enough elevators”
Reviews.Author: Joy T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carousel July 19-23, 2012. The rooms were very modest with a refrigerator that did not work. They did replace it. Patio door screen was off the track and could not be fixed. The elevators were not sufficient for the amount of people registered in the hotel. We had to wait a minimum of 5-7 minutes each time. It was strictly for families traveling in groups of 8-10. We did not find it relaxing and it was not the cleanest. A very big disappointment. The price of $208.00 + tax per night was way over priced. You could have stayed in Fort Lauderdale, FL for less.

Reviews.Title: “Great time with the grandkids........”
Reviews.Author: ellen c
Reviews.Content: First I'd like to start off by saying Ive been to many 5 star hotels.....so my post will be based on that.....have been to ocm over 10 times, but this was the first time staying directly on the beach.....Knowing that I knew it would pricey. We booked CAROUSEL because it always stuck out as a diff hotel. Upon arrival yes it was confusing and very crowded (saturday is always crowded) but we survived the hustle bustle.....our room I found to be just fine...again we were not in a 5 star hotel...didnt pay 5 star prices.....every hotel has issues....none are perfect. Staff and housecleaning I found to be pleasant and helpful when needed. they supplies more than enough clean towels and nice made beds daily. (we are at the beach and we are gonna drag mounds of sand back) ocean front deck was largest ive ever had. Nightly iceskating show (free) has a conv ienent candy/soda/icecream booth till 10pm.....bathrooms galore on main level....had no problem with water pressure...nice to have washer/dryer....found the food to be delicious.....5 minute walk to beach with rinse of hoses...overall for the amenities they had to offer we thought it was a great investment for a wonderful vacation....shall i also mention the HUGE screen on the beach to watch TV on wednesday......only thing I think they should do is get more luggage carts and if possible new/bigger elevators.....hope this helps.....I'm a happy vacationer :)

Reviews.Title: “Make the best of it”
Reviews.Author: KarenA215
Reviews.Content: They had plenty of activities for the guests and the location was ideal. The biggest problem for us was lack of cleanness. Dishes had to be washed before using, carpets were given a lick and a promise of cleaning, blankets had big holes in them and comforters were dirty. In spite of this we did enjoy our week but we're not used to these conditions.

Reviews.Title: “What a mistake”
Reviews.Author: Debbie D
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Carousel on 7/22/12 and had a reservations for a total of 3 nights. Upon receiving our key to our room we were greeted by the maid telling us that our room was not cleaned and she was asking us how we were given the keys when she wasn't done. She informed us it would be about ten minutes until she was finished so we decided to explore the hotel until she was done. Upon entering the room we noticed that there was still food on the carpeting and on the floor between the two beds there was an artificial fingernail laying there. We called the front desk and then we had to leave the room until they came to sweep again(they never swept the first time). Later that evening my daughter got sand in one of the beds and for the next two nights the sand was still there. On the third day after discovering this I called the front desk and was told that they don't change the sheets for a three night stay! Earlier that day while using the elevator there was a notice informing guests that they were doing a cable upgrade between 11:00-4:00 and a hotel employee would be in each room for approximately five minutes during this time. We were gone until about 10:30 that night and while my husband was parking the car my daughter and I went up to our room to find a man standing in our room upon opening the door!!! The man was working on the tv and after about five minutes left(while he was in the room I stood in the doorway holding the door open because I had no idea what was going on). Never have I ever thought I would find someone fixing a tv at 10:30 at night especially after the note stating 11:00-4:00. My husband called the front desk upon learning of the incident and the clerk told him that he was just fixing the tv and she was sorry for us finding him in our room. The indoor pool was like a germ breeding ground with a leaky pipe that was wrapped in towels to absorb the water that was leaking out of it. Unfortunately with the lack of housekeeping in our room along with the much needed renovations of the property and the man in our room this was not an enjoyable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Mestopholita
Reviews.Content: Ten of us (family and friends) rented a condo on the 7th floor, ocean view, for one week. The rental is advertised as being able to accommodate up to 12 people, but it's really best for 8, max. The pull-out beds were extremely uncomfortable, and there is no privacy when using the "den" or living room as a sleeping area. Additionally, the A/C overall barely cooled the condo, and the A/C in the den was completely broken. When we informed the front desk of the problem, they told us that we had to contact Coldwell about it since that is who we booked it through. They didn't even offer to contact them for us! The drinks and food outside were extremely expensive. The indoor pool is kept too warm, and everything closes much too early (outdoor bar by 11pm, the outdoor pool at 7pm, indoor pool and hot tub at 10pm, and ice rink at 9 or 10). Also, there is no smoking on the outdoor balconies, and guests are not allowed to hang towels over balcony rails to dry! This might be a good place for families with children, and there are TONS of children there. I don't recommend it for an adult vacation,. The wait staff were wonderful, though, and we did really like the ocean-view and easy beach access with outdoor "showers" (actually hoses, even better!) to rinse off all the sand and salt. Even though I didn't have the opportunity to use it, the ice-rink was a cute, fun attraction. I will not stay there again, and I won't recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: Roobya
Reviews.Content: The Carousel hotel is nice, a 3 star in our opinion hence my rating. Our room had 2 queen bed and we paid for a roll away bed. The room was spacious but worn. The curtains were old and had pin pricks of light from material being worn away. The rod pulled out of the ceiling but Maintenance came immediately and fixed it with almost no inconvenience to us. The mattresses were old and soft. The decorations old and out of date. We had problems parking our oversized van since regular sized vehicles aren't forced to park in the garage. The oversized lot is small and was full of buses. Fortunately, there was room for our trailer. Access to the beach is great. Restaurants are within and easy walk, as well as a cinema.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Families and Couples”
Reviews.Author: Suzy B
Reviews.Content: I practically grew up at the Carousel since my parents owned a condo during my teen years and we used it year round. I have fond memories of spending time with family and friends at the beach,tennis court, indoor pool, arcade and ice rink. Over time, my parents sold their condo, the hotel changed hands a couple of times and I have been bringing my own family to the newly renovated hotel. I am excited about all the new amenities that make the hotel even more family friendly such as an outdoor pool, kiddie camp, family movies, nightly ice skating shows, and live entertainment. Hotel guests also get a free family photo and the use of free beach chairs. For these reasons and more, the Carousel has always been our first choice for a family vacation. So when my husband and I decided to plan a vacation without the kids this summer, I wasn't entirely sure this was the right place for a couple's weekend until we checked into our hotel room. We sprung for an oceanfront room overlooking the patio after learning about recent renovations to this section of the hotel. The Bamboo Lounge and palm trees outside our window made us feel like we were back in Hawaii where we spent our honeymoon many years ago. The hotel room was very clean, spacious, and beautifully furnished. The kitchennete and bathrooms had beautiful granite countertops and I was pleasantly surprised to find a large, flat screen TV with HD in our room. We were especially excited to have a king size bed with plenty of pillows and a very comfortable mattress. During our stay, the hotel was very busy with families on vacation but we found it easy to enjoy our time as a couple. The best part of the vacation was feeling relaxed, entertained and comfortable at the hotel. Practically everything we needed for a memorable vacation was either onsite or within walking distance from the hotel. The only downside to this vacation was having to remember to tone down the excitement in our voices while sharing the details of our day with our kids during phone calls home. We didn't want them to feel too bad about everything they were missing out on!

Reviews.Title: “Hotels nice, make sure u take pics before you leave...”
Reviews.Author: StellaGirl27
Reviews.Content: We stayed mid June this year... Hotel is nice - full of kids running around without parents. Ice skating rink is cute. Food prices outdoors are quite expensive... We would have had not much to complain about until we were charged $200 for a room damage charge that they could not prove, I have called numerous times left my number and no response from anyone. My advise is to watch your card charges and take pics of the room before you leave.

Reviews.Title: “Had some plusses”
Reviews.Author: bernadettePittsburfg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the Carousel last week (july 2012) and it had some positives as well as negatives. First, the hotel is family friendly and the front desk was helpful. The internet connectivity was difficult at first, but resolved in time. Our room overlooked the ice skating rink, which was very noisy, Had a very bad first night and could not sleep. The bed left a little to be desired, particularly the bedding & pillows. We asked to be moved to another room due to the noise, which improved our quality of sleep. Some positives were free beach chair rentals and easy access to the beach. Overall, the hotel needed a good cleaning, including the outside bar area, which actually had a very bad smell. The price was high for the quality but we still had a very nice time.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissMaria927
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Carousel Hotel (starting July 14) in the “deluxe standard” room, which faced the bay. This was our first time in Ocean City and after much research on choosing a hotel that would be in a good location and have the necessary amenities; we believe we made a very good choice. All employees were pleasant and made us feel welcome. We did not have to cross any busy highway to get to the beach, very lovely and picturesque landscaping, a restaurant on the premises and snack bar. Although we did not have any young children with us, this is definitely a family hotel with many fun kid activities. Other positive aspects of this hotel is that staff members were on hand to help with luggage, hold doors open and answer questions. The complimentary beach chairs were a plus, the fitness center was better equipped than we anticipated and the free family portrait night was an extra bonus. There was also an ice rink, which we did not use, but enjoyed watching others skate and admired the free nightly ice shows. Another advantage to this hotel is that there is plenty of parking including a garage next door which we used, keeping our car out of the hot sun. The only issue we had was that our ceiling was dripping water that we discovered on our first morning. The front desk had maintenance check it out and they believed it was due to a faulty air-conditioning unit above our room, and it was determined that we could move into a different room as soon as one became available that morning. The situation was handled in a professional matter and we were promptly accommodated. Other posts have complained about the elevator wait after check in; we suggest just being patient as this situation is to be expected when there are many guests all with the same idea…to unload and get to the beach. If you prefer a hotel that’s away from the noise of the boardwalk, this is a great location. A bus stop is across the street that makes plenty of stops along Coastal Highway and down to the boardwalk if you are in need of transportation. Yes, we would stay at this hotel in the future. Keep in mind this is an older hotel, but well maintained, the staff is always cleaning all areas of the hotel and our room appeared to be renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Not a family oriented hotel.”
Reviews.Author: beldan21
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel because the website made it seem like it was a family oriented hotel.We arrived late with our three children and after I checked in and began to unpack a large crowd of college aged kids arrived, ( must have just left the bar ) and we were approached by one guy who had no problem asking if our cooler was filled with beer. Then he went in the hotel. I went right in and asked for my money back and we stayed at the Hampton. I felt that the website did not show you an accuracte description of the hotel. Will never go again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent but needs work”
Reviews.Author: WRK1968
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this resort starting sat. 7/21 and the final check out was sat 7/28. Ended up staying in three differant rooms during the week due to not booking the whole week in advance. We choose this resort due to its location which was only two buildings away from where the rest of our friends where staying in a very nice three bedroom condo. First off this place Could be a very nice place to stay due to what it has to offer including an indoor ice skating ring. However, in its present state its not. Its Fair at best. It is in much need of a complete renovation. Paint peeling from the ceiling, dirty carpets, very old decor, and not the cleanest place by far. There was trash n years worth of dirt under the beds and anything else that would require a little effort to clean. And this wasn't hard to spot, it wasn't like i had to move furniture. Just drop something on the floor n happen to look under Any pc of furniture n it will gross u out. The worst part is having to pay an average of about $300 a night. I have stayed in very nice 4 star hotels for less then what they are charging. I can stay at a 5star two bedroom resort in cancun for the price i paid here and the rooms in cancun are spottless and in perfect condition. This place does have a lot to offer and i would love stay here again but only after they get their act together and fix the place up and Clean it well. And again I stayed in THREE differant rooms and found them all to be in equal disrepair.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Staff but Needs Major Upgrading”
Reviews.Author: Easton_PAFamilyof4
Reviews.Content: I just stayed 1 week at the Carousel in a 2 bedroom 2 bath Condo in 1403 the week of July 21st with two adults and 4 kids. Once I arrived at the hotel the check in was easy and the bellmen took all my Escalade filled belongings up to the condo. That was a big help with 4 kids. I also want to add about the big SUV's...the parking garage can be tight backing out but security can put you in an oversized lot on the side. Anyway, back to the condo...the condo was very very dated. The furniture is old, the appliances are really old, the ceilings are popcorn stile, the bathroom ceilings are drop ceilings, the fixtures are dated back to 80's easily, the vacuum cleaner looked like the 60's, the whole place needed painted, and overall the whole place needed major updating. I can't say that I expected much more though since it is a 3 star hotel. Just don't expect anything modern in this resort. I did notice that they were replacing all the tube TV's with 37 inch flat screens. They had three dumpsters full of tube TV's. Now my opinion on the actual resort: it is dated but good for families. The pools are small but work for families, the food was pretty good and a good selection, the ice skating rink is cute, the ship for the kids to play on was a must for the kids at the end of the day, and the gym was used by myself everyday and was more then sufficient for my needs. They also have a game room and bounce house for the kids. The beach is also just steps away which is really nice and the views of it from the condo were amazing. Just beware that everywhere you go...you must have your room key. I gets annoying after awhile actually!!! The staff were all very nice. I have stayed at 4 and 5 star resorts and I think this could have been the nicest staff I have experienced. I think if you can look past the very outdated rooms your family will have an enjoyable trip. Just don't expect anything more then a 3 star room (at best). I think the Carousel has a great staff and now if they just invest in upgrading the place....they will have something overall even better. ****Extras: The elevator situation can get very frustrating because there are only two for the high floors and it can take a pretty long time to fit into one when you have four kids!!!!! Also, very happy with the fast free internet!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money, Or time”
Reviews.Author: m_rei34009
Reviews.Content: We stayed July 16th to the 20th and boy was it an awful vacation. It started off getting a room right next to the pool and when asked to change (due to people staring in our room) the front desk told us to either move hotels or deal with it. The following day the televisons were out the WHOLE DAY and for the money we payed there should have been 12 televisons in the room. The next day we went to the hotels restaurant, and boy was it expensive and awful. They also messed up our order and the waitor could barely speak english. Front desk was always rude.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay in this hotel again....”
Reviews.Author: C H H
Reviews.Content: The room isn't ready until 4:00pm and checkout is 11:00am...but the pool closes at 7:00pm and doesn't open until 10:00am, so if you are looking to check in and relax that really isn't happening. The bathroom shower has no pressure so forget getting clean and rinsing off the ocean and pool. If you have long or thick hair shampooing will take forever. The cable was out for almost an entire day. A note had been left under the doors explaining that the the hotel was switching to full hd and they would need to have access to our room for 5 minutes between the hours of 11:00am and 2:00pm. The cable never came on after that time. When I was in the lobby I heard the clerk telling someone on the phone that she hadn't had cable at home either. I saw someone who looked as though they could be a manager give a grin and chuckle as though he thought that was an acceptable story. The cable wasn't out in the area. It was because they were changing the system in the hotel. It seems that doing so in the winter would have been a far more intelligent choice. After I complained and explained to the clerk that I wasn't buying her story about the cable being out all over Ocean City because the other area hotels weren't having the problem and it was their change over that caused it, they finally sent someone to my room at 11:30pm waking my chidren to repair it. the repair took about 20 seconds and must have been what they had to do to each tv. There were not enough towels in the bathroom and no tub mat so if you have children be especially careful! Even though I requested that the room be cleaned, the carpets weren't vacuumed, the soap wasn't replaced and the bathroom floor mat was not replaced and the sink had not been cleaned. The room had a general dirty feeling...no closet door on the closet and the freezer portion of the refrigerator need to be defrosted so nothing could be stored there. Sand was still in the tub from the previous guest. You can no longer take drinks to the pool area either...so if you are looking to relax by the pool with a cocktail forget that. The indoor pool and hot tub were very murky looking. The second evening there we noticed that no one ever checked the chemicals in either the pool or hottub. So my vacation at the Carousel consisted of: One day with no television - which we like to watch at the end of the day since the outdoor pool closes so early and we have children. Cleaning the bathroom myself Going to the front desk at 6:30am to retrieve soap and towels. Swimming in a murky indoor pool that had a leaky pipe and a towel wrapped around it. Sleeping very little because the bed made a very loud squeaky sound every time you moved on it. We were obviously not valued customers and will not stay there again... Several of the staff act as though you are bothering them. The hotel in general is poorly maintained and seems badly in need of repairs and a thorough cleaning. I would not stay here again it was simply horrible!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Laura M
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Carousel several times, most recently over the fourth of July. As always, the staff is very friendly. There is a lot to do at the Carousel. You wouldn't even have to leave if you didn't want to. The outside bar is great, although it closes too early..at 9:00 pm. A nice perk is that they give you two free beach chairs to use during your entire stay. The outside pool is nice, though a little small. There is a nice yard area to lay out if you decide not to go to the beach. The rooms are a bit dated, but I found them to be clean. I definitely would stay here again. Only complaint I have is that it took forever to check in on a Sunday afternoon. They need to figure out a way to speed up that process.

Reviews.Title: “BUGS BUGS AND MORE BUGS”
Reviews.Author: joe b
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel recently. I am sorry to say we had a horrible experience. At a first glance, the hotel seemed to have all we needed to have a great family vacation; pools, outside bar, hot tub, work out center, ice rink, restaurant etc. The hotel was definately a flashback to the 80's and lacked modernization or techinical upgrades. That was all fine with us, for the price we paid for an ocean front view. However, the second night we were there, I decided to stay up later than my chldren and husband and was on the computer. The lights in the room were off for about an hour when I noticed movement in the kitchen area. When I turned the lights on, the room was loaded with 3 different types of bugs, which were by that time crawling all over coming out of the carpentry. I am not a bug expert, but i can tell you this: these were not carpenter ants, they look like roaches and bed bugs. I woke my husband up to check out the scene. We turned on the lights. I went downstairs to talk to management about the problem and insisted on a refund. This was 1:45 in the morning. My husband and I packed up and as the lights were back on, the bugs seemed to go back into hiding. Like I said previously we have 2 small children and we had to pack them up and drive to a relatives house 3 hours away. Not to mention, when we arrived, we had to spend the next day fumigating the car, and luggage, and bringing all clothes to laundrymat. I called the hotel to get full refund for the inconvenience, the shortened vacation, etc..and PLEASE READ THIS...they denied us a full refund, and actually denied the fact there were any bugs in the room and went on to say the room had been occupied already...HORRIBLE MANAGEMENT!!!!!!!! Please do not risk ruining your vacation!!!!

Reviews.Title: “10th Floor Condo Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Jenny W
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 10th floor 2BR condo for a week while attending dance convention. We really liked that we had easy beach access and ability to rent chairs and umbrellas. The hotel and staff were clean, professional and efficient. Our air conditioner broke on the first night so we got to meet the maintenance staff. They were also, professional and efficient. We will stay here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth0312
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't suggest staying here. The first night we arrived we had an atrium view. The room was poorly maintained. The shower was dirty, the kitchenette counter tops were peeling, the wallpaper was peeling, the carpet was dirty, and all of the furniture needs a good cleaning. I asked to switch to an ocean front room for the remainder of our stay. It was better maintained but definitely by no means clean. There was writing on the wallpaper in the bathroom, dirt carpet, dust bunnies everywhere, someones deodorant cap barely under the night stand, and tissues under the bed. We stayed in the ocean front room for 3 days and housekeeping never once cleaned the room. I had to call down to the front desk for clean towels. The whole resort just seems poorly maintained. The front desk was nice and helpful but it would be a whole lot easier if they had someone who spoke good English to maintain the phone lines. While we had a good short vacation, I would not return to this hotel. Also, upon check out they hand you a paper and say "be sure to leave us a good rating on tripadvisor".

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Brenda R
Reviews.Content: Not too bad of a place to stay. Only issues were the wait time on the elevators during check in & check out & the outside pool & bar closed way too early. No free breakfast either.

Reviews.Title: “Noisey”
Reviews.Author: jenny g
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week. Our room was on the second floor in the corner facing the atrium. Right out side if our window were 3 giant air conditioners which were very loud , as well as the noise from the atrium . The atrium did quite down around 11pm which was fine but the air conditions totally disturbed us. By the 3rd day I could take it and asked to have our room changed. I could not take another day without sleep. They were very nice about it and changed our room right away. One other thing if you can bring your own pillows, they were very lumpy.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great place to stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: liberatorLori
Reviews.Content: The amenities are exceptional and compensate for the price of the hotel (indoor and outdoor pools). Other hotels priced the same and have little to no amenities. Rooms are large and the maid service is exceptional and accommodating. A nice place for families and great place for couples.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: MiddletownDe_Robert
Reviews.Content: the ONLY good thing I can say about this place is that they got a winner when they hired KEVIN the food & Bev./ rest. mgr. We had made reservations in early April for the week of July 2 2012. There were 3 prices we had to choose from, we chose the most expensive (269.00) a night. Did not get the room we were promised, and when confronting the room mgr., all she could say to me was we will give you your money and YOU CAN LEAVE. She was sooo rude and unprofessional. Kevin on the other hand was so professional, really made us feel relaxed and comfortable. If it wasnt for KEVIN and his employees this mini vacation would have been a complete disaster.

Reviews.Title: “First Time in the OC!”
Reviews.Author: PDIDY68
Reviews.Content: Room was quite small based on the price that was paid. The elevator situation was horrific as two went to the upper floors and two went to the lower floors. I see doing that if you have more than 4 elevators but come on, we were waiting there for over 15 minutes at one point. The ice skating rink was not bad, kids loved it but it could have been Zamboni'd a little more often as puddles of water were evident for more than 1 hour at a time. The game room was small and had probably 10 playable games. The food and bar were a little pricey but okay. Breakfast we ordered from the menu instead of the buffet. The outdoor pool was horrible. no chairs around and even if you did have a chair it wasn't a lounge chair as there was no room for those. So people took their lounge chairs and sat on the grass across from the pool. The best part was the beach...they sprung for 2 free beach chairs per day per stay and the we rented the rest(boogie boards and umbrella) The kids had a great time in the ocean but we soon departed a night earlier when a friend had their house on the Jersey Shore open for us to come...Will come back to OC MD but will stay at Marriot or Holiday Inn next time....

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: K D
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying here and we loved it. Rooms are a bit outdated and it's about 5 miles away from boardwalk, but the hotel kept the kids busy. They loved ice skating rink and the shows they had every night. Indoor pool was nice and warm, atrium had lots to do. Staff was great and friendly. Check in and check out took no longer than 2 minutes. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “not as good as last year”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: Quality of the room was good. Everything was clean and house keeping was polite.....However, we did not get the room we requested at check in, and was told while making reservations we would have that room available...The food at Seasons Restaurant was below average at best, and the outdoor bar ran out of two draft beers for an entire two days....oh that was ok because, for a $1.50 more you were able to purchase a can of beer if you wanted the specific beer that was not available on tap...not very happy with that at all..

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: candice m
Reviews.Content: We actually have stayed there two times and loved it! Lots of activities going on inside so even when the weather is bad outside you can still have a good time. The indoor pool was great. The only issue was there was no stove top or toaster in our room which would've been nice to have.

Reviews.Title: “Family focused destination..”
Reviews.Author: Judy K
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 day stay at the Carousel. What a great place. We were welcomed by friendly staff and the rooms wre clean and spacious. We had an oceanfrintt room which was just above the outside dining and bar. At first we thought this may present a problem but, it didnt, they had everything quiet by bed time and the hotel was surprsingly one of the quietest that I have stayed in.There is plenty of activities right in the hotel.. They provide a free ice show which I have to admit we did not watch in its entirety but not because it was'nt good. They have dinner specials every night. We only ate at the outside tiki dining , but the food was good and plentyful. The beach was easily excessible. If we needed anything the staff was right on it. The place was clean and beds were comfortable. I will stay again there . Also another added bonus was a free parking garage while there. The car was parked the entire time in shade and away from traffic. There was a bus that traveled the main strip which picked up and dropped of right in front of the hotel, so for $1 each way you could easily travel to the boardwalk or other places. Very enjoyable experience .

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value”
Reviews.Author: Sunder R
Reviews.Content: Was there during the very busy 4th of July week, the first appearance is not great as the facility is dated, check-in process is clunky, however once checked in found the rooms clean, had a inside room facing the ice rink. Given the very convenient access to the beach and sand the hotel folks do an outstanding job of keeping the lobby, foyer areas clean enough, the indoor swimming pool was also good- water temperature was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great beach and full of activities”
Reviews.Author: gme123gme
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. It was on a pretty flat beach, ,no shells, good tiki and poolside restaurant. Has an indoor skating rink. Has a pool on the beachside instead of streetside which is a big plus when family memebers want to swim at beach and ocean. Lifegaurds very attentive. This is the 2nd time we stayed here and would do so again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Terri C
Reviews.Content: First of all, keep in mind, this hotel really does cater to families. Most of the previous reviews I read, gave Carousel a 3 out of 5 star rating, but I think it should be closer to 4. For the overall service, value and on-site activities it was a nice family get-away. If you can afford a few extra dollars, it's worth getting an oceanfront balcony room. The room was large and sunny. All of the rooms have a "mini-kitchen" with a fridge and microwave. This is nice for having breakfast or lunch in your room. It's also a great way to save a little money.

Reviews.Title: “Overall nice place”
Reviews.Author: LauraNP74
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Ocean City and I chose the Carousel based on the ice rink, family activities and some friend's reccomendations. I liked the feel of the place, it was the first hotel I have been to outside of the all inclusive resorts in the Carribean that truly felt like a resort. We enjoyed the ice shows, the movie nights and the pools and beach. I do think the condo we stayed in was a bit run down for the money we paid. We had a problem with the freezer and my daughter's ice cream cake melted. I reported it to the front desk and within a few hours we had a new freezer (too late for the cake but I wish I had said something sooner). Housekeeping was a little iffy- sometimes they did the dishes and sometimes they didn't and there was no dishwasher detergent available for us so we had to buy some. The housekeeper took some empty plastic bottles out of our kitchen and unfortunately our cherry pitter was also in the bag which made the kids unhappy. Overall it was a pretty good experience. If we come back to Ocean City I will consider returning to the Carousel.

Reviews.Title: “The Carousel”
Reviews.Author: Katie I
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel at least 5 times and it is truly amazing. The staff is super friendly and there is so much to do in the hotel. My family loved the ice rink, the pools, and just about everything else this place has to offer. The hotel room itself, is really nice and clean. Everything about this hotel is great. I think that for the cost it is defiantly reasonable. Checking in and out was very simple and we had a wonderful stay! :)

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Special Room Rates Deals”
Reviews.Author: twinmom67
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with the room. I booked our Ocean front patio pool room back in March based on excellent "deals" received in a mailer but did not get the room we requested even after several confirmations and guarantees even up to the day before we left. They completely messed up our reservations and took no responsibility for the problem. I was told the "rate" was why we could not have the rooms directly in front of the pool. They were reserved for guests paying full price. If I had known that I would not have paid extra for an ocean front patio room. I had young twins and we wanted to be in front of the pool to watch them from the patio and also so they could take naps. Instead we were put in a less desirable patio room directly in front of the LOUD music, grill and bar tables. The manager (Ruby) was not very helpful and would not move us even though we had reservations 4 months in advance. She could only offer $10 off a night for the inconvenience. Wow what a discount! Again it was based on the amount you were paying. Less price = lower quality room!!! I was told that there is no guarantee that you will ever get a Pool Patio room. Hmmm then why make reservations? Poor Hotel management...

Reviews.Title: “Surprising quality and price for Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: melani26
Reviews.Content: As far as Ocean City hotels go, the Carousel is both surprising and impressive. The location is prime, with beach front access, right on Coastal Highway, near a lot of good restaurants, bars, and a grocery store. The hotel offers two free beach chairs during your stay, so don't worry about bringing your own unless you're traveling with a big family. While you don't need your beach chairs, you will need beach towels unless you're only hanging by the pool, in which case towles are provided. As advertised, the hotel hosts an indoor ice skating rink, outside patio bar, indoor AND outdoor pool, plus a restaurant. The rates are reasonable considering the overly-priced hotels in Ocean City, but you don't have to worry about a compromise in quality associated with the price. The rooms are spacious and clean and the staff is friendly and attentive. I plan on staying here again later this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, sure to return!”
Reviews.Author: CostasDaGreek
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Carousel from June 9-16 with a group of my friends in a Condominium. Overall the experience we had was great. Not sure why there are many negative posts, because we had an excellent stay and the ammenities were good. The indoor pool was good and spacious, along with the Sauna. The atrium was nice to hang out and relax with a drink while watching an ice show, and the condo itself was large and comforting. Huge oceanview balcony with a great view, and friendly staff. The only downside was midway during our stay there was a fire drill which I assume is mandatory. It occurred around 10:30, and everything seemed to go accordingly. The Carousel is situated on the more quieter and more family friendly side of Ocean City, and it is a short drive to many amusements that the city has to offer. The bus gets pretty crowded unless you can deal with a lot of crazy people. We drove to our destinations. The other minor problem was parking. A few nights we could not find a parking spot on the property and had to park on a nearby street. Besides that, we had an excellent stay, and we are returning to Ocean City on July 3 for Independence Day Week, but unfortunately the Carousel was sold out. We had to settle for a smaller hotel which we will be checking out tomorrow. But we will return to the Carousel very soon!!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: dan r
Reviews.Content: Booked a three night stay 06/24 to 06/27. We booked through the "deals" they sent in the winter. They messed up our reservations, gave us a ocean front room for the first night and then had to move us to a parking lot view the remaining nights. The first night we couldn't get in the room until after 4:30, but magically the parkiing lot view room was ready the next day at 9:00??? The parking lot view room after the third try still smelled like mold. The screen door was broken, the rain was pouring through the door, little hot water, room was dirty and stunk. Just a hint, spraying Febreeze doesn't make the room clean. The manager's response "Do you want to stay in this hotel or not". We will never waste our time or money on this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay..but still had problems!”
Reviews.Author: sherrym71
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an ocean view room with our two teenage daughters. Overall, our stay was nice. Our girls enjoyed the ice rink and the beach access was great. However, the room was small and the bathroom was ridiculously small...the door hit the toilet every time we opened it. We ate dinner one evening in the hotel restaurant and it was awful!!!! Our order was wrong, grilled shrimp tasted like plastic, and the service was poor. The manager assisted us eventually, but it was a huge disappointment. Check out was fast and easy, but check in took forever! This has happened during other years we stayed at the Carousel. They are either very slow and/or under staffed!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Mini Vacation For Two.....”
Reviews.Author: Jeannie_J330
Reviews.Content: This was the first vacation for my husband and I togther so we picked the Carousel, our friends have stayed in the condominium for 2 years now..we booked late so we didnt get an ocean front room..I liked that it was easy to get to the beach..just a few minutes walk..we enjoyed the grassy area also near the outside pool with tables and an outside eating area with good food..we also appreciated that they had a lot and a garage if the lot was filled we could find a space easy to park..we wanted to stay an extra day or two so they accomadated us that way also..got to see our friends condo there it was really really nice..we may do that next year with a few friends to share expenses..all around I would go back there again..alot of things to do there too..thanks!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Family hotel”
Reviews.Author: kkline82
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at The carousel many times and never have had a problem. This year we went with an ocean front suite. We loved it! The suites are on the ends of the hallway, which makes it nice and quiet. We have 2 little ones under 5, and they have do much for the kids to do. Walking distance to beach, swimming pools, ice skating rink, arcade and more. The room was upgraded with new bathroom and flat screen TVs. And the service was pretty nice. They immediately brought up extra towels when asked. Always a pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Beware and be warned! Have low expectations if you stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Truthdriven
Reviews.Content: Very dated structure, facilites, furnishings...everything from the 70s. There is a reason that they do not show us photos of the rooms! You would surely go to another hotel if you saw a photo of the popcorn ceilings, aged walls and paint job, cheap carpet and small bathroom. We stayed in a room intended for 3 + guests because it had 1 king and 2 queen beds. Really, 1 bathroom is inadequate. The bedding and draperies smelled badly and looked old. If you look at the photo, they are arial views so they appear larger than in reality. Read some of the management responses and they blame the guests for not bringing problems to their attention. No, no, no. Shame on you Carousel. You should have higher standards for your product then you wouldn't have to make excuses and blame your guests for having made the bad decision to stay even 1 night at the Carousel Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Memorial Day 2012”
Reviews.Author: CallMeCassi
Reviews.Content: Simply put this hotel was everything I needed in Ocean City. It's on the grown-up side of OC and a few steps from your room the beach. We rented an umbrella for the day and the hotel provided 2 complimentary beach chairs. Clean rooms, FREE parking, semi-attentive staff (I hate it when ammenties are not disclosed upon check-in**complimentary beach chairs and wi-fi acess code), indoor ice skating rink and walking distance to grocery, liquor store and a fast food restaurants. We will definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place”
Reviews.Author: Bretjurgens88
Reviews.Content: Overall I enjoyed my stay. It's right next to the beach and in walking distance to gas stations and grocery stores. The room was clean. We needed extra pillows and they were promptly brought to our room at 2am. I only have a few complaints. The vending machines do not have water on the upper floors so you have to go all the way downstairs to the center of the hotel. It would be nice if they had more elevators because they were always packed and we had to carry everything we had to beach down the stairs. My main complaint which is a wry big one was a mysterious "authorization fee" that I was charged after check in of $200 which overdrafted my account. I spoke with a supervisor who was very rude about it and was of no help at all. She told me she has no idea why it was charged and pretty much told me she can't do anything about it and I'll have to talk to someone in accounting the next morning, which left me with no money Saturday and instead of going out for a good time i had to sit in my room all night because I was broke. The next day durring check out I spoke with the manager and she called my bank for me and got it fixed for me. She told me we were checked into the system wrong by the front desk and that should not have happen. Her name was robin and she single handedly saved any chance of us returning to the hotel on our next beach trip. So overall a nice stay and I recommend it but when you check in make sure you ask them about that fee and to make sure you are checked in correctly so that you don't lose $200 for the weekend. THANKS ROBIN!

Reviews.Title: “June 2012”
Reviews.Author: Patti S
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a nine night stay. There was an issue with our unit upon check-in. Pat, director of Condo Sales, was very helpful and professional. She quickly and efficiently addressed the issue in a more than satisfactory way. My family and I enjoy the excellent location and many amenities of the carousel. We are looking forward to our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to”
Reviews.Author: LAgirl427
