Reviews.Content: We went in August 2011 for my 13th birthday. We stayed from August 1-august 5. The hotel was awesome! I loved the ice skating rink, the snack bar, the indoor and outdoor pool. We stayed on the 19th floor and we had a perfect view of the ocean. The rooms were clean and the staff were friendly. For my birthday, we went to a seafood restaurant which was in walking distance. The first few days were cool and rainy, but we still had a great time :)

Reviews.Title: “Would go again, upgrading and ocean front has great view”
Reviews.Author: eastcoastgirlforever
Reviews.Content: We got a deal and decided to try a different shore point. My daughter and I heard this place was a "dump" and I saw around 2008 on TripAdvisor it wasn't so good but I saw they were doing work,new owners, etc and for price figured what the heck. The balcony was sizable and had 2 chairs and a table and was where I spent most of my time just enjoying the atosphere and reading all hours of the day and night. I would go again. The view was beautiful, staff was very courtious, our screen door came off the track and my daughter thought the refrigerator wasn't getting cold and maintenance was responded in minutes! I love how the luggage carts are under security so you don't have kids or people hoard them and abuse them, you need to leave your ID when you take a cart and get it back when returned. (Although I did hear some snob say he "NEVER" had been to a hotel where they didn't have someone to help - middle aged overweight guy probably covering for not being able to push the cart, where I'm married to a guy who refuses, even in high end New York City hotels to allow someone to take our things without his presence). The ice rink was nice since my daughter plays ice hockey and was able to enjoy skating and the free show. Movie night was a nice feature too, but the screen was hard to see without the lights off in that part of the atrium. Usually it's outside. The outdoor bars and atmosphere were nice. The free family picture was cute and a nice perk. The guys taking the pictures were great at their job! Their theme nights and breakfasts seemed expensive in comparison to all of the food places nearby. We didn't bother once we saw the price and someone else said they waited 1/2 hour for breakfast and ended up walking out, so that area needs improvement. A Theme night must be affordable. I wouldn't hesitate to go back, the ONLY reason I gave 3 stars instead of 4 were a few little things. They upgraded to nice clean furniture but it's very cheap. When we arrived a dresser drawer was off it's tracks and housekeeping should have notified maintenance before check in, my husband uses a CPAP snoring machine and after 6 days the bottom of the drawer where he placed it was falling out, literally, but I get they are trying to quickly spruce it up and hopefully will use better quality as they replace? and you could tell light switches, thermostats and doorknobs were never cleaned by the dirt and fingerprints left on them, the bathroom lightswitch and thermostat were nasty with fingerprints. Just take your own clorox wipes like I do since we travel so much. PS - even in pouring rain, kids were great with a really good cable selection. Trust me, we've traveled enough to know that some places have the basic 13 and if they have satellite instead of cable it can take the whole trip to get a tech to fix it and you are stuck. Touch this up and I can say fantastic, but if you don't upgrade the furniture you run the real risk of having it be "dumpy" again by summer's end!.

Reviews.Title: “Why we are going back.”
Reviews.Author: GORDOJAYS
Reviews.Content: This summer will be our Third visit to Ocean City and the 2nd time we are staying at the Carousel. We rented a condo again and first off I must say that the staff in the condo reservations dept are top notch, they are some of the most polite people I have ever dealt with. Starting off with Pat and the rest of the staff, all excellent. The condo itself was very clean, though the bathrooms were a bit dated. But that is fine as they were super clean. We love the poolside bar and the music they play everyday. The staff at the hotel are always helpful and friendly. We searched and searched for another hotel in OC this summer, and we had no choice make our reservations at the Carousel. Everyone from the Bell hops, Front desk staff, right up to the upper management made us feel welcome and attended to our every need.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Carrie B
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I brought my 3 granddaughters to the Carousel Hotel over Memorial Day weekend. We chose the Carousel based on a recommendation of a friend as being a family friendly hotel which it was. My granddaughters loved the pool, moon bounce, and pirate ship. We didn't ice skate because the girls are still young and would have needed an adult. With my daughter being 7 months pregnant and me not knowing how to skate we chose not to attempt it but the girls loved watching the other skaters. I knew going in this was an older hotel but was pleasantly surprised at the condition and cleanliness. I consider myself a picky person and I could not find one thing not clean. The service we recieved was exceptional. Anything we asked for we had within the hour. The motor on our hair dryer blew and we had one within 15 minutes of asking. The staff were all very friendly and accommodating. We arrived on Thursday when they were just preparing to open everything for the season yet even though the outdoor grill was not completely set up the staff offered to make us anything we wanted to eat. My only disappointment was being told prior the pool would be opened on Friday and it didn't open until Saturday but we had fun anyway so it wasn't a huge deal. My daughter was kept awake most of Friday night by rowdy, young people partying but when I opened the door I determined the noise was coming from a small motel next door. I have come to expect noise in the middle of the night in Ocean City no matter where I stayed. I have attached a couple of photos of the view from our room. I have stayed at many ocean front rooms at various beaches and I have to say the view from this room was probably the most stunning I have ever had. Not only did we have a view of the ocean, the pool was directly below us too. I could watch all the action or in the mornings I could enjoy the peacefulness of the roaring ocean. I would get up a couple of hours earlier than my family every morning while there and sit on the balcony with my laptop. This was my alone time to prepare for a full day with 3 toddlers and watching the sunrise was the most relaxing part of my trip. Considering I hadn't planned on any relaxation this was a bonus. lol The landscaping at the Carousel was absolutely beautiful. From what I understand they bring palm trees in every summer and they are gorgeous. It gave the feel of being in a tropical island. I can only comment on dinners at Seasons Restaurant because we did not eat breakfast or lunch there. I thought it was good food, not exceptional but good. The ice cream parlor was a great place to go in the evenings for a snack and they also have a small gift shop that has a good assortment of sand and beach toys and souvenirs. We didn't use the indoor pool or spa. I know this sounds somewhat like an advertisement for the hotel but please believe me when I say if I have a bad experience I am not afraid to share it. I had such a nice time and so much of it was because of not having a stressful hotel stay that I wanted to share it. I hope your visit will be just as pleasant as mine was.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel rooms but lovely beach in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: stulimom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel section of the Carousel Resort since they allowed us to spend only 4 nights here as opposed to a full week's condo rental. The first room they showed us on the 5th floor was absolutely unacceptable as its balcony wasn't even a balcony but some hard asphalt out onto the roof of their skating rink facility. We moved to a different room facing the parking lot and were much happier. Parking is easy and convenient and the beach area is fine. But the rest of the place didn't appeal to us as an older couple. Families would love it however with the skating rink and indoor atrium. But it served our purposes of getting good beach time and visiting our favorite restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Horrible food”
Reviews.Author: Lakeyshia J
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple recently visited tis hotel for memorial weekend. The rooms were very clean, the staff was very friendly, however the food in the restaurant was AWFUL!!! it is advertised as a breakfast buffet and is nothing of the sort! It was 5 items and they were cold. The service was WORSE! For 10.95 i would have expected more than bacon sausage biscuits and french toast. Unacceptable! Other than that it was a great hotel for family, couples not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Horrrrible.”
Reviews.Author: ChadTravels828
Reviews.Content: First off, the hotel was oversold and we were bumped. Which happens. But the room they gave us was AWFUL! It over looked the roof which was littered with beer cans and trash, the paint on the door was all peeling off and there was FRESH grease running down the side of the microwave. There were no other rooms they were willing to give us at the same price so we left. VERY unhappy memorial day weekend..

Reviews.Title: “Only go if you like loud and just the basics”
Reviews.Author: 0beachbum0
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Right on the water - Free parking - Indoor iceskating rink for kids Cons: - Indoor iceskating rink with loud music until 10pm - Went off season (last weekend in April) and management wasn't in full gear- hotel didn't notify us that construction was going on and the construction went until 10pm and later until we called and asked them to stop. They pretended at first, that they didn't know what we were talking about. Started 8am daily so couldn't hear waves of ocean either. - Offseason the internal store for food/drinks closed M-F

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families!”
Reviews.Author: SoloTraveler44
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at this hotel a few nights ago and we had a wonderful stay. The hotel offers numerous amenities (indoor and outdoor pool, sauna, fitness center, ice rink, and beach access) making it the perfect choice for families. We stayed on the fourth floor and our hotel room was very clean and fitted with comfortable beds, modern furnishings and new carpeting; there was also an in-room coffee maker, mini refrigerator, microwave, flat screen TV and cable. My only complaint was that we couldn't stay longer (we only spent one night there). Cons: late check-in (however, we were told we could use the amenities prior to check in and when we arrived at 3pm our room was ready and we were allowed to check in early). breakfast was NOT included All in all, I would recommend this hotel to families (and even couples) who are looking for a reasonably priced hotel in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Don't come out of season”
Reviews.Author: vpollyb
Reviews.Content: No breakfast available despite being told by front desk that there would be. Basic room but great view of the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: powz13
Reviews.Content: My family and I went for a weekend getaway April 20-22. What more can you ask for? This hotel is right along the beach, includes free parking, ice skating, and indoor pool. The room was clean and spacious. The staff was nice and courteous and to top it all off the prices were reasonable. Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Better than most in OC”
Reviews.Author: Arthur C
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Carousel with my family in Ocean City for the past 10 years or so. I've tried a couple other properties, but they never quite measured up. I know that sounds very positive, but basically, in my experience, there are a lot of really crappy hotels in OC, and the Carousel just happens to be less crappy. The good: If you have kids, the ice rink, indoor pool and arcade are a godsend. If it's raining, you aren't trapped in a hotel at the beach, which anyone with kids knows is a recipe for infanticide. Ice skating in July is weird, but the kids love it, and have taken advantage of it. It's a unique experience, and a lot of fun. Deserts: The restaurant isn't great, but they have killer deserts. We often go out to other restaurants, then order room service deserts. OC restaurants tend to have lousy deserts. The carousel has a killer creme brûlée cheesecake and a berry thing that is amazing. Coffee and ice cream: There's a Starbucks in the middle of the hotel; they have good ice cream and make decent, inexpensive shakes. Rooms: The rooms are nicer, sizable, and generally clean. I won't talk about the beer can I found under my bed last time. We always get an ocean front room; they have ocean front rooms with a queen and a hot tub, and an ocean front with 2 queens, no hot tub. Both are very nice. Be warned, make sure you don't get a first floor ocean front room, they abut the pool, so you have to deal with screaming kids and have zero privacy. Indoor pool and hot tub: The indoor pool is quite nice, but as with most indoor pools, it has a lot of hard surfaces, and a lot of screaming kids. One blessing, they actually enforce the "no one under 18 rule in the hot tub", so you get a little bit of a break. Food: The indoor restaurant is ok, maybe 3 stars, but the outdoor food is quite tasty and reasonable. The bad: I said I wouldn't mention the beer can under the bed. Kids: The Carousel is "family friendly: I go with my family, so perfect, right? Not really. I went in April of 2012 and I would have sweared they rent to 12 year olds because I saw no parenting going on. I have a rule with my kids, enjoy yourself, but don't prevent other people from enjoying themselves. I wish other people employed the same rule. Granted, this isn't the fault of the hotel, but a little more "hey, control your a-hole kids or you'll get kicked out" would be quite welcome. Employees: As with many OC businesses, the Carousel hires a lot of foreign people. I have no problem with their employees, but I've spoken with a lot of them, and I get the impression that they aren't treated all that great. That bothers me. So overall, it's relatively clean, overrun with unsupervised kids, has nice facilities, and I'll probably stay there again. But only because the only place I suspect is better is the Hilton, and I'll be damned if I'm going to spend $400 a night to ensure that Parris Hilton doesn't have to get a job. I'm going for a week this summer, and have decided to go the condo route. More on that in a later review.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE THE CAROUSEL!!!! EXTREMELY SATISFIED!”
Reviews.Author: Jan D
Reviews.Content: My family and I have enjoyed a relaxing vacation to Ocean City, MD for the past several years. Having two small children to bring along lat summer, we decided to stay at the Carousel for several reasons. I came across this video on YouTube: ( http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kkKd1bZ-5t0 ) and knew right away this was the place for us. As the video clearly indicates, the Carousel Staff is enthusiastic, friendly, and well-spoken. Further, Each employee was more than willing to answer any questions my family had about the hotel or about the Ocean City area in general. Traveling with two children, my family desired to stay somewhere that offered activities for both adults and kids. Like most hotels in Ocean City, the Carousel has both an indoor and outdoor pool. What sets the Carousel apart from the other resorts in Ocean City, however, were the other activities the Carousel offers. There is an ice rink located in the Atrium of the Carousel. Ice skating was a fun family activity that gave us a break from the beach when we needed it and gave us something to do when the weather was bad (not to mention the boys that worked in there were really cute and funny). We were amazed at the pristine condition of ice, especially when considering how hot it was outside (it didn't melt at all!!!!). We were also fortunate to see Ice Skating Show put on by professional skaters. My kids absolutely loved getting autographs from the skaters and dancing along to the fun and bubbly songs during the show. Also, for those parents looking to get away and relax for an evening, the resort offers a program called Camp Carousel which is essentially a day camp for children. The Camp provides kids with a variety of activities (including games, arts and crafts, movies, and a front row seat to the ice skating show) as well as dinner and ice cream. The kids loved and it and my husband and I got away for some much needed alone time ;). The Carousel also hosted a Movie on the Beach which was something great for the family to do at nighttime. I would definitely suggest getting an Ocean Front Room. Our Room was on the 9th floor and was immaculate. It seemed as though the Carousel was located closer to the beach than the surrounding condos and it was great waking up every day to the beach. There were no problems with the room whatsoever and the Housekeeping staff was always very friendly and outgoing. Lastly, the Carousel's location cannot be beaten. We had never stayed so far north before and did not realize what we were missing. There are tons of great restaurants, mini golf courses, and shops in the general vicinity which are easily walkable. Northside Park is only a few blocks away. There is a lot of stuff to do there and there is a fireworks show on the 4th of July which we were able to watch from the Carousel!! While we did have to drive or take the bus to get to downtown Ocean City, it was well worth the brief trip. Traveling with a family, it was nice to not always be surrounded by those rowdy college kids! Hard to believe that was me 25 years ago!! :) We liked that it was close to the surrounding Delaware beaches too, where some of our friends were staying. I would highly recommend everyone stay at the Carousel. Having stayed at other condos such as the Hilton, the Clarion, and the Princess Royale (dont even get me started!), I can truly say that they do not compare to the Carousel. My family and I will absolutely be returning this summer and can't wait to vacation in style at the Carousel!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK room, nice location.”
Reviews.Author: goharris
Reviews.Content: First, I don't know how these places stay open off-season, so I can't throw too many stones. For these prices (Off-season) to have a room overlooking the ocean, the room doesn't have to be 4 star. The room was nice, the bathroom not so much. Staff was fantastic, pool was clean, parking good. The sports bar and separate restaurant were very good, very accommodating. Lots for young kids to do. Indoor Ice skating. Again, not the best room we've stayed in, but when you're on the beach, you don't think about your room much.

Reviews.Title: “There are better places to stay...”
Reviews.Author: DixieSherri
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with our family's visit to this hotel (stayed in hotel room not a condo). We have stayed in Ocean City many times, but this was our first (and our last) visit to the Carousel Resort. The rooms did provide a decent amount of space--we had a 2 room suite--but only one of the 3 beds were actually comfortable. The carpets were dirty - as in I did not want to take my shoes off or let kids walk barefoot. The furniture is worn, there walls and trim are in disrepair, closet doors were missing, and the walls incredibly thin. Supposedly they do not allow loud parties, but both nights we were there, parties went on until 2:30 am waking our child on several occasions. The ice skating rink is neat and the outside area looks like it would be fun in season. The indoor pool was overrun with children without supervision so we did not even attempt to use it. Most of the staff we encountered were very pleasant and helpful, with the exception of the lady who was working the gift shop who was rude and treated customers like they were there to steal instead of shop. Very disappointing--I will stay somewhere else on my next visit to OC!

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied customer”
Reviews.Author: Jada W
Reviews.Content: I was very well pleased with my overall experience at the hotel. My children really enjoyed the activities that the hotel has there like the skating rink, the indoor pool, and the activity room that was available for the family. I will definitely be returning for another stay. Great service!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kelly W
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went to this resort for a Belly Dancing conference. The staff was very courteous and friendly. The indoor pool was outstanding. The water was very clean and heated. One would not even have to go in the sauna. How fun is it to go ice skating in their indoor ice skating rink? So nice and refreshing. When we asked the staff for a fan, it was delivered right away. We did not taste the food from the resort as to we went to our favorite place at the beach--Nicks Ribs. A great place to stay and enjoy the private beach.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time!”
Reviews.Author: terri_e_55
Reviews.Content: I just came back from my first (but not last) weekend stay at the Carousel Resort. I had dropped in to look over this resort on other stays in Ocean City and had always wanted to stay here, which I did this weekend on a get-away with my son. I had a beautiful ocean front 2 bedroom condo on the 20th floor with a great view. Right out of my door on the bayside was a sitting area overlooking the bay where I watched a beautiful sunset while sipping my margarita (it 70 degrees in March!). The benefit of staying here is that I could rent the condo by the night which can't be done with other condos in OC. Although I didn't eat at the restaurant, it looked inviting with an all glass front window overlooking the ocean, palm trees and a garden. Out the back is a deck grill that looks like it would be fun in the summer. It was enjoyable watching the skaters in their ice skating rink. I would recommend this, especially for families.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: Tabitha W
Reviews.Content: Staying in one of the many condominiums available here and had a wonderful time! A group of us were there for a bacherlorette girls weekend and with the atmosphere here were able to have an amazing weekend! Have stayed here several times and would reccomend both the hotel and condominiums!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Donna J
Reviews.Content: My 12 year old son was very excited about the ice skating ring and the indoor pool. My husband and I did not like the room... It was very dated, the window to the corridor which overlooked the skating ring did not have proper curtains, we could not keep them closed all the way; the bathroom is right next to that window which was a bit uncomfortable. As guess would walk by our room they could see into the room, there were no "do not disturb" signs for the door. Maid service came just as we were showering, we told her this and asked if she could come back, that never happened. The heat/air unit was extremely loud when it would come on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time with my Family”
Reviews.Author: Scott H
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed at the Carousel last week(Feb 22nd 2012) and I have to admit we were kind of nervous after reading some negative reviews. We almost cancelled our reservation but are so glad we didnt. When we arrived we were met with a smile from the front desk staff who got us checked in earlier then the normal check in time. Our family loves to travel in the off season since the rates are so inexpensive and we loved the fact that the Carousel has an ice skating rink. When we got to our room I made sure to check the beds for bed bugs and found no trace of them. Actually, everything was very well kept, the sheets were fresh, the bathroom was clean and the beds were very comfy and the room has a flat screen tv. It was nicer than standard, and the staff really made our stay genuine. Overall we had no complaints and had a great off-season vacation. More than likely we will be back in the summer and stay with the Carousel again.

Reviews.Title: “Bed hard, building outdated, maintenence flipped cigarettes at us”
Reviews.Author: Timothy B
Reviews.Content: Visit date: May 2011. We stayed on the second floor, ocean view. The beds are extremely hard. Think they poured concrete and pulled a sheet over it. The building and decor is just way outdated. The worst part was having maintenence on the second floor sawing with power tools through the day and flicking there cigarette butts down on our balcony below. Should we choose to come back to Ocean City it will not be here. It just is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “this was seriously the worst hotel i have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: kristen c
Reviews.Content: for starters it was me and my wife's honeymoon and our first night there we had a ocean front jacuzzi deluxe king room #244 we got in the room started looking around and just like a bunch of the reviews on here said the room looked like it was out of the eighties there was exposed wires on the floor and the toilet had a poop ring around it the bathtub had some hairs in it but other than that it didn't look too bad it had a flat screen TV the bed was horrible it had no padding what so ever. next thing i am an extreme germaphobe and i like for my stuff to be clean so i ran some tub cleaner through the jacuzzi and had it filled and running for all of about 5 min. and all these pubic hairs started flying out now mind you me and my wife had not entered the tub yet also a bunch of dirt and other debris so at this point i called the front desk and she told me that there housekeeping had been sent home at 3 pm in the afternoon so she was sending a security guard up to have a look at this point me and my wife left for the evening six hours later we came back and the first thing i did was turn on the tub and start filling it and to my surprise when it was filled and i turned the jets on the same stuff started coming out so once again i called the front desk and by the the person was being very rude and i ended up having to move two rooms down to room 246 and i did the same with this jacuzzi and the exact same thing happened so furious i called back down well the front desk sent up the security guards which were all very nice and very appalled at how the tub in our first room looked and when i drained the tub and then refilled it for the security guards so that they could witness what i had three times they were disgusted so we stayed the night in that room the next morning i spoke with a manager who was no help at all and after arguing with her for 10 min i demanded the general managers number so i called him and told him in the nicest way what had happened so obviously he wasn't very happy with his staff because he completely refunded my first nights stay well that day me and my wife left and came back that evening i did the same with the tub and finally it was OK so we went down to go ice skating at their rink of which i would not recommend we were skating on it and about 5 min in me and my wife went to get a snack and decide if we wanted to continue skating because there were holes in the ice 2 inches deep and 5 inches long and at the same time i heard the sound of someone hitting the ice so hard because of the holes that 35 feet away at the snack machines we heard his head hit the ice upon this i went in and ask the attendant if he would clean and scrape the ice he responded with no I'm not doing anything its 2 hours till we close I'm not worried about it after me explaining to him what happened so if you are considering staying at this hotel i strongly recommend that you take into consideration my review and the rest of the bad reviews on this page because i gaurentee on my life that the are true this is positively the worst hotel ever!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: Damon E
Reviews.Content: stayed 11/24/2011 & 11/25/2011 worst thanksgiving ever got bed bugs and kids missed week of school

Reviews.Title: “A good time”
Reviews.Author: arutkove
Reviews.Content: Not a fan of ocean city, but this hotel is a good place for sure during the winter, when the pool & ice skating are the attraction! The rooms are decent and the price couldn't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place to go”
Reviews.Author: Bea1234567
Reviews.Content: Although my family stayed a couple years ago, I'm not sure it has changed. The rooms are ok, but some of them are by a stinky dumpster, and NO ONE wants to smell that! The "restaurants" are probably better suited for a mall down in frederick. Although the prices might be good and it's right on the beach, it's not a place you would want to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “40 YEARS AND COUNTING”
Reviews.Author: marc s
Reviews.Content: I have going to the Carousel 40 years (except for a few years before the current mangement took over). Once they took the helm they put the ship on the right tack. Slowly but surely they have improved the hotel with large flat screen tv,new granit vanities in both the bathrooms and the kitchenetts . They have put in place a great staff from the front desk,house keeping,maintance,food service and all that you don't see . The impossible just takes a little longer for this staff . The reason I am giving this reveiw is that I see the one dot reviews . They do not realize that the condos are privately owned and maintained or the come when all of O.C. is extreamly busy . If the went any where in O.C. the would wait on line,wait for a table,wait for food which may not be perfect. If I live 10 more years I'll bring my great grand kids. They will ride the elevator pushing all the buttons and I'll get a call from Patrick or Glenn that security has them in tow . (yes the hotel has great security) . They will be scared I'll punish them for 5 minutes and then off to the pool,ice skating,snack bistro,play ground or beach . The Carousel is about fun at a affordable price .

Reviews.Title: “Carousel, your one stop shop for a wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: Nancy B
Reviews.Content: I love staying at the Carousel in Ocean CIty. It is my hotel of choice when I visit the Ocean. My sister lives in OC so I visit several times a year. Everyone at the hotel is so friendly and helpful. The place itself is clean, appealing and has activities for all ages. There is so much to do at the hotel, you don't even need to leave. My husband loves the fitness center and I love the indoor pool. My sister visits us at the hotel and we sit around watching the people skate around the indoor rink as we chat. The rooms are comfortable and I love the coffee maker in the room. I love to go out on the balcony with a cup of coffee and I don't even have to leave to get the coffee. I highly recommend the Carousel Resort hotel. If you have kids, there is plenty to keep them busy without going out and spending more money!

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve at the Carousel...”
Reviews.Author: genedig65
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 plus my Mom and Dad enjoyed ourselves at the Carousel for New Year's Eve 2011-2012. We were somewhat concerned after reading some of the reviews but found none of the issues that other reviewers had remarked upon. Our check in was simple and easy and were given the keys to room 448. My parents had room 446. Our room was clean and functional. WiFi worked without issue on our laptops,Kindle Fire and Ipod Touch, TV was a flat screen type. Our room had a kitchen sink, a coffee maker, a microwave and a minifridge. An ironing board and iron were included in a decent sized closet in the room. The sofa could be converted into a bed if necessary and a hair dryer was available in the bathroom. We had a nice view of the beach and also a nice view of the atrium. A quick inspection of the beds and linens showed no bed bug issues. Management brought up extra pillows at our request. The linens smelled clean with a faint trace of chlorine, which to me is a reassuring scent. The beds and linens, while not the highest quality, were comfortable. Furniture exhibited minor wear and tear, typical for Ocean City as this town sees heavy tourism every year. Ocean City is slowly becoming a year round destination too. Over the New Year's weekend, the Boardwalk was surprisingly busy! New Year's was pretty fun and definitely intended for families. The Carousel's reputation as a swinging playground ended decades ago. The property was crawling with kids! If you don't like the sounds of children enjoying themselves,don't stay here. You'll be disappointed. We were treated to a great figure skating show. Young teens and kids from the area were the stars and they really gave it their all. One of the banquet rooms was set up with Legos, board games, and sketchpads. My own children (14 and 17) enjoyed ice skating and swimming in the pool. The rink and pool were well maintained. The ice cream parlor next to the rink serves baked goods, hot pretzels, soft drinks,and of course ice creams. We ordered 4 milkshakes made right on the spot and thought they were reasonably priced. The New Year's buffet was quite tasty, which was surprising as our breakfast served to us the morning before was somewhat disappointing. The buffet, while not cheap, consisted of blue crab claws, steamed shrimp, crab soup, king crab, grilled vegetables, potatoes, jerk chicken and prime rib. All you could eat of course. The staff made sure that the serving table was never empty. I recommend making reservations beforehand as there was a line waiting for available tables. All in all, we really enjoyed our stay. All of us decided that New Year's at the Carousel will be a new family tradition.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: VacaysRock
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carousel again from Tuesday Nov 22, 2011 to Monday Nov 28, 2011 although we had planned & did check out very late Sunday night instead of staying until Mon morning since the hubby had to be back at work Mon morning. We had the same room as our first stay 444 & again found the room to be clean. I have to say the reviews here did scare me before we left & I almost switched hotels, in the end i'm very glad I didn't. I noticed they upgraded the TV in the room to a flat screen LCD since our last stay, I'd say its about a 35" or around that size very nice improvement. We enjoyed the indoor pool & hot tub, also a quick visit to the sauna. Had cotton candy & drinks from the stand set up in the atrium. Beautiful view from the ocean front room, it was hard to leave. We ate breakfast all but one morning in the Seasons restaurant at the hotel, it has a nice view & good food, one morning we had the breakfast buffet it was good also. We had no problems with our stay check in was fast and friendly as was check out, they even asked if every thing was ok since we were leaving early the night before check out which it thought was considerate. Enjoyed watching the many children and adults on the ice skating rink on the way in & out in the evenings. I checked hard for any bugs or stains on the mattress as I do at all hotels & found no evidence of anything which was a great relief. It was a little warm in the room since the air conditioning wasn't running in late November so we requested a fan & one was brought right away with no problem, we slept with the balcony door open & could hear the ocean all night, it was wonderful. There is a screen on the balcony door so you don't have to worry about anything coming in to the room. We got lucky with beautiful weather of upper 60's & sunny & hope to return to this hotel again next November for Thanksgiving.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbug”
Reviews.Author: Patricia L
Reviews.Content: I had a terrible visit at the Carousel Hotel. I checked in on 11/11/11 woke up the next morning to blood on sheets and bedbug crawling in bed. Bug crawling in the ceiling. Ths was a bus trip. I did not picked the hotel. Management would not provide refund and refuse to provide any type of assistance in resolving my issue. I would not recommend this hotel. Customer service was poor and the room was dirty, mattress were stained with God knows what.

Reviews.Title: “The start of my honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Mairead w
Reviews.Content: I was recently married and my husband had raved about this hotel. The sad thing is when we booked in we were very disappointed as all the amenities that they claim to have were not available. The web site said nothing about the restaurants were not going to be open in the off season, we were unable to use the ice rink due to it being melted for an upcoming event, again nothing was stated on there web site that it was unavailable for use. We found out the next day that the Jacuzzi didn't work. When we complained to the front desk all they said was that they couldn't do any adjusting to the bill as we did not inform them the night before so they could send a maintenance person to the room. The sad thing was we didn't know until the next morning when it was used!!!!!!!!!!! Ask to speak to the manager on duty and was informed that she was in a meeting with the general manager so I left a message on her voice mail to no avail as it was NEVER returned. We checked out and went to the Holiday Inn which was suggested to us where all the amenities were available and FINALLY able to start out honeymoon properly.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, spectacular views”
Reviews.Author: Samantha Y
Reviews.Content: We held a retreat for 250 women at the Carousel in October. The staff were truly wonderful to work with and accommodating. They were quick to meet our every need and request. The hotel was clean and the food delicious and plentiful. The ice rink was really pleasant. One evening a student with skating expertise was ice dancing. The next evening, the rink drew happy kids and families. We rented a two bedroom condo which was perfect for a registration area and additional break-out meeting space. The oceanfront guest rooms have a large balcony affording great views of the ocean. The entire experience, from the months of planning to our weekend event, was positive. Thanks especially to managers Helen and Kim who were so helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer S
Reviews.Content: We had a women's ministry retreat and did not run into a single problem with the hotel. All of the staff, from the maids, waiters, front desk, security, to the managers were friendly and ready to help in any way that they could. Helen and Kim from sales made sure every little detail was right and were such a pleasure to work with. From the time we started scouting hotels for our retreat we were treated better here than at the other hotels we were looking at. They accommodated our special dietary needs with wonderful vegetarian meals including vegan meats, provided Spanish liaisons for our Spanish speaking women, changed the skating music station to fit the religious atmosphere for our retreat. We had a successful retreat, but only with the help of a wonderful hotel. I can not say enough good about the Carousel, and have recommended it to another department for a different retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Turned off the AC in October”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel to do the Seagull Century with my sister and a friend. The night after the ride, the air conditioning stopped working and the room got very warm..over 80 degrees. When we complained, they brought up a fan and said that was the best they could do at this time as the system was in neutral. They didn't say they weren't going to fix it so we assumed it would be fixed. We stayed our third night and it was still over 80 with the balcony door open. When we checked out and complained they said they shut the system down every year at this time. When I asked why they didn't tell you that when you checked in or booked, the clerk just shrugged and said "sorry". No compensation was offered at that point or later when I filed a formal complaint. Don't stay here if you want comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Makes You Feel Like a Kid Again!”
Reviews.Author: LoMohr
Reviews.Content: The Carousel is right on the beach and has an ice skating rink in the center of the hotel! It's incredible that you can go from wearing your bikini getting a tan one minute and then walk inside and put on some ice skates. It's very fun! The rooms are also nice and decently priced.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware! 5th & 6th Floors are NOT "Ocean Front"”
Reviews.Author: Jason7213
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a holiday weekend getaway at the Carousel. The staff was courteous and helpful, and the facilities were solid....Just don't expect too much in the form of ice skating as the rink is small and does not meet the Zamboni nearly enough. ( - )Please be advised that almost all of the 5th and 6th Floor "Oceanside" rooms do NOT have a visual on the ocean's waves, rather a view of the ice rink's roof. From my very spacious 6th floor balcony, I was extremely disappointed when the waves could only be scene by looking way down the beach, around the 4 story-high roof. That being said, I was able to still hear the ocean and see the ocean a ways beyond the breakers. I was also able to see Dolphins swimming by...but it just wasn't the same. ( + )The hotel is very convienently located accross the street from a grocery store, sports bar, and beer store. ( + ) Very family friendly atmosphere. ( - ) I was not impressed at all by the one dinner we ate at the Seasons Restuarant in the lobby. Putting 6 shrimp on top of speggetti noodles and pouring white sauce on it for $15 is a stretch, and there wasn't much taste. All and all, this is a solid choice for a hotel due to the ocean access, convienence to local shops, and the gym and pool indoors. Just stay away from those 5th and 6th floors!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 1 night for his high school reunion. We had a street view room with 2 queen sized beds. When calling for a reservation we were told there was a 2 night minimum, but after booking online we reserved for only 1 night. The room was reasonably priced and clean. We saw one review of bedbugs, but after a careful inspection on both beds, the room was bug free. The beds were comfortable and so were the pillows. There was a small patio, but the weather was too chilly to enjoy it. The front desk staff were all very nice and the location couldn't be beat. It was a little noisy at night with the traffic, but we expected that. The only problem we encountered was being double billed at the restaurant. We are in process of getting that fixed. Parking is limitied too in their lot, but they also had a garage.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Reunion Hotel”
Reviews.Author: henry s
Reviews.Content: We just held a 28-person family reunion at the Carousel and it was a total success. We had one, large two-bedroom ocean front condo suite as our "headquarters" room, and ten additional oceanfront rooms. All of the rooms were excellent, the pricing was extremely reasonable, and the staff courteous and helpful. The combination of amenities was extremely popular with our group (with the indoor pool and indoor ice skating being particular highlights).

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: gypsy1684
Reviews.Content: Although it seemed expensive to us ( it is off-season) and it was bike week ( a surprise to us!) we were able to get a 4th floor oceanfront room. The view was great, the balcony was great, the room itself seemed clean, but ordinary. The bathroom was small, but fine. The hot water in the bathroom sink was dangerously hot; it was easy to burn yourself! The beds were terrible , hard and they were encased in vinyl--bedbugs? as were the pillows.The location in the building , and geographically, was perfect. Parking was easy, the front desk staff seemed to do a great job, even though there was a line; Patrick was nice! Otherwise can't comment on service; we did not ask for anything.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for an older hotel”
Reviews.Author: melissag11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an ocean front room with a balcony, that was very nice being able to sit out there and watch the ocean, beach and sunrise. The room was large, beds were comfy, just the bathroom was on the small side. We ate breakfast in Seasons 2 mornings, it was good. We had drinks and munchies in Bamboo one day, they were all good. We visited the hot tub and indoor pool both nights as well. The hot tub could use some sprucing up, but overall the area was nice and jot over crowded. We didn't have any children with us, but I think my son would have enjoyed the things for kids they had going on. Oh yeah, we had ice-cream and coffee in the Atrium, very good!

Reviews.Title: “Theives”
Reviews.Author: Salome L
Reviews.Content: I stayed over the Labor day weekend at this hotel only for one night as they were sold out the next day, so we just re-located to a hotel next door. I happened to forget 2 dresses and a jacket in the room and went back to retrieve them the same afternoon. The housekeeper only returned one dress stating that this was the only item she had found (and she was the first person to enter the room after we had left). The front desk was quite taken aback by my appearance as they thought I had already left the resort and would never come back for my items. The worst thing was that the management just covered for their thief employees and did not bother to do anything about it. This hotel is not worth going back to. A huge disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go during bike week September 15”
Reviews.Author: RAWBaltimore_MD
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel that gives you an idea of what a luxury hotel was like in the 1960s, then this is your place. The room we had was large, but it looked like they had taken out a lot of furniture. There have been complaints of bed-bugs in this hotel, but we did not see any. The mattress was comfortable and seemed to be new. My main complaint was due to the time of year. We had a "Bayside" room which really means a room that looks over the main highway. Because it was motorcycle week with the advent of thousands of Harleys, the thin-walled room was inundated with thunderous roars of motocycles all night long. We had to sign a "no party" agreement when we signed in stating that we would not have a party in the room. Since my wife and I are in our 60s, we actually felt somewhat flattered by the contract, much the same as being carded in a bar. However, the contract did not apparently extend to the parking lot since we were awakened at 3AM with a group of loud party-makers with motorcycles in the parking lot just outside our window. We ate at the Season's restaurant which was pretty good and reasonably priced. Across Ocean Highway is a gem of a restaurant - Jules - which has a 5-6PM fixed-price menu which is one of the best dining venues in OC. The Greene Turtle across the street is a good place for a cold beer. Would I go back? No.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Extremely Poor”
Reviews.Author: tootallsrs
Reviews.Content: I just this week stayed at this hotel for a convention. Let me start off by saying while things were fine during my stay, the customer service was the worse that I ever experienced at a hotel in all the year's I've traveled. First off, my room was booked 2 months in advance with no problems. Got a receipt and the down payment was charged to my credit card. 3 weeks before the conference I get a call from the hotel with my voicemail stating my credit card had disputed the charge and they promptly, without speaking to me directly, cancelled my reservation. I quickly had to call them back and rebook to a downsized room for the same price. When I spoke to the manager, he was very rude and made it seem as though "I" did something wrong. I asked for him to have all the documentation of this "disputed charge" available when I checked in. When I did check in, the lady I spoke to was very rude and seemed as though she didn't want to deal with me at all. I asked for the documents, which were not there, and to speak to a manager, in which she responded "you'll have to wait till tomorrow to speak to the manager". I was never provided any documents and no one would help me in regards to any of this my whole stay. Horrible Experience!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice family getaway”
Reviews.Author: redrider1115
Reviews.Content: Great family vacation! Arrived right after hurricane Irene went through ocean city. Luckily the area wasn't hit too bad. We got there early in the day so our room wasn't ready, so we spent a couple hours enjoying the beach. Our room was nice and clean, nice kitchen area and had a great view of the bay. We never ate at the inside restaurant, but enjoyed the outside bar and grill. Prices were not too bad. My kids loved the bounce house and the playground pirate ship. We never used the ice skating ring but it was a nice addition. Overall my family had a great time. The Carousel is in a great location, right on the beach and away from some of the busy areas. About a 10 to 15 minute drive to the boardwalk. They are not the newest or the greatest in the ocean city, but for the price you cant beat it. We are already planning on going back next year. Thanks for a great time Carousel.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: m3334043
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there. My family awoke with bed bug infestation in room (several beds). Had to leave belongings and check into another hotel. Hotel not responding to settle on belongings I had to leave. Very bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “OK place...been to better, been to worse”
Reviews.Author: caliboo
Reviews.Content: As others say, this place is very dated. Our room was clean,but we did find a set of keys next to the wall, leading us to believe housekeeping was not very thorough, yet we didn't find anything to be dirty. The tub didn't hold water when we got there, but they did come to fix it quickly. No water pressure in the shower, it was difficult to wash the sand off. The food in the sit down restaurant was awful, yet the food outside at the bar was wonderful. They also had a big BBQ every day we were there, and was delicious. They roasted a whole pig one day BBQ chicken, ribs, burgers, with all the sides from a picnic, potato salad, corn on the cob, corn muffins, everything was delicious. Right on the beach, but far from the action on the boardwalk. Nice and quiet though. The skating rink is a nice touch, but it was melting while we were there, a big portion of it was water. An employee told us it was due to the humidity, but it really wasn't that humid out. Another guest told us that they were told the machine to keep it cold was not working and they could not get the company to come and fix it. The elevator moved very, very slowly, and was quite congested at times. They had a nice area with ice cream and popcorn, with several kiddie rides. They demand your driver's license if you want to use a luggage cart, and the woman was NOT nice about it at all! She said too many people leave the carts outside their rooms rather than returning them, and they didn't have the staff to constantly retrieve them. But she had quite the attitude about it. All in all, not bad, not great. This place could be so much more, but it's old and tired and no one seems to care about it anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Great people , great services”
Reviews.Author: Fardella
Reviews.Content: Great family place always something fun going on!!! Indoor ice skating !! Awesome!!

Reviews.Title: “Like a cruise ship on land”
Reviews.Author: DavidVelvet
Reviews.Content: Had a bad experience at a hotel up the street from them, but they saved my trip. Had a room available at 2:00 am and the staff working the desk was just a pleasant as they would have been at 2:00 pm. The room itself was showing its age a little bit, but it was still very clean. If you want to go to a hotel that you do not have to leave if you do not want to, than this is it. Between the beach out front, the pool with the grassy area to lay out in, the pool grill and tiki bar, restaurant, ice rink with snack shop we never had to leave on a labor day weekend, kind of being at sea without leaving land! Will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice location, loads of kid activities.”
Reviews.Author: Moneyfool
Reviews.Content: Pros: Hotel is in great location. Few minutes to boardwalk. Dunkin donuts and Food lion are right opposite to the hotel. Check in and check out is a breeze. Ice staking ring is a bonus for kids. Staff is friendly and rooms are nice and comfortable also very spacious. Cons: Hotel is aged. Bathrooms are small but did not mind that. Tends to be noisy with ice staking rink outside the room and restaurant below the room balcony. So aviod rooms which have this issue. Indoor pool tends to get crowded. Outdoor pool is okay nothing great. Kids pool is a round pool nothing great again. Beach right outside tends to be very very crowded. You would need to move away to get good spots. Parking is an issue if you are back at night. If is alright for the money you pay. Kids loved it and would definitely consider it again for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bug Alert”
Reviews.Author: marilyn t
Reviews.Content: We had our family reunion in August of this year. Upon our initial check in we did notice the hotel was having a shipment of new mattresses but never put two and two together. After waiting for about 30 minutes for an elevator as they only have two elevators servicing the entire facility, we managed to make it to our condo (rm 1911) which we were less than impressed with. The condo accomodated about 8 people, my cousin unfortunately selected the room which contained the bed bugs. On her second night stay, she really started complaining of how she felt something biting her and how she was unable to get a good night sleep. Upon examination of the room particularly the mattress, we found it to be infested with bed bugs. We immediately called management to report the incident. The manager on call (Pat) was the middleman and first attempted to get us accomodations at a Townhouse to include linen service, not far from the Carousel but directly on the beach, however; they weren't going to assume any additional costs over what we had already paid for the week. The townhouse costs an additional $2000.00, we had already paid an estimated $4,500.00 for the rental of the Condo. The general manager refused to speak with us as he was communicating directly through his manager. We had to threatened to sue for the stress incurred as a result of this short stay. We had small children with highly sensitive allergies and who are asthmatic. With all of our clothes and luggage, we didn't want to take the chance of bring their bedbug problem back to our place of residence. We did advise that we would tell the rest of our family, as we were there for a family reunion and wanted them to be aware as well to prevent them taking critters home. We told them to expect a bill for the cleaning service that we would have to incurr as a result of their bedbug problem. We did ask why didn't their housekeeping didn't do a more thorough job with cleaning. In brief, they refunded us our entire deposit, gave us three different rooms for free. We weren't ecstatic with the new accomodation but it was a start in the right direction, after a 4 hour trip with small children. In conclusion, the customer service sucked, we didn't have to appreciate having to threaten the managment to see results. We encased all of our luggage in plastic and upon our initial return home, we stopped at our family laundromat to rewash and dry everything to prevent an outbreak in our own homes. Take heed, stay away from this place.....

Reviews.Title: “Good amenities for family, but it is run down and filthy unfortunately.”
Reviews.Author: karabellaj
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a condo that was literally filthy when we checked in. The unit was run down: holes in the walls, old stove, old cabinets, rickety bedframes, etc. The kitchen was filthy as were the mattresses. They re-cleaned the kitchen and replaced the mattress upon request, but the bottoms of our feet were black from walking around. The sofa sleeper was dumpster quality and unusable. Dust, dirt, unvacuumed and uncomfortable all the way around. The A/C unit was loud and outdated. The rest of the hotel public areas were okay but old. Several other guests also loudly complained at the desk about their filthy rooms. Avoid. Horrible way to spend your vacation money. :-(

Reviews.Title: “RECCOMMEND”
Reviews.Author: MIssAmber212
Reviews.Content: Last summer in July2010 we stayed in a condo and it was AWESOME. -recommend if possible for your family. This summer we were unable to stay a full week for vacation (first time in a long time) so we had to stay in a hotel room ( i hate staying in hotels, and i even work in a really clean one at home) After reading a lot of reviews I was hesitant about staying in a hotel here at the Carousel. BUT i was not cancelling. When we arrived i was INCREDIBLY HAPPY! VERY spacious and GREAT ocean view! The beds were not the best, I didnt sleep too good when I was there, but heck sleep on the beach, its vacation! It was very clean and the little kitchenette area when you walk in is GREAT!! Little bathroom space but its okay!! I was so very happy and if the price wasnt so high we were going to stay a extra night. The staff was pleasent for the most part, no complaints there :) I did NOT eat at the restarunt due to what I heard about it (bad) my dad and other family ate lunch there and they liked it, but when went back for dinner (against my advice not to) and they did not like it at all. So maybe hit or miss but there are so many other good places there, I would go out. They only wentthere due to the rain! Outdoor bar is great! BEST orange crushes EVER! Thank you to everyone there for helping make my short vacation (which i was sad about, i missed not being at the beach for a week) and my family and friends vacation an awesome time! I love the atmoshphere of the hotel and the ice show was cute. Just a cute cozy place. Sad to have left :( sad to think about ( since im at work now haha) I reccommend the hotel and condos highly! Thank you again and hope to see you next summer in the condos!!

Reviews.Title: “very family orientated!”
Reviews.Author: breakgben
Reviews.Content: LOTS to do here....fun activites for the kids. Movies on the beach, ice skating rink (which we didn't use), 2 pools....only complaint about allt he activities, the signage is a lil vague, took me a min to find beach access, lol. My only complaint I have is since staying in a "private owned condo" not owned by me....you don't get any of the advantages of the dining discounts, which was not told to us while booking or even sitting to eat. But overall would stay there again. Lovely place, lots to do, good location....love Green Turtle which is right across the street, as well as a Food Lion for groceries. Think you family will enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, good for kids, too expensive”
Reviews.Author: rockville123
Reviews.Content: Good things: I liked the location. The Carousel is good for families -- its on the ocean, has a pool, etc. And my kids go to bed pretty early and it was very quiet there by 10pm we had no partying/noise. With 5 of us we need the larger size room, the room size was perfect - we had 2 queens and a sofabed and plenty of space (but the bathroom was very very small). The kids loved the pirate ship playground and it was nice to have a place to buy lunch outside (average food). Generally the staff were helpful and pleasant. Bad things: Overall Ocean City MD is not a luxurious city, a lot of places are dated looking and rundown. But I agree with other posters, the rooms at the Carousel are visibly dated, cheap furnishing, cheap bedding. And the bathroom was really tiny, barely one person at a time could fit in there. The atrium area could use a facelift. Our ocean front room overlooked a dirty rooftop and the patio furniture was cheap and filthy. For $400 a night plus taxes, it was disappointing. The whole place (atrium, stairwells and indoor pool had very poor lighting which gave it a dirty look.) The outdoor and indoor pools, a great draw for kids, were scuzzy looking, they need painting and new tiles. We'd been promised that we could use the facilities all day on the day of checkout, which was nice, but after going to the beach we went to the locker rooms to shower and change -- they have no soap or shampoo, no towels. I had to bring all of my own stuff, which again, for a $400 a night "resort" is sort of skimpy. While we were there, the elevator was broken for part of the time, the ice rink was closed one day due to some problem, the lights were all out in the men's locker room due to some electric problem, the atrium cafe ran out of coffee early on Sunday morning and people were standing around waiting for them to make more...they seem not to be able to handle the amount of traffic they get. I probably would not stay there again. We tried to be tolerant since this was one of the busiest weekends of the summer, but you'd think they'd have their act together.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Freddientj
Reviews.Content: The rooms are visibly dated with rust on the vent covers and unattractive bedding. The hotel lobby could use a facelift as well. Our ocean front room overlooked the rusty, gull covered roof. For the price, $430 a night plus taxes, it was pretty disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this place!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ScoobyDoobyDoobyDoo
Reviews.Content: All I had was issues one after the other with this place and it eneded very badly for us. When I booked the hotel, the room description showed us two queen beds, a sofabed and a kitchenette. We got there and were told there was no sofabed in our room and there was a small kitchenette nothing like the one shown online. We enered the room and it was freezing so my husband urned on low heat to warm the room, The entire place started smelling of oil and the fire alarm went off. Maintenenace came in and assured us everthing was ok. Next we tried to turn the lamp on and it was not plugged in. My husband laid on the carpet to find the outlets and was unable to so maintenance came in again and found the oulets in some obscure place. Next morning we left the room at 9 am and returned at 3pm. Our room was not cleaned so I had to call housekeeping who made us stay out for half hour in the lobby until they cleaned the room. Next morning they knocked at our door at 8:30am when we were fast asleep to clean our room. Never experienced anything like this. To top it all, the last evening we returned back to the hotel and found our room open and latched with the dead bolt left slightly open. My husbands cell phone, his 3DS and his I touch were all missing. Security was called and they checked the lock to tell us someone last enetered at 1:45PM and the room was not enetered after that. We filed a police report for the missing items but we will obviously never find them. Please stay away from this place as fas as possible!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Despite the high cost, it was o.k. and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Deb_ClarksvilleMD
Reviews.Content: This particular weekend of August 4 is very popular, as this is close to last weekend before kids go back to school and sports tryouts. So...because I was desperate to get away with kids before school and crazy work schedule. $400 per night fee was crazy...but the hotel was convenient to the beach, had ocean front bar/restaurant, included kitchenette, and fit our family of six comfortably. It's not spotless and room is old decor. But, it worked for us.

Reviews.Title: “STAFF RUDE AND UNPLEASANT”
Reviews.Author: PAM R
Reviews.Content: This past weekend we visited your hotel. It was a MOMS GET AWAY WEEKEND. 10 of us stayed there for 2 nights. I was extremely disappointed in the customer service. The front desk clerk and manager were rude, didn’t smile and were so not welcoming. We had an issue during check in and there they didn’t take the time to explain to us the problem and/or work it out with us. No one seemed to go out of their way to make our stay comfortable or enjoyable. The staff is NOT friendly.. The ONLY Staff members that smile or say hi or have a nice day were the BELL BOYS... They were great! I am one of the 10 moms that stayed there and I wouldn’t recommend the hotel to family or friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great! Going back in 2 weeks!”
Reviews.Author: happytravels9911
Reviews.Content: Wanted a weekend getaway with my boyfriend away from the city but not too far as to where we needed to fly. Finally settled on Ocean City but we weren't sure where to stay. We weren't really familiar with the layout and just wanted to be close to the beach and Seacrets. Boyfriend stumbled upon Carousel. I did my research on the reviews of the Hotel and we were not satisfied. The reviews were pretty bad and I happen to really trust Tripadvisor. I never write reviews but felt I needed to write about our experience and contradict some of these low ratings. We arrived Friday night 7/29 and the room was clean and big. We didn't get and ocean view, as it was more expensive, and settled for a standard room. To our surprise it faced the parking lot but it was the most beautiful view of the sunset. We had a balcony and enjoyed the view Saturday night. As soon as we walked in we checked everything to make sure nothing was broken. As it turns out the refrigerator was so I called the front desk immediately so we wouldn't be blamed for it later. Within 5 minutes the repair men were at our door and within 2 minutes after that they brought in a new fridge. Friendliest staff ever. I'll stop rambling and get to all the good stuff. That night walked across the street to the bar which had a DJ and bar and dancing. Just what we're into and just across the street! Next day went to the beach which is right outside the hotel. The hotel provides you with your own chairs as well. Once done with the beach walked back to the hotel's outside tiki bar and restaurant. Food was delicious, drinks were strong, and the live band was awesome. Our waiter was soooooo nice I over tipped him. Once drink in hand headed over to their outside pool and lounged...serenity! Went back to the room and it was spotless. Got dressed and made our way to the crab bag, a few blocks down. All you can eat crabs - AMAZING! Again, more friendly waiters. We then made our way to Seacrets and had a blast there. It's more of a 21-30 crowd and very loud with live bands and DJ's. We found a cab that gave us his number and was there to pick us up within 10 minutes of calling him. All in all everywhere we went was close and convenient. My best experience at the hotel definitely had to be when we left on Sunday. Check out was at 11 so the BF went downstairs to check out as I did last minute packing. He specifically said don't forget anything. As hungover and tired as I was, I forget my Iphone. I make it to the lobby and realize that I forgot it. I rushed back to the room to find that the phone was no longer there, charging in the outlet. This was literally 10 minutes after we left the room. I turn to the cleaning lady and said she hadn't seen anything. I was about to start going NUTS until I see the inspector of the rooms walking down the hall with my Iphone and charger in a little baggy with our information on a piece of paper. I was sure I had lost my phone for good but the honest staff at the Carousel Hotel did not let that happen. It was an amazing time and we're planning to go back in 2 weeks for another weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “The single greatest rip off in 30 years of international travel”
Reviews.Author: globalyoda
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel a lot. Between the two of us, we have probably been to close to 100 countries. Not surprisingly, we have seen a lot of hotels in that time. Therefore, it is pretty remarkable when a property comes out on top - or bottom - of any of our possible lists. Congratulations Carousel Resort Hotel! You just topped our list of biggest rip off. With taxes, we ended up paying about $320 a night for an experience that felt part like being in a refugee camp and part like the surreal hotel experience in the movie Barton Fink. Yes, we know that trying to book less than a month in advance on the Eastern Shore of Maryland is going to be expensive, but never, never, never have we gotten so little for a room that cost even $100 less per night than what we were paying. Let's start with the kitschy and surreal first. The Carousel has a run down ice rink in the atrium of the hotel. Apparently the compressor was malfunctioning, so no guests could use the rink, but they were treated to a show called "The Next Ice Age" with 12 year-old's skating around in some bizarre interpretation of what the next ice age might be if it were an incoherent offering in a $300 rip-off hotel. In addition to coming in first on the rip-off chart, this act almost gets the Carousel the first place award for most astonishing kitsch ever seen in an establishment. As for the cheap, the hotel might also get another dubious first for worst elevator situation. At $300 a night, it appears a lot of families try not to starve on vacation by piling 12 people to a room, hence my impressions of a refugee camp. Yet this enormous high-rise (It must be 25 stories) has only four elevators - two for the lower floors, and two for the upper. To make matters worse, most guests seem to buy a week's worth of groceries at the Food Lion across the street and then use luggage carts to transport the food to their rooms. The result? Lines of up to 20 people stretching into the lobby waiting for elevators! This I have never seen except in an apartment block in a country I will not name (so as not to insult it in a review of the Carousel) that had been transformed into... yes... you guess it, a refugee camp. The room was clean, but ugly and a bit worn. Even if I was paying $200 a night, I might not complain (since it would not be worth the effort), but at $320, I have to say something. The lobby looks like a truck stop. The water in the indoor pool was murky. And the room seemed to have a spider infestation. So you get all of that for $320. Need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Manilowm
Reviews.Content: The place really disappointed me. I was looking forward to a nice week with the family and instead it was nothing but heartaches. The first day after checking in and filling the fridge with all of our food, we noticed the bottom portion of the fridge was not making our food food cold. We called maintenance numerous times only for them to keep telling us to wait a few hours. It will get cold. After waiting an entire day the fridge still did not get our food cold. Again calling maintenance again he told us to wait another hour. We called the manager and insisted they replace the fridge. Which they did. When the fridge was removed it gave a reading of 47 degrees. Unbelievable. Then we made a lovely dinner the next evening and filled the dishwasher up with dirty dishes only for the dishwasher to pour out all this water from bottom. We had to wait the entire day for someone from outside the facility to fix. No one in the hotel knew how to fix a dishwasher then the dryer in which is in the room, doesn't dry your clothes unless you have it in for 3 hours. Another call to maintenance. I can't go on but there is more. Besides the beds bellowed in the center, the exhaust fans to not work in the bathrooms......I do not recommend this place at all or at least room 1104

Reviews.Title: “A bit dated, but great for kids/families”
Reviews.Author: kelcarib
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in 2 rooms for 2 couples and 3 kids. Staff was welcoming, but beware it is very crowded at check in/out but what do you expect, avoid those times if you are impatient. Our kids loved this place from the skating rink to the beach front location with bouncy tent and the ice cream station. The rooms were adequate and very spacious, frig was a plus with kids for sure. Nothing fancy, nothing glamorous, but is was value for what we got. Would we stay here as a childless couple, no, but again with kids, absolutely yes! One big negative, the outdoor dining area has the slowest, least motivated servers in the world, they really do seem to disappear for lengths of time, though never were they rude. The food is awful. Go elsewhere for anything but cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: melli05
Reviews.Content: First off, I must say that I am not a big fan of Ocean City MD beaches. Too crowded!!! I do however love the Carousel. We stayed in a 2 bedroom condo and it was like being at home. Dishwasher with detergent, washer with a box of detergent, dryer, master bath (which was beautiful) and two AMAZING balconies. One faced the bayside it was awesome to sit out there and watch the sunset over the bay. The second balcony was the oceanside. You could watch the sunrise out there. Amazing views on both sides. We were on the 15th floor. There are 22 floors. The first 14 are regular rooms and suites the rest are condos. The prices were great. I received a postcard in the mail that said if I called and booked by March 30 the rates were 1/2 price...Great deal!!! The place is really family oriented. There is a giant iceskating rink in the middle of the place. A coffee/ice cream/ candy stand inside as well as a bar and a restaurant. There is also an outside bar/restaurant that had great food. 1 regular pool and 1 kiddie pool outside then 1 indoor pool and sauna whirlpool inside. Staff was very accomodating Free crib rentals Free parking Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gman457
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying here and I can say I truly enjoyed it. Although not the newest hotel many upgrades have been done. Everyone with the staff was very helpful, friendly and easy to deal with. Our room was clean, upgraded, and had good a/c. I was impressed with the indoor pool area which had been updated with some nice stone work. Ive stayed here 3 times and I have always left happy. The new elevators are nice, modern and fast. They sometimes close a little too fast though. The beach acess is also nice to have. What I like about this place is that they are very organized and have all bases covered, from the hoses to wash sand off from the beach to non slip mats in the indoor pool area, it is all thought out. I did enjoy this stay and Im surprised at the other reviews because it seemed all the other families seemed very happy.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: mrp483
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a condo at this hotel for the last 2 years. They are very well maintained and comfy to stay in. We will keep going back here every year. If you encounter a problem the front desk staff will bend over backward to make sure you are happy. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort”
Reviews.Author: kkline82
Reviews.Content: Just finished a family vac at the Carousel. We have been to both the hotel rooms and the condos. This yr we went with a reg suite room which was nice with 2 bedrooms and a little mini fridge, microwave, sink and cabinets (no stove). We like the Carousel bc it is very family oriented. We have 2 young children and I find that this place is very quiet. Couldn't hear anyone from the other rooms, no noise from the hallways really or from outside (except traffic). They have a wonderful indoor pool with hot tub, an outdoor pool, an ice skating rink and great access to the beach. The rooms are very clean and bed was comfortable. The only complaint I have is the table in the main room was very small (there was plenty of space for a larger one) and there was no couch to sit (which would also have had plenty of room for). The bathroom is also small, and the shower pressure was a little low. But other than that this hotel meets our standards for our family. We will probably most likely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “terrible, i will never go back”
Reviews.Author: ekaterina7
Reviews.Content: ok, its not worth the money they charge, room was atrium view $318, phone in the room did not work, even though i told the staff they did not fix it. did not get any clean towels after cleaning the room i had to ask them for it after i came from the beach around 6 pm. the pool i terrible, not enough chairs. first day of my stay around 1 am fire alarm sounded, everybody with little kids ran out, nobody told us anything of what happened, they did not acknowledge us, it was false alarm anyway.

Reviews.Title: “FILTHY DIRTY will NEVER return...”
Reviews.Author: KPares
Reviews.Content: Too many complaints to list but I wil start with the 2 inches of water accumulating in our room due to the rain...dirty old carpet, filthy outdated kitchen with chips and stains everywhere. We actually checked out without sleeping there because the place should be condemed, not suitable or safe for our 3 year old daughter. They did credit our account without any questions...I guess the staff is use to clean people complaining about the filth...do NOT go there

Reviews.Title: “good condo rental - will go back”
Reviews.Author: jenniko78
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the condo's of Carousel. Good value....inside pool my kids loved it! steps from the beach....ice skating in lobby...ice cream in lobby...good for families. On 118th street....boardwalk further down costal highway...but can drive or take bus and it's no problem, traffic moves smoothly....actually there is things to do all over costal highway....if you stay in condo rented by coldwell banker, bring your own sheets, paper goods, soap, laundry detergent, etc. They are not provided. Kitchen has pots/pans/utensils/plates though...

Reviews.Title: “Rustic, but nice”
Reviews.Author: GORDOJAYS
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for the week of July 9th. Check-in took a bit time to get in. However, that was to be expected. We rented a condo on the 10th floor. The condo was nice and very, very clean upon check-in. The bedrooms and bathrooms are a bit dated which is my only complaint, but the living area and kitchen were great. The staff were extremely friendly and made our stay most enjoyable. The front desk always greeted us with a smile and whenever we needed something done it was done. Example: Our patio door would not close properly and the phone was not working. I called the front desk to have both repaired and it was done within 30 minutes. The outdoor bar was a blast and all the bartenders were top notch in their service. As soon as I sat down at the bar they had my regular drink ready! My one complaint was the BBQ on Wednesday, my daughter ordered chicken and it as very undercooked. However, it started to rain at that time and I imagine the cook was under a bit of pressure. I felt a bit sorry for him and I did not blame him for the mistake as these things do happen. The manager apologized and we ate in the restaurant instead. The waitress in the restaurant as very attentive to our needs and made sure everything was right for us.
