We never had any issues getting beach chairs, and the bellmen always held the door open for us. The beach bar food is pretty decent and the prices are very reasonable. The staff at the beach bar as I mentioned before were excellent and they had daily entertainment from 2-6 everyday which made the beach bar the most fun. Our check-out was a bit hectic as the elevators were very slow that day, which was to be expected. So upon check-out, I would suggest you get everything down around 7:30 am just to be on the safe side. I ended up getting a bellman to take my stuff down for me and he was very attentive to our needs. We are going back next year and despite the negative reviews from others, I would say the hotel did everything in their power to meet and exceed our needs. I do suggest that they update the bedrooms and bathrooms, but that is just a minor detail as far as I am concerned. We will be back!!!!! Thanks to all the great staff and management at the hotel, your service was EXCELLENT!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Family reunion at the Carousel Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: drd2824
Reviews.Content: We booked our family reunion for about 43 people in February, 2011 and kudos to the Carousel Hotel for an outstanding job! In Ocean City, there are many choices, but I can't imagine a better place for all who attended from ages 5 to 70 years old. The hotel was extremely clean, fresh and the staff is well trained and most friendly and attentive. At the last minute we ate at their restaurant without an advanced reservation as a severe thunderstorm kept us in the hotel on Friday night and without blinking an eye, they provided us with outstanding service and the food was superb. The next night we me in a private room which was set up for us with a buffet and bar tender. The staff again came through with flying colors. No complaint and the food was better than I expected for hotel food. Really a terrific event. I should say that I have never before stayed at this hotel but I chose it for several reasons. First, their director of group reservations, Kim Heffner, is terrific. Definitely call her if you have any interest in the Carousel. She delivers on what she and the hotel represent and say what they will do for you. She did not miss a beat! Also, they have all kinds of activities there and the hotel is right on the beach. I never write these type of reviews but I'm definitely going back there again, hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FOOD AND STAY”
Reviews.Author: chevbayne
Reviews.Content: i have been coming to ocean city for 25 years, and have stayed in many hotels, none of them compare to the carousel, i had a great ocean view. the room was spacious and loved the kitchenete. the indoor pool and spa was terrific.but my favorite part of the hotel has to be the food and bar. i came off the hot beach to walk right up on the bar to have great drinks and friendly service. the following nite i ordered a lobster, and it was off the hook good. thankyou to the manager of the carousel and the manager of the food and bevrage. you made my family and my stay a memorable expeirence, and i cant wait to come back next year. highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Dinning Room full of flys....”
Reviews.Author: Karenthunter
Reviews.Content: This is the first time back o this hotel in 23 years. It's pretty much the same. EXCEPT THE FLYS IN THE DINNING ROOM. When were escorted to our table for breakfast, I had to ask for a different table because there were at least 10 flys hovering around that table. We were then given the table next to it that had food on the window seal and the floor( scrambled eggs). THE BEACH WAS FILTHY AT THIS END. I walked the boardwalk and noticed how clean the beach and sand was further up. The sand right behind the Carousel was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Not the great place they describe-will not be back”
Reviews.Author: shizle7
Reviews.Content: We rented a condo from this resort. One of the reasons we decided to go here was the fact that included was: shampoo, laundry detergent, soaps, dishwasher detergent, dish detergent, etc. Well, we arrived to find four (4) trial size shampoos which are to last us an entire week? Also, there was no dishwashing detergent provided-only dish detergent to which there were no dish towels. We had a complete kitchen, but there were only 2 knives, very bare kitchen cookware! Also, the website promises with linen service-8 to 10 sets of towels-not even close-we only had 4 sets! There are only 2 elevators that service the higher floors and 2 elevators for the lower floors. So, you can definitely expect a wait for the elevators. We had a package in which free ice skating passes were included. We decided we would do the ice skating on the final night of our stay and of course there was a problem with the rink and there was no ice skating available. The restaurant here is HORRIBLE! First of all, the menu items are very limited. The waitress that we had barely spoke English. Everything that we ordered came out incorrectly because of the language barrier. She couldn't understand when we ordered a Coke-that's ridiculous!!!!! I think there were a total of 6 or 7 desserts on their dessert menu and of course one that we ordered-they didn't have it. One night was we sat on our balcony, we actually had some entertainment-workers (including a maintenance man that had visited our room) were diving over the dumpster and taking items from the dumpster-like chairs, etc. That's classy lol. We are definitely not going to revisit anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Major Disappointment, Old Outdated,Rude Manager”
Reviews.Author: oscarobx
Reviews.Content: My new bride and I stayed here for our honeymoon for nine days because of all the amenities and most of them were not available for the most of our stay. The ice rink closed the day after we arrived and was closed for the remainder of our stay. Every time we went down to use the hot tub there was a "Closed for cleaning" sign on it except they never seemed to clean it. We finally asked about the hot tub and they reluctantly informed us it had been broken and was actually waiting for repair. After it was "repaired " the jets were very,very weak and the water luke warm. Disgusting! The store was NEVER open when he were there although we were able to look through the window at a coffee mug I would have liked to bought. When I complained to the front desk someone who claimed to be the manager was very rude and called security and said if we were not happy we could leave HAPPY HONEYMOON!! Never again!! P.S. It did not matter I had suggested to my wedding party they stay there as well and booked 3 rooms and 2 condos. NEVER AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Old and torn up...and bedbugs?”
Reviews.Author: 410office
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a convention. I was initially excited because I hadn't been to this hotel since I was a child and I had fond memories of it. Well, it seems that this hotel has seen its day. The linens and curtains were thread-bare, the furniture and countertops were chipped, the tub was stained and the toilet didn't flush well. It was about the quality of a college dorm room, which makes sense given that it seemed to attract mainly Senior Weekers. When I got home, I found a bedbug in my things. OMG WTF *&(#&%^ not happy.

Reviews.Title: “Not the most luxurious "carnival ride" in town”
Reviews.Author: mapology97
Reviews.Content: I cant say that this place is a "resort".Th location was excellent and the beach was great! However, the hotel is commencing to age. The rooms decor is very out of date and is begging for attention. Some parts of the hotel were INSANELY cold. Breakfast was plane DO NOT RENT THE ICE SKATES!! They smell awful and they are horrible quality !!! I would take your family to a different place that gets you more bang for your buck...

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating in Off Season”
Reviews.Author: cynnii
Reviews.Content: I took my 16 year old niece to Ocean City for a 3 day get-a-way for Spring Break. I certainly realized that early April is not peek travel season in MD, however I did not realize Ocean City would be a ghost town. Including the hotel. It almost felt like the Twilight Zone. The hotel is nice, but we experienced several frustrations. No where on their web site did they state that the hotel pretty much is "closed down" until PEEK SEASON. We could not get any food, because the restaurant was not open. The pool was WONDERFUL, but only open for limited hours. We went down in the morning for an early swim to discover a group of Senior Citizens doing water aerobics. We weren't allowed in!!!! I paid good money to have access to a pool. If I had know, I never would have choose this hotel. When went back to the pool after visiting the Rohobeth Beach Outlets, only 1/2 hour away and great deals - no sales tax in DE, the pool was open when we got back, however there was a kids swim class. Seriously. Our ocean view room was great, I must say. The rooms are outdated, but spacious and clean with a couch, table and kitchen area. Luckily there was a grocery store across the street so we got some munchies and such. We did have a nice walk on the beach the morning we left. Would have loved to have a swim in the pool....but, it was not open. Ugh! The ice rink is cool to look at, but very very small. I'm sure this hotel is a good deal in the PEEK SEASON, but they might as well just shut the doors until warm weather hits. I also left a message with the front desk person for the manager, who was on the phone when we checked out. Never received a call or a follow-up to my concerns. Too bad, because I would have recommended this hotel. Oh and the free wireless internet...yeah not in our room. Could not get it anywhere I walked with my laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Carousel: Where fun goes to die”
Reviews.Author: MD4700
Reviews.Content: Avoid this place at all costs. We made a reservation online for a oceanfront room and when we got there they said none were available. So they bumped us down to a room on the first floor with virtually no view and their standard rate. No comp or anything. The rooms weren't cleaned by 3pm even though we left the room by 8am each day. Even after calling the front desk they still didn't clean the room until 2 hours later! Also, upon arrival you're forced to sign a no party waiver and they threaten you with this and that. I'm 39 years old with two small children. Does it look like I'm going to be throwing parties? That pretty much sums up the general attitude of the staff and the hotel - no fun allowed! . The rooms are pretty disgusting as well. Old, run down and falling apart. I thought after all this the least they could do was grant me a one hour, late checkout. Nope, not a chance. Lesson learned, I'm never coming back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: polkadotfish
Reviews.Content: My family and I enjoyed our stay at the Carousel. We paid a very reasonable rate for a street view room and when we arrived we were upgraded to ocean front. The room was clean and as far as hotel rooms go was pretty roomy. The kitchenette area was great. There was a good amount of counter space, a sink, microwave, mini-fridge and storage space. There were many amenities for the kids too. There are two pools, a pirate boat play set, moon bounce, and direct access to the beach. My little ones even enjoyed playing in the atrium on the mechanical rides (although many of them did not work they just liked sitting on them). Although we did not eat at the hotel there were several dining options. They have a full service restaurant, a pool side bar and grill, and a little snack shop. You really don't ever have to leave the hotel. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: softlilangel99
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a few hotels in oc md in the past, this one is the nicest so far! The staff was all very friendly and helpful. From check in to cleaning to gift shop...all very pleasant! We had our children with us and there was plenty for them to do! The hotel and rooms are very clean. I have no complaints about this hotel, our room or our stay! We will be back soon! Its a little far from the boardwalk....just an fyi

Reviews.Title: “Fun time at the Carousel!”
Reviews.Author: iowakrb
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Carousel, we were very pleasantly surprised that we had been upgraded to an ocean front room. This was the start to a great weekend! Yes, the hotel is older, but we enjoyed it. The Atrium area is fun, with the ice skating and little snack shop. The room itself was okay. 2 double beds-very firm, and I prefer a soft mattress, but you can't make everyone happy! We had a nice balcony that overlooked the ocean-beautiful! There was a small counter kitchenette area with fridge and microwave. The bathroom was small but adequate. I'd skip the restaurant-there are plenty of other choices in Ocean City and the food wasn't anything special, though we didn't have any complaints. There were some really great features of the hotel, and one is definitely the staff. Without exception, they were all friendly and would say hi when they saw you. Very friendly and helpful. Another great amenity was the indoor pool. Wow! It's very large and the water is nice and warm. We loved it! There's a small hot tub, and a couple of ping pong tables in the same area. The beach outside the hotel was also great. Overall, the only reason we wouldn't stay at the Carousel again is if we wanted to be closer to the boardwalk, since it is quite a distance.

Reviews.Title: “not worth $131.00 a night”
Reviews.Author: joeyc049
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the carousel for my daughter's volleyball tournament this weekend and what a disgrace. Upon check-in, we were lucky enough to have room 208. Very outdated, no view at all. The choices are the parking lot or the 1st floor atrium which unfortunately was hosting a convention, so no ice skating. Back to the room issues: the bathroom had some kind of stain in the tub.(Hardwater stains perhaps?) Covered it with the rubber mat. Wasn't real sure that was safe to stand on either. Could the maid not see the stain in the tub???? Don't know why the carousel advertises a high rise resort because unless you're a condo owner you won't see those rooms. Very disappointed and taken over for an off-season weekend. Would hate to see how they operate this place in peak summer times. Beware of the carousel!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “"Last resort" resort”
Reviews.Author: Customer031
Reviews.Content: I came here in April 2011 with a group from my university. We were all very excited to relax and take a break from school, but the hotel was extremely difficult in making arrangements. They were rude to us because we were students and did NOT treat us with respect. The rooms are not at all as they look on the website. I reserved a room with an ocean view......but did not expect it to be 85% blocked by a Carousel hotel building. The seat in the shower (for those with a disability) was broken, making the shower 1/3 smaller than normal, and the bathroom itself was not clean-- I found pubic hair (EWW!!!) in the shower. There was also no counter space in the bathroom. Finally, the bed was EXTREMELY UNCOMFORTABLE. I am used to a dormitory mattress and having springs poke me in the back at night, but this was beyond that. I got next to no sleep the two nights I stayed at the hotel. There was no mattress pad and only 2 pillows were provided for a queen bed.

Reviews.Title: “Ghetto”
Reviews.Author: wippster
Reviews.Content: What bad decision on my part. I should have gotten two rooms at the Holiday Inn express. We check in and none of the elevators worked(we were on the 16th floor) Then, they initially wouldn't accept my AAA card because my reservation was made on the internet (with no special rate) so the girl (with the obvious tongue ring) had to ask her boss (who never came out to talk to me) about it. Then, we finally get in the room around 10 pm and try to go to sleep, but the wind is whistling underneath the front door because there is no screen door like all the other units on the floor. I had to throw one of the blankets from our bed on the floor to block the wind. Anyway, I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Stay!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: momofmpl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Carousel Hotel for a 3 day stay in April 2011. The staff was very friendly, helpful and professional. The housekeeping in our ocean front suite was awesome!!!! The hotel restaurant & bar was great-excellent breakfast buffet and a nice bar to hang out in! We didn't have kids with us...but let me tell you what a great place to take a family-so many activities from kids to do! Even though we didn't have kids with us we had a very nice romantic getaway at the Carousel. I highly recommend this hotel and I will be returning soon!!! Check out the facebook page-awesome photos of the beautiful beach!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Five dots for a three star hotel”
Reviews.Author: pedroAnnapolis
Reviews.Content: Let's get real. The Carousel does not claim to be a 5 star resort. Its' a 3 diamond AAA rated hotel. And for 3 diamonds it was about perfect so I give it 5 on tripadvisor. Was it the best place I've ever stayed, no. But it was clean, had a nice indoor pool, atrium area was nice though I'd like more lounge seating. For Ocean City you're not going to do much better at this price point.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay.”
Reviews.Author: VacaysRock
Reviews.Content: I should say upfront that we won our 2 night stay so it was free. I was very leery based on the reviews here, I have to say though that I didn't find any of the bad reviews to be true. We had a Ocean Front room on the 4th floor for a Friday & Saturday night, the room was very clean. Actually one of the cleanest rooms I've had anywhere in Ocean City. The balcony view was wonderful, we loved the indoor pool which was heated to a nice temperature. We played a few games in the game room & tried out the pool table. We had cotton candy & hot dogs from a little stand that is set up in the atrium area, very convenient. We'll definitely be back again probably in the off season, if this hotel was on the boardwalk it would be perfect for us. Thanks to the Carousel for our wonderful free stay, we loved your hotel :o)

Reviews.Title: “Mild disappointments but may give it another try.”
Reviews.Author: De1trblu
Reviews.Content: At least once every winter I bring my grandson to Ocean City for at least one night. We try to stay somewhere different each time, and this time he chose the Carousel. Let me say that the room was very clean and the pool was great. The bathroom small, but spotless. Our biggest disappointment was my own fault...the skating rink was closed. This was the main reason we decided to stay there. In going back to the website now, I see that the "closed" dates are the last thing at the very bottom of the page, and I did not see them. Also, I booked an "Oceanfront" room instead of an "Atrium room with a view of the rink", after reading some reviews about noise from the rink. My room had both the Ocean View and the view of the rink. I can only imagine that, when open, the noise from the rink must be difficult to bear, as even in this "Oceanfront" room, with the rink closed and drained, music and noises from the "Atrium" area were quite easily heard in our room, and in the morning we were awakened by the clanging of metal rods as workers laid carpeting and decor in the rink area for a fundraising party. Well, no skating, but there is always swimming...my next disappointment was in the pool hours. It closed at 9pm. Since check-in isn't until 4pm (the latest I have ever encountered), and we had to go out to dinner (I did know the restaurant would not be open) we didn't get as much time in the pool as we would have liked. At other hotels we generally grab a swim before checkout the next morning; however, checkout is at 11am and the pool didn't open until 1pm. Scratch that idea too. So after the pool closed we noticed the pool table downstairs. We went to the desk to ask for the cue sticks as there were none at the table. The desk clerk called the security guard and asked if he would get them for us. We were told we could wait at the pool table, which we did for 30 minutes. No one brought us any cues. So then we decided to go over to the game room instead. It was closed. By then it was 9:50pm. Earlier we had tried to use the "complimentary" computer in the Atrium, but we couldn't get it to work, so we just went back to the room to watch TV. The room was warm (75 degrees) despite having never turned the heat on, so just before sleep I pushed the control for "cool" and set the thermostat at 70. It seemed to be running and I fell asleep. I awoke at 3:30am sweating. It was now 78 degrees in the room and whatever I had turned on was still running. I had to turn it off and open the balcony door to cool the room off. An expensive overnight stay considering the only thing we got to do was swim for about an hour. But my grandson still wants to go back again and give it another try in the next off season. Maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for kids and adults”
Reviews.Author: Reese2
Reviews.Content: I really don't have anything bad to say about this place except the gym cold be bigger with more equipment but it is comparable with other hotels. Great ice rink, in door and out door pool. The beach area is do-able. But there were a lot of flys that would land and on you and bite. They really should take care of the fly situation. The rooms were nice and clean! No complaints

Reviews.Title: “Blackened hands and feet”
Reviews.Author: Kris1004
Reviews.Content: I usually am the one reading reviews, but not writting them. So, after the experience we had here, I decided to tell folks about it. Overall, we had a great time. However, for the price we payed...I would expect the rooms to be clean. We went with another family and have three young children altogether. Two of which were crawlers. Well, we had just entered the room and set the toddlers down to crawl around while we unpacked. BIG mistake!! We picked them up only to find their hands and feet were now black with filth!! Not very happy! We called the front desk to ask if someone could come up and mop the floor....they said normally they don't do that as there is no daily maid service in those rooms. Well, I was mad! We ended up going across the street and bought a swiffer. It helped, but the carpet in the living room clearly needed to be shampooed as well!! We will not stay here again, as there are so many other choices in OC.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway.”
Reviews.Author: DeeDeeDowningtownPA
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend stay at the carousel resort with my hubby, daughter-in-law and my 3 and a half year old grandson and we all had a great time. We rented a condo and it was huge( unit 612) with 2 bedrooms, 2 baths, and a full size kitchen. It also has a ice skating ring, a indoor pool, game room & some other stuff to do. The place was very clean and so was the condo. This is a very nice place to stay with kids because there is alot of things for them to do. Would also recommend it to others without children to. It was a very nice weekend and we would stay again in the future. My grandson had such a good time and did not want to leave that he started to cry when we left. So give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “O.K. , But, I don't think I will return.”
Reviews.Author: clammerdave7728
Reviews.Content: The first thing I did upon entering the room was check for bed bugs, since we all are concerned with that. I rolled the sheets back and checked each one and the mattress. No problems and the bed was comfortable. The room was quite large with a microwave, sink, and fridge upon entering. Two queen beds, a table, chair, and sofa. The balcony was oversized, but I did not stay outside because of the cold. I thought the room was very clean. Television was a dated cathode ray tube. When you are use to L.C.D. thin sets with a digital picture, these out dated sets just don't cut it. But, most hotels have the older t.v.'s, I stayed on the 4th. floor ocean side and did get some noise from the ice rink in the atrium. The hotel had a beatiful large oval pool and a hot tub that was actually hot. The restaurant and bar were closed on a sunday. Sunday ? I complained to the front desk. The clerk replied the closing was listed on the hotel web site, but you had to hunt for it. He stated the closing was listed on the restaurant menu on the web site. Not exactly direct. He did direct to me another bar in town that had a decent happy hour. I had friends that called and asked to be connected to my room. The clerk replied no one was staying at the hotel by my name. So, I made reservations on the internet with my credit card, recieved a written confirmation, checked into the hotel, gave them my address and recieved a parking pass and room keys, and they stated I was not staying at the Hotel ? UNACCEPTABLE.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: luvthebeach35
Reviews.Content: While I have stayed at the Carousel in the hotel portion before, this was the first time we stayed in a condo. From the very beginning, we were pleased with everything about the condo. The main area of the hotel including the pool, ice rink and hot tub was extremely clean. The staff was very pleasant and eager to please. Our condo had amazing views and was very pleasant and chearful. My only recommendations would be that the pots, pans, bowls, plates, etc. be replaced. Our selection was extremely limited and what was there was cracked and chipped. The oven in our condo was very slow. It was probably a good 50 degs off. I did inform the staff upon check out and I am sure this will be remedied. All and all, it was a fabulous trip and will most definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Outdated but Great Amenities”
Reviews.Author: avasmom06
Reviews.Content: The pros - hotel has great amenities. Inside pool and jacuzzi were very nice and a great size. Bar had great happy hour specials and was cozy. Ice rink was closed during our time of stay but we wouldn't have gone anyways. Though it was just me and my husband during this trip, our daughter would have loved to stay here based on the amenities. The cons - the room! The rooms should have been renovated 30 years ago. Carpet is worn, paint peeling off the walls, refrigerator and microwave would barely open. TV was on the verge of dying while we were there and only got about 10-20 channels. We had cold showers one day of our stay and no water pressure on the other days. Maintenance was called to resolve the problem and they told us that it was because there were too many people taking a shower. Shouldn't hotels accomodate for this? I wouldn't want to try to take a shower during the summertime when the hotel is at max occupancy. If you could take the amenities of this hotel and combine them with a better room in working order, I would be more than happy. But we experienced too many problems with our room during this stay so I would probably never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: hurleyj19
Reviews.Content: Although the people are friendly, this hotel was dirty! The beds are disgusting and the carpets are torn up. They didn't have heat and I had to order a space heater. They have an indoor skating rink that looks like if you ice skated on it you would break something. I would never go back to this place

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, they were always cleaning.”
Reviews.Author: BCHOH
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an Oceanfront hotel room. Nice size rooms, clean and comfortable. The staff always seemed to be cleaning the hotel while we were in and out from the beach. I was a little worried with some of the negative comments right before we left, but it ended up being a very nice place to stay. Not sure if we will go back to OC, but if we do I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: morgrace
Reviews.Content: OK, should I start with the good or the bad? OK...let's go with the good. The staff at this hotel were all very friendly and welcoming and this hotel was very family oriented. Also, my children LOVED the ice skating rink. We stayed for a long weekend over Labor Day, and once the weekend ended, I got rooms for only $79, which I thought was pretty reasonable. Also, we are facebook fans, so upon arrival there was a very nice gift with t-shirts, beach bag, beach balls, frisbee, and free skating passes in our room which I thought was very nice and appreciated. Also, the beach area in front of the hotel was very nice/clean, not very crowded, and there was a lifeguard in this area. We didn't have a chance to swim, but took a peek at the pools and they all looked very nice and well maintained. OK, now for the bad.... The hotel is pretty old and in need of some major renovations. When you walk in, the lobby area is beautful and well maintained, but this is not true of the rooms. The elevators were a little frightening and made strange grinding, pounding, hissing noises. There was dust and cobwebs in the corners of the room and in the air conditioner. The water pressure in the shower was so poor that I had a hard time getting the shampoo rinsed from my hair; I mean, I now that hotels put on water savers, but this was ridiculous! Our TV kept going black and saying "Unusable signal", but these were not my biggest complaints. Upon arrival to any hotel, the first things I do are strip the bed to check for bed bugs (none found here=good) and check the bathroom for cleanliness (very dirty=gross). I found black mold/mildew growing around the metal fixtures in the bath tub and small, curly hairs (ew, gross) in the tub. Also, the caulking around the tub was dirty and crumbling all around the edges of the tub. I complained to the front desk and they apologized and told me someone would be sent up immediately to clean it. We went to the beach and came back that evening to find the tub in the exact same condition. I called back down to the front desk and talked to Todd, manager. Let me just say, if you do stay here and need something done, he is the man to get things done :) He offered to send someone right up, but I said that we were tired and going to bed so he said that housekeeping would handle it in the morning. We got up bright and early again and headed to the beach. We returned for showers mid-day and ew...our tub was still dirty. I went down to the front desk and asked for cleaners so I could just do it myself. They were very apologetic and promised that this would be taken care of immediately. So, we were off to meet up with family and returned late again and guess what....our tub was STILL dirty! It was around 9 that night and I called Todd, again, and he sent someone up immediately to FINALLY clean the tub! I never knew that cleaning a tub was such a chore. It was very frustrating. Also, on our first night in the hotel, there was a woman in the room next to us whose husband locked her out of the room on the balcony. On purpose? I'm not sure, but anyway, we woke up to her pounding and screaming on her balcony door around midnight. My husband stuck his head out and she asked us to call down to the front desk for her so we did. My husband was in the hall, getting a drink from vending, when security came up to help her, and guess what...since our door was open, they came into our room and out onto OUR balcony at midnight to help her. I was in bed with two sleeping kids and security was very loud. This made NO sense to me. Did he not have a key card? Why was he in our room waking up my children? Again, I talked to Todd and he did credit $75 to my room for the inconvenience, which was nice, but this should've NEVER happened! Overall, I have to say that we will not stay at the Carousel again and I would not recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: lovethebeach86
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 3 night stay over labor day weekend. We traveled with another family and stayed in a 2 bedroom condo. I was a little nervous after reading all the bad reviews, but after our stay all I can say is I can't wait to go back! Our condo was on the 7th floor and although we could see the roof of the smaller hotel part below, our view was still great. Sitting out on the balcony watching the sunrise with a cup of coffee was the perfect way to start the day. We spent the days on the beach with our free beach chairs that came with the rental, afternoons in the pool and having the full kitchen was a great way to save some money! We cooked dinner in the condo and then set out on whatever we were doing for the evening. We ended our days with a nice walk on the beach and after the kids went to bed enjoyed our quiet time on the balcony looking at the waves. This is a nice quiet place to relax and enjoy time with your family! We will definitely be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: techwiz1977
Reviews.Content: The Carousel has been around for many years and the hotel reflects its age. The rooms are large and clean. It's location on the oceanfront makes it a nice place to stay for the budget to moderate traveler. It's not as fancy as the other big name hotels in North Ocean city but still is comfortable and adequate for families. The hotel could use a facelift and interior renovations to make it more desirable.

Reviews.Title: “A little rough”
Reviews.Author: Linda42717
Reviews.Content: We did have a nice vacation, but I would never stay at the carousel again. Many of the workers had a communication problem, because their English was poor to say the least. It was very noisy and the people on both sides of our condo were escorted out by the police at 2am. I expected a call from the manager the next day with an apology but it never happened. The pool was closed for an entire afternoon for cleaning???? All in all the service was poor and the condos were rough to say the least for the price I paid. Never again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but over priced”
Reviews.Author: Christian293
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at best a 2 star place. The rooms need to be re-furbished. Parking was not a problem, there were ample spaces in the garage. If you don't have young kids, find some place else. The bar/lounge closes at 9pm, so get your drink on before you come back. For 2 people traveling without kids, the place was okay, but not great. Next time I'll spend a few extra bucks and upgrade my hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “I would not come back to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alex23111
Reviews.Content: We got an ocean front room with king and a sofa bed. The room was spacious and the view was great. The location to the beach was great. The TV and furniture is really old. Service is really poor. Our room was not cleaned when we get back at 5:00 PM. I called front desk, they said they will send someone to clean. Waited for half hour nobody came to clean the room so I called and asked to talk to a Manager and talked to a front desk supervisor by the name Nicole. She was very impolite and said that they have more than 300 rooms to clean and asked if i request for rooms to be cleaned. I was really surprised by her reply and did not have much more to say after that she said she will send house keeping to clean. Thinking that someone will come to clean the room we left the hotel and went out to eat. When we come back at 10:00 PM for our surprise the room was still not clean. On the way out I reminded the front desk clerk that we were leaving for the room to be cleaned. I finally went to the front desk and talked to a very kind gentle man by the name Todd who heard and apologized and said he will adjust the bill. He also send us 4 sets of fresh towels to use. It is great to have an ocean front but the basics is missing. I will not come back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Weekend Ever”
Reviews.Author: FHM46
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was a little fearful of what to expect at the Carousel. Well, I couldn't have asked for a better experience. From the moment I got out of the car the staff couldn't have been more helpful. Yes, the elevators are slow, but it is a hotel that has been around forever. I never waited over 5 minutes, if that long. The staff was amazing. They always said hi, moved out of your way, and did everything to help you. The room was amazing in size, apperance, and very clean. You would pay the same amount for a hotel on the boardwalk and newer and it would be half the size. The staff is also cleaning the inside and outside. They pool may have alot of sand in it at the end of the day (after all you are in Ocean City), but by morining it was perfect. In compariosn to many hotels, they have ample parking. Their front lot is huge, they have a good amount of street parking and the gargage. Oversized cars/trucks were alllowed to park in the unloading and loading zone. The ocean is right there and the outside bar/grille meant never having to go far for a drink or lunch. We have made this our offical hotel for ocean city!

Reviews.Title: “It was O.K.”
Reviews.Author: dannyluuuwis
Reviews.Content: I will start with the bad. The elevators are horrible, luckily our room was on the 3rd floor because we elected to use the stairs 90% of the time. The only time I used the elevators was during arrival and departure when I had to because I used the luggage cart. Parking was another issue, Yes there is a parking deck however if you own a large truck (crew cab with big tires) good luck finding side street parking. The clearence bar at the entrance of the parking deck says 7 ft. I think it is more like 6ft 8in. I walked out to my truck to get a towel and 2 cars swarmed on me hopin I was going to leave so they could have a parking spot near by. Another disappointment was the ice skating. It was our last night there and I promised my daughter she could try ice skating. So I rented her skates and paid for admission? but they were out of the walkers which help kids who never skated before get around. The ice skating rink was very crowded that night because they let outside groups come in and use it which seems unfair considering the ice rink is one of the major reasons I paid $200 a night for a basic hotel room. Im sure the condos are nicer. Now for the good, the location, even though our room faced the coastal highway a short walk through the atrium out the door and you are on the beach, the indoor pool was clean and warm, Unlike other reviews the staff were polite as far as holding doors and saying your welcome. Wi-Fi worked good. Also security, maintenance and even office staff were always present walking around which gave us peace of mind in case we needed anything. Overall an average experience, yes expensive but all hotels there were expensive August 8-10.

Reviews.Title: “So much fun!”
Reviews.Author: MALLARD22_10
Reviews.Content: Went there end of July. Our oceanfront suite was clean and good size. The view is fabulous. We enjoyed both the hotel and OceanCity. So many activities on site and around. Highly recommended with kids and teens.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced for the quality”
Reviews.Author: tpdisneymom1
Reviews.Content: If you have kids, there seems to be alot of activities for your money but we came with two couples so much of the extras were not important to us. For the price we just wanted an upscale room. Our room was outdated, had an overflowing toilet twice, the sheets were inside out and sideways and the pillows looked twenty years old. Our first room was supposed to be beachfront but instead opened to the bar. The staff was very nice and changed our room to the one with the overflowing toilet. When I complained upon checkout ,the manager did credit $50 to my account but that did not undo the embarrassment for my guests. For the price charged, they need to update this place.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Carousel Had a fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Angisok
Reviews.Content: If you want a place to stay right on the beach that provides entertainment and is children friendly this is the place to go. We had 3 rooms at the Carousel we had children ages 2-17 and 2 senior citizens in our party. All were happy and all loved the stay. It is an older place in Ocean City but don't let that stop you. They have an ice skating rink outdoor and indoor pools. Daily DJ. Lounge and outdoor bar. Bounce house, playground never heard I"m bored from the kids. Older kids caught the bus right in front of the hotel to go to the boardwalk. Younger kids had entertainment at the resort even had babysitting service not that we need this with 2 grandparents available. This is my second year at the resort and this time took more of our extended family. Already we are looking forward to next year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jerseymom2
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at the carousel, and I was a little worried after reading some of the reviews. But was very happy I didnt change my reservation to another hotel. We had a very clean and spacious room on third floor (city view) The staff was polite and helpful. The bellmen are the BEST!!! They were always nice and helpful. My two children loved the iceskating rink and we will be staying again next summer. Give this hotel a try if you have children they will love it :)

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time - would stay at the Carousel again”
Reviews.Author: TRestey
Reviews.Content: I brought my 3 kids, ages 18-24, and their 3 friends to the Carousel resort. It was clean, the staff was very friendly and helpful. The elevators were slow (we stayed on the 14th floor), but that is my only complaint. The beach front was gorgeous and all the specials offered to us were available when we arrived as promised (gift certs, beach chairs, etc). The live music at the outdoor lounge every night was a nice feature. Anytime I called customer service, the response was great. We were about 20 minutes from the boardwalk, but my kids and their friends (4 of them 21 and over) would take the bus since you could ride it for $2 all day, so they could have a few drinks and didn't have to worry about driving back. The kitchen was fully stocked and the A/C worked very well. The view from the balcony was beautiful. It looked like there were lots of activities for all ages. The seafood & steak buffet was awesome! The free internet service was a little slow at times, but we didn't need to use very much. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Another fabulous stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: kamsct
Reviews.Content: July marked our 7th summer stay at the Carousel. In fact, we are giving serious thought to purchasing a condo. We typically rent a condo on the 6th floor (you get housekeeping services because of the obstructed view) but arrive before the Saturday turnover and spend a night or two in a standard hotel room. We have seen numerous upgrades and improvements over the years. In fact, the outdoor pool is new since we have been going. The staff are fabulous and often remember us year to year! Our kids are 10, 8 & 4 and they love the Carousel. From the pools, the beach, the kids club (on sight babysiting offered for a kids free evening) the ice rink, the movies and the live music, there is something for everyone all day long!

Reviews.Title: “The Carousel is our favorite place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: mjd06
Reviews.Content: Pay no mind to the negative reviews. We absolutely love the carousel. We've been going there with our family for the past four years and I myself have been going since I was a kid. We like to stay away from the boardwalk so this is a really good location for us. We love the fact that after a long day at the beach we can go downstairs, get our kids a treat of popcorn or ice cream and watch the guests ice skate or watch ice shows. There are a few little quarter rides downstairs that our kids just love and the restaurant is great when you want to grab something real quick. It's a little pricey but it's convienent. The bar is nice when we have had the opportunity to go without the kids. The pool is huge and it is really nice to not have an ice cold pool when you have a little one. I have always loved that there is a little gift shop in case I need to grab something real quick. The staff is extremely courteous and have always been helpful. I will say, that it is probably time for some renovation (the beds are a bit hard) but it's not something that needs to happen immediately for me to enjoy this place. I love it!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, staff and entertainment”
Reviews.Author: Eljay1004
Reviews.Content: I took my 10 year old daughter and cousin to the Carousel and we had a GREAT time! The staff were so friendly and helpful. We thought the ice skating rink would be cold and we'd need coats/gloves/hats, but it was surprisingly "room temperature". The kids were thrilled to ice skate in their shorts & t-shirts! We were very pleasantly surprised that our room had a mini-kitchen, fridge, and balcony (although it does state this on the website). Free movie night, all you can eat steak and seafood dinner, the beach so close all made this the best vacation we've had in years. The indoor pool really came in handy when it rained on one day during our visit. Just awesome. We didn't have one negative experience here. We will definitely make this our hotel of choice from now on! Thanks Carousel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but overpriced and outdated...”
Reviews.Author: VS1234
Reviews.Content: Just came back from my trip to Ocean City. We stayed at the Carousel Resort. It's definitely not worth the $320/night that I paid to stay there but then it seems like all the other hotels are just as expensive. The room were old and does have a funny smell to it. My sister woke up with bites all over her arms and neck on our last night. Not sure if they are bed bugs bite but I am definitely grossed out by it. The hotel location is good. It has a big indoor heated pool for the kids when you don't want to swim outside. The outdoor pool is small and very limited beach chairs to use. We usually head outdoors around 3pm to avoid the heat so we didn't have any problem finding a seat. The beach is right there. All in all we had a great time. But I wouldn't stay there again. Try the Hilton Suites. Looks newer.

Reviews.Title: “Need updating but pleasant”
Reviews.Author: satuaki
Reviews.Content: First timers to OCMD. Looking forward to the beach front accommodations. The location is good with lots of restaurants, movie theater and shops in walking distance but quite far from the boardwalk. We got a 5th floor double queen w/ attached king for our family of 6. There was a kitchenette w/ a refrigerator that kept tripping out. Maintenance fixed it then it tripped again. Only one bathroom. The bed covers, drawers and carpet need to be updated. Also the televisions were dated. The air conditioners were so loud and had to run all the time because it was very hot. The elevators were hot, smelly and slow. Many families w/ lots of stuff. The beach was nice and easy to get to but very crowded. The pool was small and kinda' dirty. The ice skating rink was nice for the kids. I'm not a pre madonna but I like don't like to stay and pay for a place that is below my standard. It wasn't a great value. $1025 for 3 nights. Carousel could be great if they update. The staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, gross condos and NO AC!! CONDO 901 IS SO GROSS!!”
Reviews.Author: deedee07312
Reviews.Content: Do not stay in any of the condos at the Carousel. Especially not Condo 901! I have been to the carousel 3 times and each time paid alot for a condo to accomodate 3 families with children, each condo has always been dirty. However, condo 901 I recently stayed in was beyond filthy and there was no AC!! The condo advertises that there is a den plus three bedrooms, there is no den, it is a foyer area, and the third bedroom was about 95 degrees. Finally after 2 days of our 4 day stay the AC was fixed in the other rooms of the condo, but that third bedroom and den never have AC, also you don't get a front balcony thats where the den is. The beds were so dirty I wanted to go home after I pulled the covers down to put my son to sleep. We had to have the hotel staff bring us all new sheets, blankets and pillows and we stripped down the beds, the comforters had all kinds of stains including what looked like blood. The corner of the rooms had piles of dust and dirt built up and the bathtubs were nasty with yellow and brown gunk all over. Dont ruin your vacation and stay here, my family couldn't even sleep it was so gross and hot and dirty and uncomfortable. Pots and Pans and dishes and silverware were very dirty too. We had to buy everything from paper cups to paper plates, plastic silverware and oven tins. NOT WORTH THE MONEY OR A RUINED VACATION!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Place, Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: ddablh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and three girls ages 16, 14 and 10. It was a great family place, with a lot to offer for everyone. It was very clean, but there were a few things that drove us crazy....The room with a ocean front view was $279/night.(That seems to be about average for the area.) The web site shows a tall building with a smaller building in front of it. The hotel is the smaller building. Our pull out couch did not work. We called the desk and they sent someone up to open it for us. They said it would be replaced. They never did. I had to call again. While having cocktails at the outside pool bar, the bartender took our change as his tip. We were going to have more drinks and give him a tip. We felt he should have waited for us to "leave the tip". The maid knocked on our door at 9 am. I asked her to come back. We went out for the day and at 5pm, the room was not cleaned. This happened two times. The Happy Hour Food specials for the indoor bar were posted throughout the establishment. It posted 1/2 pound seasoned shrimp for $4.95. When we ordered it, we were told it was $10.95 due to the Gulf oil leak disaster. We do respect that, but the specials should be changed to reflect that. When I asked the food manager to honor the price I was told by the food buyer, the best they could do was $2 off. We said no thank you. When I reported this to the front desk, the very helpful woman, called the food manager. He said he was honoring the prices, but we did not ask him. This was a lie. The woman at the front desk told him to honor it the next day. He, Tom Anderson, who lied to us, said he would. We did not bother to go back, because we were annoyed. The shrimp was "whited out" off the flyer in front of the bar, the next day. The rest of the flyers as of 7/15/10 throughout the resort still had the shrimp listed. These are small things, and we really did have a good time. I just feel their customer service needs improvement. The only person who went above and beyond was the woman at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: augustof1973
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel with mild reservations of what to expect from some of the reviews. I'm glad i took a chance to see for myself. The hotel was clean. Pools were open and the beach was just steps away. I didn't experience any major problems. They did close the indoor pool because it was lightening outside not sure why but not a big deal.Yes the ice rink is a little smaller than regulation but come on its in the middle of the hotel and for that its a decent size. Yes the ice gets a little watery from the busy use in the evening. So go during the day when its less crowed. No big deal. The arcade is small but something to do to kill some time. There are two computers to use for Internet access if needed. A gift shop if u forget something that's prices are in line with all local gift shops in the area. We ate at the restaurant once for the free buffet for kids. It looked better than it tasted but so do most buffets. The Dinner we had was cheap for kids and much pricier for the adults. The food was just OK. There is plenty to do from the small ice show to the movie night, pools, beach and moon bounce. The free beach chairs for each day was nice not to have to pack. parking was ample.The elevators are a tad old and slow but nothing more than a two to three minute wait unlike the other reviews that said 20 Min's which is not true. Besides taking the stairs never hurt. Our room did have a leak which i reported and they took care of right away. basically the rooms were like most hotels. A little worn but clean.Beds were a little hard but nothing that prevented sleep.our room had a mini fridge,microwave,coffee maker and sink. And being right across from the food lion made it easy to have a economical lunch and snacks in the room.We travelled with 4 kids and 2 adults ages 4,9,12,15 and had plenty of space for all.This place is good for families. No its not the Ritz but it's no roach motel. We never saw any bugs like others have stated. Its all about expectations. If you're expecting a fancy 5 star place then keep looking. but if you can be realistic and look past the occasion decor flaws and see that its a comfortable decent place withs lots to entertain the family, you'll be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Carousel Resort...Not worth the money!!”
Reviews.Author: ashybabe11
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to start my weekend in Ocean City, MD. I have not been there since I was very little. When I first walked into this place I said to myself "Okay this place is old." It just got worse from there. When my friends and I first got there only one of our rooms were ready so we went up there. The first room was fine. The bathroom was soo small and no counter top to put anything. After my friends settled in that room, we were hungery so we decided to eat at the bar downstairs. Big mistake!!! I paid 9.00 for a Ranch Chicken Wrap. It was not even ranch!!!! It was merical whip and chicken! It should of said chicken salad! I could not even finish the sanwhich. After we ate we went and got the other room. This room was the one I was staying in. Soon as we went into the room we could not even open the front door! You had to throw your whole body weight to enter the room. It was the same with the bathroom door. There were white stains in the carpet near one of the beds which was gross. To be honest I would never stay there again I was skeeved out the whole weekend I was there. For the money I paid to stay at this place I could of stayed at a place a hell of a lot nicer. Oh! and I forgot to mention that our toilet clogged on the first day. How did that happen? No idea! The only good thing was when we called maintenance, the guy came up real quick. I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The most perfect vacation...”
Reviews.Author: mkshelly
Reviews.Content: The Carousel Hotel is the ONLY place in Ocean City that my family and I will stay. We have 3 children, ages 11, 8 and 6. There is SO much to do. The beach front, outdoor pools, indoor pools, ice skating, moon bounce, movies on the beach and nightly ice shows. You never have to leave! We actually do spend one evening at the board walk, but we are so grateful to be so far away from that chaos. We have stayed in both the hotel rooms and several different condos. The hotel rooms are very nice. Clean, comfortable, quiet. Each condo is different. Well, the layout is roughly the same but each is equipped differently. But they are all wonderful. The staff is friendly and helpful. They go out of their way to help you out. The hotel restaurant is fabulous. It's a wonderful atmosphere for families and singles alike. There is a bus stop right in front of the hotel so traveling around the city by public transportation is a breeze. We have stayed there 5 years in a row now (over the 4th of July week) and we will NEVER stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place for the location, value and family appeal”
Reviews.Author: kbltater
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd year my family and I have stayed at the Carousel and we've enjoyed it. I disagree that the staff is unfriendly and the facilities unclean. I did have the staff say "Good Morning" to me, and my Mother did as well. The room was always cleaned promptly and we were left with fresh smelling towels. We also ate at the buffet for breakfast every AM -- I thought for the value, the breakfast was very good. We also tried the Seafood Buffet Sunday night and were very pleased with that. Carousel, please keep the skating shows during the summer -- I love seeing the skaters practice in the AM and perform at 6:30. Additionally, the location is ideal --- right across from Food Lion and Super Fresh; same with Pizza Tugos and Greene Turtle. Try a hotel at OC that will give you free beach towels -- I am not sure one exists. I thought the pool towels were adequate for their purpose -- just to dry off with -- if you want a huge towel to dry off with, use your own. Carousel, I also enjoyed the outside bar -- bartenders were friendly with great service. Music at the outdoor bar was also a nice addition. All in all I tremendously enjoyed my stay at the Carousel and will be back next year with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay, great hotel for families!”
Reviews.Author: drdpittsburgh
Reviews.Content: I do much research before I go to a hotel on vacation. I found Carousel Hotel on Trip Advisor and looked into it. Most of the reviews were good, a couple were questionable. Turns out, we had a great time and couldn't have been treated better! This is a great family hotel. Beach is good, pool and bars are good, skating rink is cool (no pun intended). Staff was great and very courteous! I would definately go back again. Please do not hesitate to try this hotel, especially for families!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sherrycoppola
Reviews.Content: This place was so terrible, I do not know where to begin. Unfriendly staff, filthy, old, dated, and very noisy rooms as well as terrible food. We stayed in the hotel, we had to move 3 different times and they were all bad rooms. The cleaning staff is terrible at their job, there were sticky floors and greasy tub as well as a toilet that was not cleaned well. I made coffee one morning and they never bothered to clean the coffee maker. The microwave never worked. The balcony doors never closed well. the beach chairs had to be returned by 5:30. No beach towels, and if you take the pool towels they chase you to return them to the pool area. We had breakfast at the restaurant and we couldn't eat our eggs they were so terrible. And don't forget the flies, flies, flies everywhere. It was not cheap to stay there but it should've been for free.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE HOTE.. WHY SO MANY BAD REVIEWS??”
Reviews.Author: fjt1111
Reviews.Content: Glad I didn't go by the past reviews I read. We thought this place was wonderful for our family of 5. Our kids ages 13 twins and our 11yr old loved the indoor and outdoor pools. We had an incredible view of both the ocean and bay from the 17th floor. Our condo was perfect for cleanliness.. the cleaning staff was throughout the hotel at all times. The ice skating rink was wonderful for all of us. The location was perfect from all the noise and crowds. Food lion is directly across the street. McDonalds, burger king, dunkin donuts, 7 11 are all within a short walk. Pizza Tugos and the green turtle are directly across the street, both very good and reasonably priced. The only downfall and its a small inconvenience is the elevator situation.. there are 4 elevatorss 2 go from the 11th floor up.. and the other 2 go from the 11th floor down.. if I had a choice stay on the 11th floor since all 4 elevators go there.. the wait for an elevator can be frustrationg.. other than that.. we found this hotel to be PERFECT.. and the staff is friendly at all times

Reviews.Title: “arogant and rude treatment”
Reviews.Author: sebury
Reviews.Content: Don’t bother with this place...,.I think they need to train their help in manners and how to treat a person with respect. If the Ocean City Council knew how they treat customers they would make them leave the area. Gives Ocean City a bad name.... I won't be back and I will tell everyone to avoid the Carousel at all costs. They double booked me and charged my account 2 times. When I advised them of the error they said it was my fault that I did it. They were so rude on the phone to me that I cancelled the reservation. But somehow they neglected to do that too... Go figure??? Rude on the phone was not enough for them. They are also inept. Oh, and this is a valid complaint. Not bogus....Confirmation number was 220331.

Reviews.Title: “Please clarify, hotel or condo....My condo is always great!”
Reviews.Author: rocketman4319
Reviews.Content: I have seen reviews regarding the Carousel each year, and I must say there are many that dont hold the hotel in good standing. My family goes each year to Ocean City, this July will be our 7th yr, and our 6th at the Carousel Hotel (CONDO'S). It seems that the majority of the complaints I have read about deal with people that stay in the Hotel part, nightly rates, etc...The hotel is the 1st 4 floors, after that floors 5 through 22 , i believe...are all condos. Individually owned and rented out on a weekly basis through the Carousel Hotel. The condos that I have stayed in are all clean, well kept, and I dont think there is a place in OC that would even remotely give you what you get there as far as rooms go. I have stayed in 2 BR, and 3BR condos. each have full kitchens, and 2 baths, a den area and 1 or 2 sliding doors that lead to an ocean viev terrace. You can view the condos on their website, so, you see what you get before you get there. Again, I am not talking for the nightly hotel part, just the condos. It seems as though they are completely seperate, but i would say theres plenty to do. Kid have a blast, each yr for the past 5 yrs we have also took kids to Disney in Orlando. If you asked my kids what their fav vacation spot was, they say OC every time. And for what i am looking for , I have not found anything remotely close inthe OC area. So, if you are planning to stay a full week in the summer, by all means...book this place. If you are spending a few nights in the hotel part, not the condos...based on what I read, you probably should look elsewhere. But, for me, this is a great place. only complaint about condos year in and out, is internet servise stinks. hope this helps...

Reviews.Title: “never again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: biggie07
Reviews.Content: There was a group of about 15 of us looking to get away from work and school. We were heading fdown to ocean city for a car show. From the time we walked in the hotel they had it in for us. They tried to evict us friday night for a noise complaint( 1 Complaint!!!).So the next night they came back up and yelled at us again. We were doing nothing wrong, we were just sitting in our rooms talking with the tv off. No music was playing. The kids across the hall had a shopping cart and were pushing it down the hallway all night. Finally at 1 am they came and evicted all of us for 2 noise complaints They said we were slaming doors. We cant help that with the balcony door open, the air pressure sucks the door shut. I will never again waste my money for this hotel. If you are looking to have fun, stay away!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst place I have ever stayed... absolutely ridiculous”
Reviews.Author: mshriver
Reviews.Content: I just got back from the worst vacation ever thanks to the Carosel Hotel... I went with a group of friends for memorial day weekend ad a car show. All together we had 4 rooms on the same floor. The security had it out for us and harrased us! they followed us from the lobby to our room a couple of times because we are young (19 - 24) and they were sure we were trying to have a party.... they ended up evicting us in the middle of the night because they claim they had 2 news complaints even though all we were doing was sitting around talking, we could hear other peoples tvs that were louder than we were. The most noise we made was going in and out of the room because the crappy doors to the rooms slam on there own, If you stay here dont shut your door you might get kicked out! We tried to reason with the security, they came and told us that us and anyone associated with us had 30 minutes to leave, this was at midnight btw, They were even going to kick out the other 2 rooms of our friends that werent even in the hotel at the time or had been there at all that evening. There were some rowdy kids down the hall but they kicked us out instead for having too many people in one room sitting around and talking< thats what they consider a party. We had to pay for the whole weekend even though we only got 1.5 nights and ended up sleeping in our cars accross the street that night. The whole situation was aboslutely rediculous

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: Jennyfish94
Reviews.Content: Water was so cold at the beach so we had a great time in the Heated indoor pool and a family night of Ice skating. The older children had fun in the arcades. When summer begins it has a great outside bar in the back. It wasn't open yet when we were there. The hotel is nice, the old carpet needs to go. But as we were leaving we could see that a lot of the rooms were getting new carpet/tile. Should be great for those visiting after Memorial Day. We would definitly go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL WIFE AND I WOULD HAVE LOVED TO STAY LONGER.”
Reviews.Author: wes22
Reviews.Content: my wife and me loved the hotel every thing you would want or need is right there. staff very nice and there if you need any thing.we had angus burgers and fries in lounge.best burger i ever had. had chaz the service manger cooking one night.real nice man not to bossy to help out. very nice man. room very nice and clean.great view. we will book again.

Reviews.Title: “Thank God I Only Booked One Night!”
Reviews.Author: baaad_lady
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with 2 14 year old boys ( my son and my nephew) that love to swim, in a pool but not the ocean. I found out about Carousel through a friend that heard about it. I was going for a weekend trip but due to the low Trip Advisor rating I decided to only book one night at this hotel. Thank you Trip Advisor reviewers! The greatest thing about the room was the ocean front balcony. We had 2 queen beds and a sleeper couch. Please, don't even try to sleep on the sleeper couch unless you enjoy pain. The room was clean, but very very average. I expect a little more when I travel. But then again it was a great price. My biggest complaint by far was the rude staff in the swimming pool area that day. The boys could not go swimming without adult guest supervision. When I questioned why 14 yr olds who were taller than the 5foot pool (one 5'8 and had just turned 14,the other 6'2 and turning 15 the next week) could not swim without supervision, the staff lady told me it was Ocean City regulation. When asked which regulation (because we had just come from another hotel where this was not a problem), the staff lady became very defensive stating she did not have to tell me. I asked for the hotel manager information and she refused to give it to me and said I would never be able to speak with him. Finally another staff member did give me the manager's name. After walking around the pool after this altercation, I noticed there was a posted green sign leaning against the wall behind the entrance that said "..children under 15 should not swim without adult supervision"("should not" not "could not"). When I pointed that out to the original staff lady, she said the green sign was the Ocean City regulation. I reminded her that she said Ocean City regulation said children under 15 "could not" swim without adult supervision, but the sign says "should not". She then said Carousel regulation said they "could not".... I asked again for her to tell me where it say this and got the same rude response that she didn't have to tell me or show me anything. After walking around some more, I did come across the hotel pool sign on the floor against a wall all the way over to the left of the entrance. Mind you, you had to go up to the sign to read it. That sign did say it was Carousel policy that no one under 15 be allowed to swim without adult guest supervision. What was the big secret that the staff could not or would not point out this sign?? They had a sign posted on the entrance door of the fitness room that no one under 18 was allowed. What was the secret with the pool room?? So, being the selfless mother/aunt that I am :-), I gave up my oceanfront balcony time to sit with the two tallest boys in the room, so they could swim. Needless to say, I will not be going back to the Carousel (despite the fact that my boy is now 15) and I will NOT recommend this hotel to my friends either. There was no excuse for the rudeness.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids!”
Reviews.Author: WeLuvWaves
Reviews.Content: Our kids loved it. Very fun place. Great beach location. great street location. Close to many stores, food, etc..The biggest problem I had was the fact that I felt like I needed to call 'Extreme Home Makeover' to come & update this poor, used & abused place. I can imagine how awesome it must've been many years ago. The (outdoor)pool was gross. Lots of debris floating around. cloudy water. Large amounts of sand in the pool. They make filters for that . My kids didn't mind. The ice skating rink was great for my kids, but...the ice was watery...Not ideal conditions for safe ice skating during our stay. My kids had a blast, so we can't complain too much. Ladies, do not bring your nice handbag, you will feel awkward walking around with it. Bring a straw bag & leave the Coach bag at home. Do not buy a fancy cover-up or nice beach towels. Do not worry, this is not, I repeat, this is not a fancy place!. This is like a basic place with loads of stuff for kids! Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, terrible Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Splitterman05
Reviews.Content: The wife and I stayed in room 446 over the 2/20/10 weekend. We wanted a little off season getaway for the wife and me. We liked the room. Nice size and clean. Decent TV. We liked the bar on Friday night (good recorded music and dancing) and found the prices fair. Forget the breakfast buffet. It's cheaper to order from the regular menu and the buffet selection was poor. But when ordering off the menu, the food was very good and reasonable. Now for the bad part.....the hotel was hosting at least one church youth group! The noise was TERRIBLE! It did not stop at 10PM either. We had to help children find their irresponsible parents on two occasions. Children were running wild up and down the halls until 11PM. It also looked like the hotel hosted children's parties each day as massive numbers of new children were on the ice....yelling and screaming as kids do. When a hotel is hosting a large group, especially a youth group, they really need to give the other guests fair warning when they are making reservations. A simple "We Welcome the SoAndSo Youth Groups:" on their web page would have sufficed and we would have stayed somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jlynn785
Reviews.Content: The hotel was absolutely wonderful!!! The service from ALL of the staff was absolutely amazing, but I'd have to say the front desk staff was the best!! To say the staff would go above and beyond to get you what you want or need is an understatement! My husband had a taste for bacon wrapped scallops in February on Valentine's weekend and the front dest staff called every seafood restraunt and when the restraunts couldn't deliver, the head chef at the restraunt inside the hotel did! I couldn't believe how responsive the staff was when it came to giving their customers what they want! We will definitely be returning!!! My only complaint, however, would be the noise inside the atrium in the mornings and during the day, although it does subside by 10 p.m. But this is definitely the place to stay in Ocean City!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back in 2010”
Reviews.Author: gracy72
Reviews.Content: We have found our newest family tradition! We stayed at the Carousel last year on the advise of a friend - we had a 3BR condo on the 15th floor adn could not be happier with it - the ocean view was breathtaking, the condo was clean and we got to watch the 4th of July fireworks from our Bay View Balcony. The beach was great, the indoor pool was a huge plus and as a family with hockey players, the kids loved the Ice Rink. The snack bar had nice and inexpensive choices. Would not recommend the "family barbeque" buffet, but otherwise we had a fabulous trip and wholeheartedly plan on returning in 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Old, run down, and noisy”
Reviews.Author: wildcat48
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over new years holiday. We paid extra for a room overlooking the ocean. We arrived a few hours before check in and were given no problem with checking in early. We stayed in room 448. The entire hotel is very dated and run down. It is clean, but very very worn and run down and it almost makes you feel as if it is dirty. Our room was overloking the ocean and also had an inside view of the ice skating rink. The entire 3 days we stayed we heard constant loud noise from the skating rink. Even blasting our TV didnt drownd out the noise. It was terrible. We did not use the pool or workout room, but we did walk thru and check them out. Again...very old, run down and dirty feeling. The bar/restaurant in the hotel was extremely overpriced and again, run down and almost dirty feeling. There are plenty of other hotels to choose from in Ocean City......I would NOT choose this one again.

Reviews.Title: “A MUST STAY”
Reviews.Author: iluvghosts
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the carousel around 10:30 AM and were checked in 7 HOURS EARLY! and we were upgraded free to a Oceanfront Suite!! When we got into the room there were some minor problems but they were quickly fixed by the friendly staff. The indoor pool has a lifeguard and the ice ring is a great add on....we also were handed over 70 dollars in gift certificates!!! I am here now actually this is my second time and this is in october and again we were upgraded! This is a truly great place if your not looking to be on the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience Even in a U.S. Hotel”
Reviews.Author: adcst12
Reviews.Content: In July 2009, our family stayed in the Carousel Motel and it was truly the worst experience I ever have had in a U.S. hotel. First off, even though the Carousel is advertised as “resort hotel & condominium,” it is actually what looks like a 1970’s motel with a condominium building attached. When booking, make sure you know which you are getting. I booked a “Direct Oceanfront Room” and, when I made the reservation, I confirmed that the room would have an ocean view and would be on a high floor, away from the noise of the ice-skating rink and public connector area. I was told that both of these requests would be noted in my reservation and “should not be a problem.” These were lies number one and two. When we arrived at the motel, we were assigned to room 243. When I requested a room on a higher floor, away from the noise, I was told that this was the only room available (lie number three) and that it was a very quiet room (lie number four). Room number 243 was, unfortunately, not as advertised. In addition to being very run down and dirty, the “Oceanfront” view consisted of a low-angle view of the ocean that was 90% blocked by a pool inflatable of some sort. The view out the other window was of a dumpster. When we returned to the front desk and told them that this room was unacceptable and that we would be staying somewhere else, they magically found us another room in the condominium building for only $30 more per night. I have seen other reviews that accused the Carousel of bait-and-switch tactics. In this case, I don’t think it was intentional but rather that the desk staff did not have the authority to take care of customer problems (nor did they seem to want to). It took a manager to agree to give us this “upgrade” at the same room rate. Off to room number two…while much better than room number one since it was a two-bedroom on the condo-side, it was still very run-down, “tired” and dirty. The room was “cleaned”, but the carpets, walls, bathrooms, etc. had had such little maintenance that it just felt dirty. The real problem with room number two, however, was the air conditioner. At any setting, it would blow only hot air, making the room temperature greater than 85 degrees. They did send a maintenance engineer right away but he was unable to fix the problem. Another call to the front desk and a request to speak directly to the manager on duty yielded yet another available room. Our third room was a three-bedroom condo and could have actually have been okay but, again, it was pretty run down. I don’t know what the rate would have been for this room but I am sure it is much more than the motel rate we were paying. Unfortunately, this room, while also “cleaned” was dirty. In addition to an envelope requesting tips for the house cleaning staff, we found a drink-box straw on the floor, several dead insects on the floor and ceiling, and a used bar of soap in the shower. And, one of the toilets was clogged and would not flush properly. We decided to stay (mostly because we were tired and it was easier at this point not to try to move again) but only to stay one night. We thought about going to the indoor pool for a quick swim but, unfortunately, it was closed. I was assured that “it will definitely be open tomorrow” (lie number five…it was still closed when we left). The next morning, when I checked out, I was informed that I had a balance for the remaining night since they have a two-night minimum (the two-night minimum was not in effect when I made the reservation several months in advance and I confirmed this about two weeks prior to arrival via telephone). When I questioned the charge, I was told that it would be corrected since we were checking out early and had had such a bad experience and that I had a zero balance. What I didn’t realize at the time, however, was that they had already charged us for two nights, one night when I made the reservation in January and one night upon arrival. STAY AWAY FROM THIS MOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun”
Reviews.Author: Travel11NewJersey
Reviews.Content: I was a bit apprehensive about staying at the Carousel due to the previous reviews. At arrival the front desk was very prompt. They had our room keys ready. We where given a room with partial Ocean view. The room was very muggy and smelled. We turned on the A.C and that problem was corrected. The windows where very dusty and in need of at least a wipe down. The bath tub needed some TLC also. We stayed in that room one nigth and changed in the morning. The front desk staff let me see 2 other rooms before deciding on which one to stay in. Our second room was nice. It was more updated.
