The $99 dollars a night we paid through Hotels.com was a good price for this hotel. We enjoyed the ice skating rink. Did not visit the pool, why would we there is a beach right behind the hotel. I am very picky and thought the Carousel was decent. Not luxurious by any means but for a quick trip to O.C I felt It was worth the money. This hotel is located on 112th street and the action on the boardwalk starts at around 24-23rd street so you have to drive about 10 min. There are places to eat near the hotel Tugo's has pizza and its open til 4am right across the street from the hotel. Denny's, Dunkin donuts, burger king and Mcdonalds are less than 1 minute drive or 5 min walk. There is a supermarket (foodlion) right across the street also.

Reviews.Title: “One of the greatest vacations I took”
Reviews.Author: KimPhilly_PA
Reviews.Content: I am actually still here at the hotel and felt a need to write this review after reading all of the negative ones. Before I got here, I had read some of the reviews and was so nervous that I was thinking about cancelling my reservation but it was too late. Once we got here we absolutely could not see what the bad reviewers were talking about. We came here for a weeks stay with my 6 year old son, my husband, my grandmother, mother in law, my 15 year old daughter and her friend. My husband and I searched out everything that was written up as a bad review and could not find anything that was written about. We saw the cleaning staff cleaning the hotel rooms every morning, we also saw them cleaning the lobby and vacuuming the elevators. There are a total of 4 elevators 2 for 2-8 floors and 2 for 9 and above floors. The staff was extremely friendly, the room was clean (I brought my cleaning supplies with me just in case), we had no air conditioning in one of the bedrooms so we stopped at the front desk to let them know and maintenance was up here and fixed the problem in 10 minutes. My son played in the arcade a few times which is actually in a room off of the ice skating rink, not in the lobby. Although, there was a few pinball machines and a few rides for the younger kids in the bistro lobby as I called it. Our condo was on the 9th floor and even though there was a building there we could still see the ocean and beach very clearly. We have not tried the restaurant downstairs yet but we will go there on Saturday morning before we check out. I must say that both restaurants that we actually did eat at this week were over priced and you didn't get much selection even at the buffet, which is why you stay in and cook your own food. We never heard any commotion from other guests and we were always back to the hotel no later than 9:30 p.m. The grille outside looks like something from the tropics, the beach access was great also. My son enjoyed himself at the playground, my daughter and her friend also went ice skating and walked across the street to the mall and they even had computer access so she was able to keep in touch with her friends at home without any time limit. We hope this review helps someone to book a stay here we have enjoyed ourselves thoroughly and have not seen any of the above complaints. I have already recommended this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE DO NOT STAY AT THE CAROUSEL”
Reviews.Author: agkg
Reviews.Content: Very very old and dirty.... The carpet in our room was soiled, with brown and black spots in all areas. The three chairs they provide in the room very soiled as well. The sofa very old, when you sat on it, your almost hit the floor. The shower had no preasure, took a very long time to take a shower. I will not recommand this hotel. At the price they charge, they require major renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: ALB2009
Reviews.Content: We paid about $350 a night for a beach front room. It was in front of the beach, alright, but it was also in front of the outdoor bar & grill and outdoor pool. In addition to being old, dated, and a bit dirty, it's also a very LOUD hotel. Walls are flimsy, and the noise from the outdoor areas competes with the noise from the indoor areas (crowded, loud lobby). If you have young children who go to bed before 11 pm (or take naps in the middle of the day), good luck with that. Staff wasn't rude, but they weren't overly friendly, either. The "arcade" in the lobby consists of 3 or 4 small rides and a pinball machine (50 cents a piece). If you're thinking that the Carousel Hotel actually has a real carousel, you'd be wrong. The "carousel" consists of 3 small horses like the kind you find at the mall. Ice rink was a nice little plus, but small (and did I mention loud)? Indoor pool was small and ear-splitting LOUD, the "hot" tub was lukewarm with kids in it. There was just no place to go to get away from the noise, not even in your own room. I get that it's a kid-friendly hotel, but if you're paying $350 a night, you should be able to at least retreat to your room for some small measure of peace and quiet. No such luck. The food and drink were WAY overpriced, which seems to be a theme with this place. Room wasn't very clean - toilet was nasty, bathroom floor had ants. No water pressure in the shower, and if the neighbors flush their toilet while you're in it, watch out. I read the bad reviews, but stayed here anyway. Next time I will learn to trust others' opinions. Will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “needs refurbishing but mostly needs cleaning”
Reviews.Author: beachchicnj
Reviews.Content: I was there for 4 days with my family. Upon arriving late in the evening I asked at the desk for a luggage cart. They called security and sent me down a hallway where someone let me into a large room where all the carts were kept. He asked me for my room number which I didn't have. My daughter was finding a parking place and she had the room keys. He gave a long sigh and said "you have to bring it right back to this room when you unload your luggage". And that was the beginning.... My 10 year old granddaughter and I loaded all the luggage ourselves. There are automatic doors to the entrance of the hotel but once inside there are two more doors to get through with the luggage cart that are not automatic. Very difficult to get through. We get to the room finally, very tired and find the we are in a cave. A very dirty cave. Fourth floor, balcony, overlooking the lobby or ice rink as they call it. The phone had at least a half inch of dust, the bathroom had sand and hair on the door, the little kitchen island had a refrigerator with ice caked on the freezer one inch thick and stains on the rug in front of it. It was so disgusting we were appalled. We were so tired we decided to take care of things in the morning. In the morning I called the desk and told them the room was dirty. They sent someone up to clean it. When we returned after breakfast at the on site restaurant. (Buffet was not worth it either). Nothing had been cleaned. Called the desk again before we went to the beach. They said they would send someone up. When we got back from the beach, still not cleaned. They told me it was redone twice. I asked to see a manager in the room. They sent Jerome, the head of maintenance. I showed him all the things I was talking about and he had someone clean only what I pointed out. They have no idea how to clean. Believe me when I say I have never complained about a hotel before. This is not what I usually do. It was very dirty. They also miss the boat on having luggage caddys for the suitcases in the room, no laundry bags, nothing to hang wet bathng suits on. Forget about umbrellas for the beach, you have to pay extra for that, show your room key every time you enter the pool area, you need to sign in too. If you want to get coffee in the morning you can make it yourself or buy it in the lobby. There are no perks at all and the staff is not friendly in the least.

Reviews.Title: “Old”
Reviews.Author: NewmanMaryland
Reviews.Content: We booked online for a room with "inside view/or bayview" our view was of the lower roof. Horrible. The rooms are old and have not been updated. The pool is horrible - gated like a prison and no where to sit and lounge to watch children- you have to stay in the gated area with your children unless they are 15 or older. Small pool. DOnt bother with the "free buffet breakfast" horrible!! Elevators are very slow- took steps most of the time. Will not go back- needs major updating- poor layout of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “gee guys my kids thought it was awesome ,would go back”
Reviews.Author: christina888
Reviews.Content: my kids 5 &7 years old ,enjoyed the warm indoor pool ,the skating rink,ice show ,,beach access and bouncy house. the 1st rm they gave us had a loud vibratung noise i could not tolerate i get migraines , and nails sticking up from the carpet where the carpet met the bathroom .but they quickly gave us a new room and assured us the room would be recarpeted (didn't want some one else to get hurt ). the new room was clean no problems we only ate breakfast their but it was clean .staff was friendly , they had an outdoor grill which looked and smelled good but we did not eat their . nothing seemd hanously nasty as you guys are making it out to be

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely love it!”
Reviews.Author: naimeh98
Reviews.Content: Thank you so much for the good reviews. I have a wonderful time with my family , my 2 girls love it, they have so much to do, ice skating, swimming in the pools, games... MY husband and I had decided to be our summer get away. Rooms were clean and staff wer every friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “crappy dump hole”
Reviews.Author: sugarcandy_9
Reviews.Content: Absolutely nasty! I was heartbroken when I saw the room in person. I asked to get out of the 5 days that we booked it for, but they would absolutely not allow it, even after knowing how unsatisfied I was with everything. Filthy rooms which are in need of serious renovation. Filthy common areas including the eating areas, game room and indoor pool areas. Super long lines for super slow and too few elevators. No carts for unloading your car, so plan on spending the first hour maybe two unloading your vehicle, waiting for an elevator and making multiple trips. Customer service is non existant! Oh... and WAY WAY WAY OVERPRICED!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Carousel Hotel, Sad State of Affairs”
Reviews.Author: alicatlatch
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Carousel in OC, MD. I always thought of it as one of the beach's landmarks but after staying there, never again. The place is in bad need of renovation. The rooms are pitiful for the price. The worst was the customer service. I know it is the height of their season but that is all the more reason to step it up. They barely could answer our questions. The place is sad :( Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time for all”
Reviews.Author: PaAlex
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an ocean front condo on the 12th floor. The view was just okay because there is a lower building that juts out in front. If you looked beyond that, you could see the beach just fine. For comparison, last year we stayed at The Irene and had nothing between our balcony and the ocean. Most importantly, we were renting from a private owner, so the furnishings and general condition had little to do with the Carousel hotel. This place was lovely. The carpet and ceremic tile looked fairly new. The furniture and appliances were in great shape, the bathrooms were well cared for. I think the housekeeping staff of the Carousel might have cleaned before we checked in (or a service hired by the owner?) but they did an excellent job. There was also a bay front balcony equipped with patio furniture. That was nice for our boogy boards and sand toys. "We" were 3 couples, a 1 year old and a 10 year old. The 10 year old really enjoyed the ice rink. Several times. One couple took the 1 and 10 yr olds to the indoor pool one day and had no complaints. The outdoor pool looked fine but was usually pretty crowded, but we like the beach anyway. We also liked the outside bar and grill. It was very convenient to leave our spot on the beach and get a shaded table for lunch in the middle of the day. Both days, maybe everyday, there was live entertainment which was pretty good. We only went there twice as it was rather expensive, but we kind of expected that. We also got carry out from the indoor bar 1 night: crab cake and hamburger platters. They were very good and not too pricey. We never ate in the restaurant, although they advertised what seemed to be a good deal "all you can eat" breakfast. The elevators were crowded during check in and check out days, end of beach times, etc. which is to be expected. Sometimes we took whichever one had room and walked the extra flight. We didn't mind. We never had to ask for anything, but there always seemed to be plenty of staff around. They were all young and friendly. I have to say, we all enjoyed ourselves. The building and all it's added attractions were great. However, all I can only recommend is a private condo since that's what we had. I'd also recommend something at least on the 12th floor or above for the best view.

Reviews.Title: “Staff are rude and not friendly!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pricegirl9
Reviews.Content: My husband & I took our 3 boys to OC for a family vacation. We went Mon-Fri (7/20/09- 7/24/09) It was very uncomfortable to stay there. The staff watches you like a hawk! For expample, they have a hot tub and and indoor pool. There is a sign that says....No kids under the age of 18 are allowed in hot tub! OK, whatever that I guess can be understandable. I was in the hot tub and my 10 year old came over to ask me a question by kneeling down on the cement......never touched the water or anything and the staff lady came over and yelled at him saying no kids under 18 are allowed even beside the hot tub. My goodness......he came over to ask a question. There wasn't a sign saying they can't be any where near the hot tub!! Then the ice skating rink incident......My husband took the boys to skate. I chose to take pics and video tape them instead! My 3 year old was tired of skating. So, we took his skates off and thought he just needed a little break....put them underneath the chair so no one would trip over them. Next you know.......here comes a staff member running over telling us once you take your skates off...you have to immediately return them. Taking mini breaks are not permitted. WOW! He is 3,,,,its expected for him to get tired. He was eventually gonna put them back on......... Room Key/Door Lock..........last incident........2nd day we were there the room keys would not work. So, we go to front desk and they give us new ones. We try them...they don't work. So, Security comes to check it out....he says once the new keys were given, the door lock had to be re-acvtivated and it never was. At this point we all were hungry and waiting to go get dinner. He finally told us just to go.......he promised when we got back it would work. So, we took kids to boardwalk etc.....get home at 10:30......room keys still don't work. We were furious! Our 3 boys were falling asleep in the hallway! Even the master key would not work. So he said we needed a complete new lock. It took him 45 minutes to put it on and of course the door had to stay open while he was putting it on. Next morning we went to the desk to complain about all these rude staff members and the inconvenience for the door lock. We expected to get some sort of a discount or refund or just anything........nope all they did was apologize for the inconvenience. We got nothing. I would NEVER stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome vacation Loved this resort and will be back again”
Reviews.Author: Angisok
Reviews.Content: I have already recommended this hotel to many people. I took my grandchildren here for a vacation and we all loved it. Don't know why there is so many bad reveiws but this was one of the best vacations we went on. There are so many things to do. You don't have to leave the resort and there are lots of stores and places to eat within walking distance. I usually love to go to the boardwalk but this time didn't even feel like going we were so busy. We went with other families and one had a condo. Everyone was happy with this resort. The people that complained about it must have been very picky people. Don't go by the bad reveiws. When I saw the reveiws I got a little nervous but went anyway since we had the trip planned for quite sometime,. After our stay I thought I just had to write an review ibecause they sure don't deserve some of these bad reiviews. We had breakfast at the hotel and on the buffet you can get your omelets mad fresh which I didn't know till my second visit to eat. For $11 three of us ate till we were full. This was the adult price 2 kids under 12 were free. then it was out to the beah for the day. One day it rained in the early part of the day the kids used this time to ice skate at the indoor ice skating rink. they loved it. Don't be afraid to give this place a try. I think you will be very pleased if you do.

Reviews.Title: “Take your towels”
Reviews.Author: PKSmith7
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my mom, sister, and 2 young children. The hotel is ok, my kids enjoyed it. I emailed the hotel prior to our visit and was told they had towels for use, they failed to inform me I couldn't take the towels to the beach. The rec director, whom I spoke to was very rude. I was 5 hours from home, I don't know where she thought I would get towels. Also there was a condom next to the play ship area for the kids. How gross!! I didn't let the kids go back and didn't tell anyone b/c of how rude she was regarding the towel thing. The bellman was extremely nice and helpful. Our room was right off the pool and it was nice for the kids. Avoid these rooms if you want peace and quiet. It can get loud outside at times. The restaruant was ok and you can watch the ice show while you eat dinner. Also there is no valet service and handicapped parking is very limited. Most of the time I had to drop my mom off at the door and park in the gargage. Thank goodness my sister was with me to help. Also the room attendant left my kid's blankets laying on the floor after making the beds. Yuck!! Overall, I was not impressed with the service, except for the bellman.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine stay at the Carousel!”
Reviews.Author: Chanth
Reviews.Content: I was a bit leery of this hotel after the other comments that were left, but I am pleased to say that we had a wonderful time for our 1 night stay at the Carousel this weekend. We arrived at 11:15am and I checked in, knowing that it was far too early for the room to be ready but wanting to get a parking pass. Surprise! Our room was actually ready for us, and as a bonus we had a great side view of the ocean (room #542, which as far as I am aware is a hotel room and not a condo. Note: we DID overlook the parking lot next door and the dumpsters, but really, who cares?). The room looked well-maintained and clean. The bathroom was perfectly acceptable, and there were enough towels for four people. I tend to be prone to back aches and after walking around for hours already had the start of one, but I am happy to say that the mattress made it no worse. The carpet was a little rumpled in spots, but I wouldn't consider it a tripping hazard. The outside pool was very nice (the kids enjoyed it!), as were the grounds and landscaping around it and the access to the beach. Every employee of the hotel that we ran across said hello when we passed. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant, so I couldn't comment on that. About the only bad part was the distance to the boardwalk, and of course the price ($219+tax), but it seems like everything is overpriced during the height of the summer on a weekend. We'd definitely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Condo was too dirty to cook in, showers moldy, 2 sliding doors broke, ceilings peeling off”
Reviews.Author: PaulaBuffalo
Reviews.Content: When I called the last day to let them know that we were not happy witht he condition of the condo, they said- you should have told us earlier, we would have fixed all of it the first day! No one could repair all of that with 5 of us living there. Location was good, resturant was decent. Staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “It was good for a weekend”
Reviews.Author: tinykillah
Reviews.Content: It was good for a weekend, I would not have been happy there any longer. The rooms need to be updated. The shower curtain had mold on it. I got a standard nonocean front room and instead of having a veiw of like the bay or even the road, I got the ice rink and te bistro place. I didn't like that because it was loud and people could see in. It you closed the curtains it was really dark. Good location bad room for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not That Bad for The Shore”
Reviews.Author: PATraveler6
Reviews.Content: Recently my family and I spent a weekend in Ocean City at the Carousel Resort Hotel. The hotel itself is on the beach and in a convenient location in Ocean City. There are many amenities from indoor/outdoor pool, entertainment, restaurant with reasonable prices and ample parking. The rooms could use a makeover, ours could have used new carpeting and updated furnishings. I must say, our room was spacious, it included two double beds, a counter area with a refrigerator and sink and a small table with two chairs. It overlooked the ocean. The check-in for a weekend was rather quick and the desk personnel were efficient and friendly. If you are looking for something upscale, this is not the place. It is busy during the season and there is alot of traffic in the lobby and common areas. As I said, not bad for the shore.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough- We got a great price!”
Reviews.Author: FrancineK7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carousel for 3 nights and 4 days, we got a very good rate we paid $99 a night for the direct ocean front room. The location was good, I enjoyed being able to walk right out of my room to the ocean, but we were directly behind the bar, so the view to the ocean was disrupted. But we could see see it slightly and hear it perfectly at night with the screen door open. For the price we paid I guess it was alright...but I would choose somewhere else that fits my style...this place was a little too old and outdated and boring! But the deal we got was great, so it was bearable! It honestly wasn't that bad for the price we paid but its not worth more than $99.00!! The beds were hard, the carpet looked dirty and old, the door frame to our room was like incomplete, it looked like the border to the door was never put in. The bathroom door didn't shut, if you could get it to shut you couldn't get it to open. The way the door was located with the small kitchenette counter it was hard to get into your room with all your luggage on one of the carts, we had an incredibly difficult time trying to get the cart into our room. Everything closed early, like the restaurants and the outdoor bar. If you had a room on the first floor like we did it was an elevator ride and a few walks down halls to get to an ice machine. We didn't eat anywhere except for the little grill place outside on the patio, and we didn't use the ice skating rink, but it looked fun. The game room was alright. The indoor pool was big but the water was too room, the hot tub looked like it was from the 1970's and needed redone badly! It looked so uninviting I didn't even get in it! But like I said for the price we paid I didn't mind that hotel wasn't exactly what I like to stay in on vacation, but the location on the beach was great !

Reviews.Title: “Bait & Switch”
Reviews.Author: eddier123
Reviews.Content: I received an e-mail coupon titling me to book any 2 bedroom condominium for $2100 as long as it was booked by June 20, 2009. I called in May and informed them of the 2 bedroom selection I had made. I was told that particular 2 bedroom was deluxe 2 bedroom... huh? I looked over the offer again and didn't see any disclaimers. Back to the Plaza for me... which my family and I have enjoyed for the last several years.

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities, great location, needs updating or major price reduction”
Reviews.Author: Sirisly
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at the Carousel a number of times and every time we leave saying we won't come back until they at least put some new sheets on the beds and pull up the old, mildewy smelling carpet. The Carousel manages to charge top dollar because of the location and the amenities. There's a hundred things to do in the area, a great view, lots of kids for ours to play with, great pools and it's right on the beach. We still feel grosely overcharged every time, however. They need some serious updating, but the staff still acts like they're the best hotel in Ocean City, which they're just not. IIt's novel and it's fun for families, but I would never ever go there unless I was with my kids. Everything looks tired and worn and it kind of smells tired and worn. We have plans to visit this weekend for Memorial Day, but only because the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Some of these reviews are really petty. We loved the Carousel Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: SugarDumplin
Reviews.Content: First of all, some of these reviews posted are ridiculous as to what they are complaining about, that made their stay oh so "terrible". When my husband returned home from Iraq, we booked the Carousel for 3 days with our infant son. The staff was very friendly, we were pleased with the accomodations, and had no complaints of our stay! We especially liked its location, further down the OC strip, away from the busier boardwalk areas. There was no crowding on the beach, not all the noise & traffic. As a travel agent, I am very familiar with the hotel/travel industry and we were completely pleased with this property. We are looking forward to returning again this year, 2009! This time our son is old enough to try out their ice skating rink, where they hold shows in the summer! Definately worth the family checking out!

Reviews.Title: “At Least the Condo's are nice”
Reviews.Author: rockland_ta
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the condo section of the Carousel. I was part of a large golf group that usually goes to Myrtle Beach. Stayed at the Carousel, because it was the only place that our agent was able to book that would have 3 BR suites. Before leaving I was a little aprehensive about what to expect, thankfully the limited reviews on the condo's seemed to be on the mark. My portion of the group stayed on the 6th floor, for some reason this floor comes with housekeeping, don't know why and didn't ask why. The room was nice and comfortable, the water pressure was perfect and the beds were comfy. The only problems we had were with the non-condo portions of the hotel. We were given breakfast vouchers for each of the 5 days of our stay, only to find out that breakfast was only being served on the weekends. Instead we were instructed to use our coupons for a free drink and either a donut or bagel from a concession stand in the atrium. That was fine for the first few days, but on the day we were checking out, the place was closed and there was no where to get anything to eat or drink in the morning. On our last night there, we were talking to some other golfers who were staying in the hotel portion of the Carousel, basically every complaint the other reviewers had, these guys did too. All i can say is if you are going to stay at the Carousel, try to stay in the Condo portion of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as I expected it would be...”
Reviews.Author: traveler862
Reviews.Content: We just returned from one night at the Carousel. The hotel is in bad shape...clearly some investment needs to be made in keeping the place presentable. The brass in the glass elevator needs major cleaning/polishing and the place just looks shabby. When we arrived at our room we had trouble getting the door open. When we walked in, what struck me was the lack of a feeling of quality or cleanliness about the room with respect to the bedding, curtains, kitchen area cabinetry, or furniture. The carpet was darker brown and stained in more than a few places. The curtains were a strange blue print with white stars on them. The lock for the sliding glass door was practically falling off. The furniture on the balcony was plastic and had clearly seen better days. In the bathroom, the molding outside of the tub was coming unattached from the tub itself. The bathroom door was dirty. The water pressure in the shower was very poor. They only left us with one coffee mug and the lid to the coffee maker was broken. I made a pot of coffee and it had that taste that told me the coffee maker needed to be cleaned. Forgot to mention that the mattress was extremely hard and the pillows were lumpy. Even the indoor ice skating rink is not inviting. We will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay During The Winter!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Joanna D
Reviews.Content: Well we checked into the hotel about 3 in the afternoon, and headed right to our room. We had a king room with a jacuzzi tub, we didnt ask for the jacuzzi tub so im assuming it came with the room, but it was nice. We had a great view of the ocean, but since it was winter we didnt venture out to the beach. Our room consisted of a very small bathroom, toilet, bathtub and shower single sink and small hairdryer. Of course they had the normal shampoos and such, i didnt really look at them. When you first walk in there is a small kitchen like area, microwave, fridge sink and some cupboards, then you head into the bedroom where there is a very good size jacuzzi tub big enough for two. The only problem I had with the tub was that im really short and the tub was taller than my hips, getting in wasn't exactly easy. They should really provide steps or something. The bed was just next to the jacuzzi, noraml king size bed, mattress wasnt great. There was a small desk in the room, as well as a sofa coffee table and a table and two chairs. Our room also had two large sliding doors and a patio with table and chairs. I did like that there was a secure lock on the two sliding doors. There was also a large closet in the room as well! After we checked in we decided to go down and inspect the pool. We couldn't get in. It was locked. It had a sign on it that clearly stated that it would be open from 1pm till 9pm, but no one was to be found to open it. So I walked around and checked out the area. The ice skating rink, which is rather small is located right in the middle of the hotel. If you want to ice skate it requires five dollars for rentals. When we had made the reservation I had asked if it cost more to use the ice skating rink and was told no, guest could use it free, but then was told differently when we arrived. One other thing I didnt like about the room is when you walk in there is this huge window right next to the door, now the window has a curtain that goes over it, but doesn't cover the window 100% we had to make it with a clip i had in my bag, i dont like people being able to look in my hotel room. After dinner my husband and I came back to our room, I wanted dessert so I was going to order it from the restaurant downstairs. I went down and stood there forever, no one ever came to see if i needed help. All the lights were lit like it should have been open, but I guess they weren't. So I went back up stairs where we watched tv the rest of the night. They only have basic cable. About 11pm we decided to go to sleep. Well lets just say the walls are paper thin. We could hear everything our neighbor was doing. Plus there was staff with some kind of carts in the halls constantly and they weren't quiet. Then about 1am I had finally drifted off to sleep when our neighbor got a pizza delivery. The delivery guy pounded on his or her door and yelled Fat Boy's Pizza or something like that I jumped so much I nearly fell out of bed. We got up early the next morning and left instead of staying to sleep any longer. Not that we got much sleep in the first place. I was very disappointed in this place. I had considered bringing my daughter with me the next time, but I know I won't go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stiff as a board..”
Reviews.Author: respuelk
Reviews.Content: We checked in for an off season escape after Thanksgiving. GOOD - Room was dated but clean and odor free. Service here was exceptional. TV did not work in the room, they had it replaced within 10 minutes. We needed sheets for the pullout sofa and they delivered them to the door in less than 5 minutes. Guy at the front desk and the girl working the skating rink was courteous and helpful. Room had mini-fridge, coffee maker, blow dryer. Pool and skating rink were nice. NOT SO GOOD - Bed was uncomfortable, woke up sore. I can't imagine more than one night in that bed. Shower did not maintain a steady temperature. Breakfast buffet was tiny and not very tasty(although I didn't expect a whole lot being off season). I would love to stay here next summer merely for the great service and amenities for the kids, but the Carousel would have to upgrade their matresses as I would be useless after a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware -- Not accommodating and poor quality resort”
Reviews.Author: rhanapole
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this resort hotel from August 11th through the 13th at which time our family needed to leave the premises prematurely to tend to an emergency regarding our beloved 11 year old yellow lab retriever - Rudy. Unfortunately, Rudy needed to be put down that evening and needless to say it was a hard time for our family. After explaining the situation and faxing the required documents to the Carousel Resort Hotel, the hotel management and staff never returned my calls or fax and DID NOT reimburse or credit our unused stay (over $700). Outside of this unfortunate incident, the accommodations were outdated, low quality (our TV was old and sound quality poor -- we reported the problem with no response from the establishment), beds were uncomfortable, balcony only had 3 chairs for a family of 4, cooling system too loud, food quality was poor (there on site Pizza was perhaps the worst I've ever had), fitness center old, pool was small and indoor pool depressing, overall run down and not by any means worth the money. The beach was nice -- but since it's public I would recommend staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: JeanneDe
Reviews.Content: I liked the location of this hotel. I also liked the atrium area, the pool and the restaurant's atmosphere and breakfast buffet. The room itself was in need of updating. It was clean but very old and run down..

Reviews.Title: “I will never go back again”
Reviews.Author: lumex1
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival some confusion at the front desk. Original reservation was made and charged to my credit card. I explained to the person on the phone that when we arrive we will be putting this on my boyfriend's american express card. I was told that would not be a problem. Not only was it a problem but we were both billed. We asked at the front desk to put the entire charge on my boyfriend's card. Well that was not done our credit card statements came in we noticed it and I made the first phone call. I spoke to Duran who works in accounting. He explained that if I needed to have these charges removed from my credit card and have my boyfriend's credit card charged he would need to call himself. 3 messages to Duran and 1 message to his boss Robin and not a phone call back!!!! Just for the hassel of trying to get this thing resolved and not a phone call back. I would never stay at this hotel again. They already have our money and not in any hurry to do the right thing and return a phone call. What happen to customer service????

Reviews.Title: “Terriific Stay”
Reviews.Author: mideb01
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had a terrific golf weekend at the Carousel!! Despite the few bad reviews seen on this site, the hotel was clean, the front desk staff and the golf coordinator were exceptionally helpfull, the pool was sparkling, and the bar and restaurant were great!! I go on multiple vacations every year and have learned that you have to take many bad reviews with a grain of salt, some are valid and some are sour grapes for reasons other than what is stated in the review!! I would not hesitate to stay at the Carousel again and plan on staying there with my family in the future!! Highly reccomended!!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Terrible, careless”
Reviews.Author: oceanlover84
Reviews.Content: My Family And I stayed at the carousel in ocean city, md for almost a week... well when we first arrived at the hotel and entered our room, It was soo bad all we could do was laugh and say are you kidding me for that much money? The beds are hard as rocks the pillows where soo flat everyone woke up with a stiff neck and headache, the bed comforters are soo itchy.. And let's say the bathroom is so small you can't even turn around in them, also the bathtub was dirty i didn't even want to give my baby a bath in it that's how bad it was..So we stayed that night and got up the next morning and went to the lobby to tell front desk about the problems, to see if we could get our money back to go somewhere else, she said they could not do that she could just show us another room, so we looked at it exactly the same terrible they are like 20.00 a night rooms...that there charging 340.00 at night for...so in order for us to stay comfy in the hotel since we couldn't get our money back was to rent a condo on the top floors which was theres also, they where a little better but still not good..we had to sleep with 4 pillows a piece lol! and no they didn't give us a discount on the condo we had to add and extra 300.00....just terrible staff there. I also had to go to cvs to buy disinfect spray to spray the beds and other furniture with. Don't let me forget about how thin the walls are you could here other people taking a bath or shower, and also when they flushed there toilets.! The Carousel i will never stay again and would not recommend it to anyone.. You can go somewhere else and pay cheaper and get a better room! the carousel needs some major updates and new staff! oh i just remebered we had got ice cream from there and it was freezer burnt..:( bad

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: KateT2571
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to stay here after reading reviews (i booked before I read reviews) however I was really surprised. After I booked online a week later i noticed teh rates went down and I called to ask about a price adjustment. They were more than happy and polite to adjust my rate. I got there at about 230 and they were fine with me checking in the guy at the desk was really polite and friendly. My room was ready. It was clean and neat. True the hotel is a bit older but I would stay there again because their customer service was terrific. Everyone I encountered there was pleasent and nice. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “I would never stay at this hotel again...”
Reviews.Author: tmindflow
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Carousel for a weekend in July. We checked in and the first thing we noticed when we got to the room was that it did not look like the room had been thoroughly cleaned (e.g. there was dried up food caked on to the rug in a few spots) and there were patches of the wall paper missing in certain spots in the room... and for some reason there was no trash can in the bathroom... I would expect a room like this if I were staying at some cheap hotel for under $100 a night but we were paying $240/night! I wouldn't have bothered writing this review if that was the only thing... but on our last day and night we had no running water in our room for close to 24 hours... we would have left but it was a busy weekend and most places were full... and we assumed we would get our last day refunded because of the water problems... instead they gave us 4 gallon jugs of water to "shower" with until the problem was fixed. When I shaved later that night I kept thinking that it reminded me of when I was in the Army or when I go camping except most campsites have better facilities. We were told 3 different stories of why the water was out by 3 different people at the front desk and told numerous times that the water would be on "within the hour" and would be given monetary compensation towards our stay. Apparently we were not the only people dealing with this situation so when we went to check out the lobby was filled with miserable people complaining and vowing never to come back to the hotel after they found out that their "monetary compensation" was a $50 credit. When we complained we were directed to another long line where we could haggle and argue fruitlessly with the management like everyone else was doing. We just opted to leave as fast as possible! This is one hotel I would never ever go back to.

Reviews.Title: “What A Dump”
Reviews.Author: webkinz08
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump! we checked in and checked right out and wanted a refund. The place kept my money and refused to give it all back . The Carousel is by far a resort. its and old musty smelling motel with condos and a ice skating rink.....

Reviews.Title: “A really nice place to take the family”
Reviews.Author: SNGLEMOMOF2
Reviews.Content: I'll be honest with you, when I read the previous reviews I was a little scared to bring my family here. I vacationed with three teenaged girls. My daughter and her two best friends. But once we got there (We got stuck in the Bay Bridge traffic) I was pleasently suprised. The hotel was nice and clean, all the amenities they offered on the website were available. The girls had plenty to keep them busy. The staff was very pleasent eventhough they did not speak english well. They always spoke or smiled when ever you passed them in the halls. Now I must admit the halls did smell a little musty but the room was very clean. I was prepared so I brought along some cleaning supplies just in case. Some of the other reviews were dreadful. Now it is not the top of the line hotel but if you are looking for a nice place to bring your family for vacation I would recommend the Carousel. The ice skating shows were especially nice in the evenings and it was nice that the kids could skate after being out on the beach all day. I would definately bring my family back here again. And I would recommend it to my friends. Now if you are looking for a romantic get away or a quiet place to stay then you better look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: kinsha
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great for families, very convenient for the beach and you receive 2 free beach chairs. The beach is very clean, the outdoor pool is nice but the inside pool is extremely dirty, green water...In all our experience was ok, the rooms need remodeling, very old and things are falling apart...we stayed for 4 nights and were booked for 5 nights, my husband 's conference ended 1 day earlier so we wanted to check out 1 day earlier but the hotel did not want to reimburse us for that last night...poor management if you ask me....the first 2 days our room was very clean, bathroom perfectly clean, sheets change everyday but the last 2 days, I had to have housekeeping come back twice to redo the bathroom, they were more concern about their tips than cleaning....mmmmm....we probably would not come back to the hotel, food expensive and rooms too expensive for what you get. The front desk staff and restaurant staff were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Been going to the Carousel for a while and there are 2 parts...”
Reviews.Author: CWipes
Reviews.Content: Been going to the Carousel for a several years (approx. 20 yrs) and there are 2 parts to it. There is the Hotel portion which I believe occupies the 2nd to 5th floors. Then there is the Condo portion which is everything 6th floor and above. http://www.carouselhotel.com/amenities.shtml (Bottom of page) The Condos are nicer and larger then the hotel rooms. All units have a kitchen and living room. The Condos are independently owned and operated. The Hotel portion is owned by the Hotel. No units have a kitchen nor living room. While both are available for rent, the Condos are more expensive then the Hotel rooms. Since the reviews for this place are so varied, I think it's would be nice to know which part people are staying in, (ie Condo or Hotel). I always stay in the Condo portion of the Carousel and have never have had a bad experience, (knock on wood). I've never stayed in the Hotel portion.

Reviews.Title: “My family didn't deserve this place”
Reviews.Author: Dadidito
Reviews.Content: I don't think i can add more to all the complaints stated before. It was a horrible experience. The quality of the rooms was dingy. Everything felt dirty. The hallways and the hotel as a whole need a renovation. The beds are absolutely uncomfortable. The best part was the skating rink. We enjoyed that. Otherwise stay away and look at any of the more acceptable places on the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: hogsmeade
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many beach hotels and I was concerned when I read the reviews (read them past the cancel date). I had low expectations when I arrived with my 3 kids (2 teens and 1 pre-teen). We stayed at Plim Plaza last year and while it has character, the room we stayed in was not large enough for 3 people to stand in at the same time. The Carousel was enormous! We could have had 30 people in that room. The view was of the parking lot - not great, but it was what was available. The hotel was clean, and had everything we wanted on site - ice cream shop, several restaurants (indoor and out), indoor pool, outdoor pool, the grounds were beautiful, free beach chair use, and indoor skating rink, which we loved. One thing we notice was that here were many hotel employees (many were exchange students from eastern Europe) at all times roaming around to help us. We had several pleasant conversations with different employees and everyone was very helpful. Never did we encounter a single employee who did not speak English. We even watched the free movie on Friday night - and we hadn't seen it, so it was nice. We watched the ice show, very entertaining - also free. We took the bus (1/2 hour trip) to the boardwalk one night - it was 2.00 for an all-day trip, and the stop is in front of the hotel. We really could not find a thing wrong with this hotel. We were very fortunate to have had a wonderful time and thoroughly enjoyed the stay. The one down side was the elevator, sometimes there were very long lines - luckily we were on the second floor and were able to use the stairs up one flight. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as the reviews say”
Reviews.Author: travelmom40
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Carousel and while it is by no means the Four Seasons our room was clean and bug free! We had a great ocean front view over the pool. Housekeeping was poor though and they didn't show up in our room the second day until 5pm when we were getting showered so the room never was cleaned that day. They did promptly send us clean towels and the front desk was very friendly. The other staff however (mostly eastern europeans) spoke very little English and had trouble understanding us. I was often confronted at the pool to show my room card which I thought was pretty funny since I could not imagine anyone trying to sneak into this tiny pool! It would not be worth the attempt. The indoor pool was much larger but smelled so strongly of cholorine that I had trouble staying there for long. The hotel itself is old and in need of a refurb. The pillows were hard and lumpy and the sofa bed mattress was horrible. The shower would go from hot to cold all through the shower. But it was clean and right on the ocean. It was great to keep our balcony door open at night to listen to the surf. The view from the balcony was so beautiful as well and we enjoyed having snacks and drinks out there. The ice rink was a bit weird, and you had to pay to use it (even for hotel guests) which I thought was a bit much given the price we were paying for the room. We even brought our skates but did not feel like paying extra just to use the rink. As you can see, I had mixed feelings. The location was nice and our ocean front room was nice. I would not stay there again though. It was very pricey for the quality of the hotel. THe Hilton looked very nice and I would try that if we returned to Ocean City. The Hilton was really the only nice looking hotel, most of the others were "no-name" places that looked old and run down to me. Myrtle Beach is much nicer but farther away. The beach was great though.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't waste your money!!!!”
Reviews.Author: N_Star_Pa
Reviews.Content: For the rate that we were charged ($329.00 a night) I expected more….at least a clean room. I have NEVER stayed in a room with feces on the toilet seat and it was clear that the rug was never vacuumed. We called the front desk and the night manager sent someone up to clean the bathroom . She didn't seem concerned about the state of the room until she was told that we had a 5 year child staying in the room. She sent someone up who did a great job cleaning the bathroom but it was rather strange that he locked himself in the bathroom to do so. We also asked for new towels and sheets for the beds since we did not feel comfortable sleeping on the beds. I was totally shocked when the items were just delivered to the room and no effort was made to change the bed. When asked if he would do so, he replied NO! I put the sheets on the bed myself. Verses taking the sheets off, I put the new fitted sheet over the fitted and flat sheets that were on the bed. We checked in the evening of July 3rd and checked out on July 6th. The sheets were never changed!!!!! The night time manager informed us that she would speak the manager the following day and would follow up with us. No surprise we were never contacted. I will never stay at this hotel again. The service was very poor!!!!! My 5 year old told me the room was dirty! Overall I would say this is hands down the worst hotel we have ever stayed in. If you just want to be close to the beach and don't mind a dirty room I guess it will work for you.

Reviews.Title: “HATED IT! Would not stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: lucky98
Reviews.Content: This hotel has CRAPPY customer service, both on the phone and in person. The rooms are OK but for the price you pay, it's totally NOT worth it! The ink rink is SMALL, the indoor pool is NOT heated and does NOT have a shallow end for little kids to play in. The music from the ice rink is BLASTING until 10 PM. We paid in advance for discounted tickets for Jolly Rogers Amusement Park and a large surrey bike rental but were not told all the restrictions regarding the vouchers and the hotel would NOT refund the UNUSED vouchers! The phone operator is absolutely useless. I accidentally left some items in our room after check-out and could not get a competent person to speak with regarding retrieval of these items. DON'T buy into their "amenities", for their price the place is a total rip off. Elevators are slow and it took us FOREVER to be able to get our luggage into our room at check-in and then back down out of our room at check-out. The ONLY good thing was the proximity to the beach but you can find that at ANY hotel in ocean city! Don't waste your money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not for the Picky”
Reviews.Author: verypickyguest
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very old and very used. When we checked in I looked over the room before paying. The shower curtain was covered with mold. The tub mat was disgustingly dirty. The ceiling was a sprayed on texture and when the neighbors aboved jumped, the ceiling flaked on the floor and beds. There was gum under picture frames above the beds, the sheets had sand on them, and the comforters were stained and dirty. I told the front desk and they offered me another room, smaller, but after review very similar complaints. I told the front desk again and they asked me what could be done to make us want to stay. They immediately sent a housekeeping supervisor to correct everything. The people at the font desk were excetionally nice. The building is dated and used very hard. It could (and should have) been cleaner. Our room was huge, and faced a roof, that people litterally threw garbage out onto and no one cleaned up. That was really gross. The beds were comfortable. It advertises 2 outdoor pools. 1 was large and the other was a 2 foot deep round cirlcle baby pool, not something I would advertise as a 2nd pool. It was nice to be on the beach. They gave you 2 free beach chairs to use during your stay. The ice-skating was fun. The skates are old and smelled. Take your own if you're going for this as an added attraction. If you don't expect a 5 star-spotlessly clean hotel, then you will like this place. I'm very very particular so I will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Was Much Better Than I Expected.”
Reviews.Author: Cenlar
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 night stay at the Carousel on Friday. I was a little worried when I read some of the other reviews, but the hotel was fine. We stayed in an Ocean Patio room which had two queen size beds and a sofabed. The room was an average room, good sized. The beds were a little hard and the airconditioner was noisy. Also the screen door kept coming off the track. The location of the room was very convenient. We were right off the lobby which had the ice skating rink and the ice cream snack bar. We did not need to use any elevators. And out the patio door, we were right by the pool and outdoor bar/restaurant. It was a little noisy in the daytime, but the pool and restaurant closed by 9 so there was no late night noise. We ate at the patio restaurant once, the food was good and the service was fine. We did not eat at Seasons restaurant at all. We also only used the outdoor pool, did not use the indoor pool since it was nice weather. The outdoor pool was fine, although a bit crowded. The ice skating rink was great. The ice show was nice, and my daughter, who rarely ice skates normally, spent 3 out of the 4 nights, at the rink. There were tons of small children around and the hotel definitely was family oriented, not for singles. The room was made up late the first day, not til around 4 so the maid service could have been a little better. The only thing I didn't like much about this hotel was the location. It is far from the boardwalk and the main part of ocean city. Also, we went to Assateague Island once, which we loved. Very nice, handicapped accessible trails. We saw a deer up close as well as a pack of horses which ran through the beach parking lot! We also saw some turtles and crabs in the swamp waters. The Carousel is 45 minutes from Assateague so staying in downtown or midtown Ocean City would have been more convenient. What we didn't like about Ocean City was the prices. The restaurants were very expensive, even the ones that looked like they would be more family oriented. The only reasonable places we found were Dennys (great for breakfast) and Pizza Hut. We ate at a seafood buffet at the Castle Hotel which wasn't very good for the price. Oh, Phillips is a good restaurant too, and not too expensive. Don't eat at the Dough Roller, they were expensive and not very good. We also loved the pro golf on 61st street. There is an indoor, airconditioned mini golf, along with an outside mini golf. The outside one was your average minigolf but the inside one was great. A must if you like minigolf. And you can play both courses all day until 5 pm for $10. All in all, we had a pleasant stay in Ocean City, the Carousel was fine, not luxury, but a nice family hotel with alot of amenities. However, next time we will stick with Wildwood NJ, it is closer to us and less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!”
Reviews.Author: jslick
Reviews.Content: Where to start: Literally, everything about this hotel stinks. It is truly geared for families with very small children. Everything closes at or before 10PM. Room service and housekeeping were non-existent. NO ONE SPOKE ENGLISH! Half the reason why we did not get the service desired was because no one understood us with the exception of a few front desk folks. No one was friendly there (staff). They had to close the indoor pool due to potential 'fecal matter' contamination. Everything was laid out wrong. We stayed at the most expensive/largest suite in the hotel expecting a beautiful view and a very nice private/quite time. The room was so poorly laid out, that the refrigeration units for the ice skating rink were located right below the suites! Can you even imagine? If you sat on your expensive balcony, you went deaf from the roar of the fans! The room was filthy and falling apart. Even after complaints, we still did not get proper service and a clean room. There is no toilet seat. How can you not have a toilet seat cover?? Can you imagine only one garbage can for an entire suite? They ripped us off for the infamous ‘$30 gas credit’, claiming we had to book online so many weeks before. It says no such thing on the coupon. The food (breakfast) was cold every morning. Do yourself a favor, stay away from this hole. It's not worth $1.00/night let alone $300/night.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: maslon4
Reviews.Content: We got in Thursday afternoon, and the only 2 negative things I have to say are quite petty, but will show you how the other negatives are WRONG! Bad - people at middle Atrium cafe dont speak english, and are slow and rude. Checkin people take 10 minutes per person for check in, and rarely know answers to any questions you have. Good- Iceskating rink has walkers for kids who cant skate and mid level noise music for the kids as well. There is an indoor pool that is supposed to be heated, it was medium heated , oh well. The hot tub was ok, and there were no annoying kids hogging the pool. The outdoor pool was ok, but the attendants are quite rude. We loved being able to hear the ocean in the morning,, it was great. We ate at the outside beach food and grill. GREAT FOOD, VERY V?ERY SLOW service. Took us 10 minutes to get a drink , and we were there 3 times... guess we should pick a speedier place. This is a great place for families. IF YOU WANT A LUXURY HOTEL DO NOT STAY HERE, ITS NOT FOR THE RICHES, ITS FOR FAMILIES WHO CARE ABOUT FUN AND ENJOYMENT NOT OVERINDULGENCE!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: bethyah
Reviews.Content: My 68 year old Mom, my twin boys age 4, and myself stayed at the Carousel for 2 nights. I was impressed with the spacious room. We had a balcony overlooking the ice rink. It was a great rate and the kids really enjoyed the free ice show, not to mention watching the skaters practice, and of course the ZAMBONI:-) We had complimentary beach chairs and the kids ate free at breakfast. There was nice music at the pool bar, good service at the pool patio, convenient location away from all of the downtown noise, and a clean baby pool. Everything closed down at 10PM at the hotel and it was a family atmosphere. Unfortunately when we arrived the front entrance was blocked due to work being done. There are very small corridors and small elevators. The maid service was not the best. We didn't get any more plastic cups and a dirty wash cloth was left on the sink in the kitchenette. I could not find a map or any hotel information in the room. The indoor pool was extrememly sandy! There was a piece of carpet coming off the wall, a cracked tile in the bathroom, a loose ceiling tile in the bathroom, the light didn't work properly, and the parking spaces were ridiculously small! I would stay at the Carousel again simply because it is one of the better places to stay in Ocean City. Beware of all the other hotels. They are expensive and very old! I am a native Marylander and have been visiting Ocean City for 40 years! It is beginning to lose its appeal and charm. It is becoming an old beach town. I come for the Thrashers fries, the Alaska stand cheese dogs, Fishers popcorn, Candy Kitchen, and Trimpers rides. If you can't afford to stay at the Hilton, then quite possibly the Carousel is for you! Eat at the Olive Tree and Harpoon Hannas. I used to love Phillips, but the service was lousy! I would not spend an entire week in Ocean City. The only thing that keeps me going to Ocean City is for the nostalgia! The town needs a complete makeover!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: samanthasmom02
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this past weekend. Was a bit worried having read the previous reviews. We were pleasantly surprised. Stayed in a 2 bedroom condo. Was very clean and apparently renovated. Staff was great. Was able to check in early. Great for families as there is a lot for the little ones to do.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Ocean City Hotel; Don't Understand the Negative Reviews”
Reviews.Author: jesmorgan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Carousel 5/18-5/22, which is my third stay at the Carousel. I have to admit, I am a little surprised by the overwhelmingly negative reviews. Each of the three times I stayed here, I was quite happy. I will say that it is NOT a luxury hotel. If you are expecting a luxury hotel, you will be disappointed. It is a “nice” hotel, especially for Ocean City which has its fair share of not-so-nice hotels. So if you are looking for a luxury hotel, you may want to consider the new Hilton, but be prepared to spend some money. The Carousel offers hotel rooms on the lower levels; the upper levels are condominiums. We stayed in one of the hotel rooms on the third floor. I paid $80 per night (off-season, non-weekend) through Expedia and found that I got my money’s worth. The room was clean and well stocked with towels. Each room has a fridge, microwave, coffee pot and “kitchen” sink which makes it nice for bringing home leftovers or having breakfast in the room. The room also had a hair dryer, iron, ironing board and large closet. The hotel has easy beach access and provides chairs, although I didn’t use them. I used the hot tub, the exercise room and the locker room during my stay and all were clean. The pool area provides towels (albeit small and thin, not “beach” towels) for use in the pool and gym area. There is also an indoor ice skating rink for rainy days. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. There was a small mix-up with my reservation; somehow I was listed twice on the manifest. The clerk offered to call Expedia for me to make sure my credit card was not double-billed. We were scheduled to be moved from one section of the hotel to a better room for the remainder of our stay and the clerk blocked the room in advance so that it would be ready for us the next morning when it was time to switch. If I had to make one complaint about the hotel, it would be that you can hear everything. The rooms are not well insulated (especially the doors) so you can hear everyone walking down the hall and their conversations. If you have rowdy neighbors, which we did our first night, it can be very annoying. This is not really the hotel’s fault; it is the fault of rude people. The hotel has a strict “no party” policy and if you call the front desk, they will enforce the policy. If you get a room facing Coastal Highway (eg. not beach front) you will hear road noise and noise from the parking lot if your door is open. During the summer months this probably is not such a problem b/c the air conditioner will be on and the door closed. The only other “complaint” I would make is that the beds are hard. They are simply a mattress and box spring, not a comfy pillow top or feather bed that you would find at t Marriott or similar. With that said, I had no problem with this hotel and would recommend it. I have not stayed at the Carousel during the peak season, if that makes a difference.

Reviews.Title: “HATED THIS PLACE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: madhattersPa
Reviews.Content: Lets begin this review with DONT STAY HERE! I went there with my Mom, sister and daughter for a girls getaway. Lets just say that we stayed away from the hotel as much as we could. We first checked in to the hotel; put our bags in the room and went to take a tour of the hotel. After that we went back to our room only to find our swipe card didnt work; neither did the families up the hall from us who was also standing in the hallway. The reason both our room keys didnt work; there was a system gliche and they got our rooms mixed up. This other family told us they were actually in our room before they realized that it was already occupied; I am so glad that I wasnt changing when they walked in. Front desk could have cared less and thought it was rather amusing vs. being concerned. The whole weekend we had to get our swipe card reactivated 9 times. RIDICULOUS! Friday evening we were laying in bed and were discussing what this horrible racket could be; only to figure out we were beside the elevators well needless to say we didnt sleep at all. Went down to the lobby got our rooms changed; again the not caring attitudes is what disgusted me the most. While in the lobby a customer and a hotel employee are standing in the lobby fighting to where the customer says to the employee I will never stay here again; the employee didnt let well enough alone and made another comment the customer asked the employee if he wanted to take this outside. On the way to the elevator another victim of this hotel steps off the elevator and tells us not to go on that elevator he fell 5 flights (something was wrong with the elevator) the poor man was as white as a ghost...again hotel mgmt laughed and said this is impossible that would never happen. Didnt check it out or do anything about it. After a few more times of being in the lobby to get our swipe card fixed and other complaining customers. The next one that got me was when the manager was on the phone with I am guessing another customer telling them dont touch anything; housekeeping was the only ones in your room...let everything the way they left it. I am not sure what was left in this room or how it was left but that is a little scary. OK to top this whole place off...my Mom went to use the bathroom in the morning when she was getting wet and couldnt figure out where it was coming from...she looked up and the ceiling was leaking...GROSS...was it from the toilet/shower above us...who knows...I dont wanna know. Again went to let mgmt know and he laughed in our faces saying that is impossible. I think this hotel is rather gross management there is not caring at all..DO NOT STAY HERE! Obviously I should have read reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Cute & fun”
Reviews.Author: katpetal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there Labor Day weekend last year (2007), and enjoyed it. It wasn't anything super spectacular, but the outside restaurant/bar was fun and the drinks were good. Dinner and breakfast were good also. I never managed to actually go ice-skating at the indoor rink, but that was because we had so much else going on and didn't stay long enough to do it all. I think if I were going to stay in Ocean City again, I'd definitely go back - but I would try to get a room overlook the beach or even overlooking the atrium, the view of the parking lot wasn't all that great but I knew that was what we were getting when I booked it. The staff was friendly, always had a smile for us.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place for the Whole Family!!!”
Reviews.Author: rkmemkc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. We had an atrium view room and could look over our balcony at the ice skating rink. We could watch our kids skate and relax! The indoor pool is very large and also nice. They have an exercise room that we did not use but did walk through, and it was well equipped and clean. There was a sauna in the locker room and a jacuzzi by the pool....very nice :) . The beach was well maintained and a good distance to the water - to accommodate many sun bathers in the summer! Speaking of summer....there is an outdoor pool (one big and one small) as well as two bar/snack bar areas, plenty of 'deck' space and a nice wooden playground that our 5 year old spent a lot of time in. This is truly a RESORT. You do not have to go outside if it is raining...there is plenty to do! The game room, kids activities, FREE WIRELESS INTERNET, the store, the pool, a sports bar and a fabulous restaurant (Seasons). If you feel a need to go outside (lol) there are shops and restaurants and bars within walking distance and you are always a short drive to even more fun. I will definitely stay here again!! The hotel is a beach resort, so the sand and salt water are present but the staff works throughout the day to keep up on it. This hotel is clean, well maintained and comfortable. The staff is friendly, accommodating and willing to do whatever it takes to make sure our stay was just right. One last point I want to write about was the fact that one of the friends we took with us left her glasses in the room. When we got home (3 hour drive) I called the front desk to make them aware that they may be in the bed or under it. They connected me to Security and the gentleman who answered ran 'right up there' to check and said he would call me back. He called in 4 minutes and had them! He wrote my address down on the shipping label while I was on the phone and mailed it that day...I received the glasses in the mail the next day (at no charge)! Just another example of how above and beyond the staff is.

Reviews.Title: “Why not to stay at Carousel”
Reviews.Author: aquagetaway
Reviews.Content: After booking my mini vacation get away, from the hotel's website at less than a week before the actual stay, I found out that almost all of the amenities (ice rink, indoor pool, fitness room, sauna), and food vendors listed on the web-site were not available during my stay! The amenities listed on their web-site, was the reason for choosing that hotel. I received conflicting excuses from staff as to why this was the case. They were more concerned over no-fault blame to them, than any concern of the guest. I was given a SMALL refund to my total bill.

Reviews.Title: “Our Family Loves the Carousel!”
Reviews.Author: apicellae
Reviews.Content: I have two girls, 12 and 14, and every summer my husband and I take them to the shore somewhere on the East Coast. We have been to The Carousel at least five times in the past eight years. We find ourselves coming back again and again because of what a great value it is. I am immaculate at home and would never stay in a dirty hotel. The hotel is very clean and I don't believe people saw bugs there because i never have. If anything, the sheets, towels, bathroom and floors were always clean and well kept. The furniture is a little dated but never bothers me. The hotel has clean pools and a restaurant that is convenient . There is a skating rink which my kids love so they can skate on bad weather days. There is also a great bar and grill outside on the beach that we got lunch from most days. The prices were a little high but if you want a bite to eat on the beach, it works. Overall, I would go back to the Carousel again.

Reviews.Title: “Gross Don't stay”
Reviews.Author: michelle8898
Reviews.Content: Ofter finding this place on the Ocean City, MD website I had decided tobook it. We were going down for my daughters birthday. We went with this place because of the indoor pool and ice skating. We got there and everything went okay with check in. No carts to carry anything to your room so we had to do it all by hand. I also had a 6 months old with me at the time and of course I had tons of things with me. Once we got into the room I started to unpack and feed my 6 month old. When done I went into the bathroom and noticed cockroaches everywhere. My husband caught one and took it to the lobby and informed them that we would be leaving. They didn't care and it took an hour for them to give us our money back. They acted like that is normal. With a 6 month old I was not staying at a place with bugs. All said and done it took us over two weeks to get a full refund and charged me .50 to use the phone to found another place. Do not waste your money. The place is a dump!!

Reviews.Title: “Wrecking Ball Needed”
Reviews.Author: markedman1132
Reviews.Content: My nephew got married in October and the reception was held at the Carousel. I will start by saying they did a pretty good job with the reception. The stay at the hotel was a different story. I booked the hotel over the phone. I had 5 guests total since I was also paying for my mother to have a room. The hotel charged my card for a deposit for both rooms when I booked. When I arrived to check in on a Friday afternoon the line to check in was rather long. When I finally got to the front desk the problems started. The person who took my reservation charged a reservation fee for both rooms but only reserved one. The desk clerk than says to the manager "You know that room we are holding for emergencies, well now we have one". Then she proceeded to send so many credits and charges to my card that eventually Mastercard would not accept any more transactions on the card due to excessive activity from this one vendor. I finally gave them my checkcard and had them charge it to my checking account. It actually took them two months to straighten out the charges to the room. The hotel itself is badly in need of renovation. It looks like everything hasn't been updated in 20-30 years. We went to the breakfast buffet and for $9 a person they had about 10 items to choose from. What they did have wasn't very good anyway. Ocean City is way overpriced and not nearly as nice as places like Myrtle Beach anyway. But if you are intent on going to Ocean City you would be advised to stay somewhere other than the Carousel.

Reviews.Title: “Shocked and Appalled”
Reviews.Author: erinandmatt2007
Reviews.Content: I just wrote a 3 page letter to the "owner", although I will never know if it is the true owner as management was reluctant to give me the name! This hotel is certainly not a "Resort" hotel, but more like a sub standard motel, and the price of our stay was outrageous! Traveling with an infant made the stay even more frustrating as the kitchenette was not in working order, not to mention the stained carpets and box springs. I was livid at the management for their non concern for my complaints, and their inability to control a crowd of young people staying at this "Family" hotel. We were kept up until 3:30 a.m., on both nights of our stay, and the appalling part of this is that my husband had to sign a "no parting waiver" upon check in. We assume that we are the only guests who did! This hotel is very dirty and run down, and it is obvious to me that whom ever owns this hotel is not putting any money back into it. The restaurant, the staff, the atmosphere, and the rooms were way below my expectations, and the advertising was extremely misleading. I would not recommend that you stay there EVER. The hotel should be torn down as it is a waste of ocean front property. I also think the owner should buy a tenement building in the Bronx, and become the slum lord he/she was meant to be!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay with the family”
Reviews.Author: ErnTrekker
Reviews.Content: Note - this review is for the 'hotel' portion (first 5 floors) only, and was for a stay after ‘high-season’. My wife selected the Carousel based on the "family criterion": - must have indoor pool for the kids - must have workout room w/ treadmill for her - must be a decent price I immediately looked up the reviews on this site - and was a bit apprehensive, but decided to try it anyway. I called once before arrival in Aug. with a question (about obtaining a cot) and the staff member was very pleasant. Having stayed at various MD & NJ seaside hotels for years, I've learned not to expect a 'world-class' experience here - all I'm looking for is a clean room, enough towels, and working air conditioner. The Carousel met all expectations with some plusses. It was nice to have the in-house restaurant - which we made use of at breakfast (buffet only - so no service issues & kids ate free). The hostess & wait staff were pleasant. We made use of indoor & outdoor pools, hot-tub & workout room - all of which were satisfactory. Our room was fine - we faced Coastal Highway (i.e. the bay) & although it was 'bike-week' in town (Harleys have a distinctive engine noise), the road noise on the 5th floor was not bad. The shower temperature was fine, the furniture is dated, but fine. One plus is that the TV was a 27”, although we didn’t spend a lot of time watching it. Tips - I read previously that getting carts would be a problem here at checkout, so I made sure to lurk out front until one became available - I was lucky, I found one right away..although other people were eyeing it up the whole time I was using it. I also planned on devoting the last hour before checkout to shuttling luggage back & forth while waiting for elevators – turns out I had plenty of time (keeping in mind it’s September). My conclusion is that the hotel is fine for families – especially for smaller kids, and the wife (ultimate barometer) has no qualms with going there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with stay after reading some reviews”
Reviews.Author: friendlyflyer84
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel portion of this hotel and after reading some of the reviews I was a little concerned. But fortunately we did not have a negative experience and it was what I expected for the price that I paid ($410 for 3 nights taxes included). We arrived on Thursday night at about 1030 pm. They had our room ready and already assigned. It was the type of room that they told me. The decor was a little older (another reviewer said 70's; I think maybe mid 80's) and the carpet seemed to have had some travelers spend time on it. But the room was clean and continued to be cleaned on a daily basis and to my expectations. We had a balcony that overlooked the ice rink and atrium and that was nice as well. We didn't have any problems with noise. The air conditioning worked well and the shower was hot. We didn't use the pool but could see it through the glass from our balcony and it looked clean as well (not green). We stayed during Delmarva Bike Week so thought it was what I would consider off season the hotel was still busy. I never had to wait an unusual amount of time for an elevator and I always saw someone in a security uniform walking the property. I did hear one of the other guests complain about her room as she was to have a bayview room and she said that her room looked at the roof. The staff advised her that she would have to talk to the manager who would be on duty in the morning and that they were not able to move her without manager approval. I could see where that might make someone right a review saying that the staff was not friendly or accommodating. So with this being a long review, I do intend to go back to this hotel next year during the Delmarva Event and am thinking that I will take my family another time as well.

Reviews.Title: “Roaches all over the counter!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerAnnapolis
