Reviews.Content: My friend and I went here for a girls trip and were beyond disgusted! The hotel is completely run down, dirty, dingy and ....we had roaches in our 4th level ocean front room! The managers were unmoved and acted like this is a normal, everyday occurance. Please save yourself from bad memories and stay somewhere else. I wish I had read the reviews prior to staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the 70's”
Reviews.Author: travelfamilyc
Reviews.Content: Ok, so we just got back from staying at this hotel this past Labor Day weekend for two nights. I will admit that I am a very picky person when it comes to hotels but mostly I just want them to be clean. We booked a two bedroom condo on the 7th floor. If they give you room #703 run away fast! We walked in and everything was chrome and white right out of the 70's. The wallpaper was ripping, the bathroom trim around the lower walls was dirty and covered in a mold like substance, the bedspread in the master honestly looked like it had been there since the hotel opened. In all fairness, the room was not that dirty, just very outdated and not the type of room I like to stay in. I would not recommend this hotel. '

Reviews.Title: “Carousel saved our vacation”
Reviews.Author: lmckinney
Reviews.Content: Carousel Resort Hotel saved our vacation. We had booked a room in a nearby hotel in Fenwick that had misrepresented itself (A/C broken, etc) and we had my 2 1/2-year-old granddaughter with us who has asthma and it was in the 90's outside. On Sunday morning at 8 am, I called Carousel's front desk hoping to find a room by that evening - the staff had us moved into a room by 11:30 am. We had a beautiful view of the ocean, the staff was kind and courteous, there was plenty of activities for my granddaughter that were age appropriate and we had a wonderful vacation! After we left, my granddaughter said to me, "I miss my Thomas (a kiddie ride), I miss my ice cream truck (another ride), I miss my pool, I miss my beach... go back!" We will definitely be booking our next vacation at Carousel Resort Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: Slam2u2
Reviews.Content: My family is always excited to stay in OC MD for the week. This hotel I would never stay in again and I have never said that before about a place nor do I have extremely high standards. I just want a clean place, good service, ease of ability to get from room to beach, great pool and good weather. Well the weather no one can do anything about and of course this week the only sun we got was on the day before we left. Anyway, the room itself wasn't bad, it was a high rise condo with a great view. The only room problem was the bathrooms. Both showers were like trying to wash under a light rain and for someone with a lot of hair it was a nightmare. Also the drain was clogged from the moment we got there causing the shower to just fill up the tub each time we used it. The kitchen was bare bones, no cups at all just coffee mugs, minimal utensils and this year I decided to take my own fry pan, what a great idea, theirs were unusable. Getting to the room was another story in itself. 2 elevators up to our area that we waited at times up to 20 minutes to get and then had to fight and squeeze our way in. We were on the 18th floor so walking wasn't an option. The pools, what to say.....gross comes to mind. Light green water that when I was in the 5ft area I couldn't see my feet. You did see the huge amount of sand on the steps of the pool. I love to use the pool on vacation and could only force myself into theirs for about 5 minutes to get the beach sand feeling off of me after being in the ocean. I've never seen a pool so dirty. The indoor one was just as bad as reported by my kids, I didn't even bother to try it. I thought the service people were nice, I didn't have to interact with them too much. Food was good, seafood buffet was adequate except the night we were there a clam eating selfish pig decided that every tray of clams that came out of the kitchen was his, I kid you not. Annoying part was the restaurant let him behave that way and no other guests could get any clams. I'd like to see him try that at the Bonfire (tremendous food). So we looked for another place nearby with a nice pool for next year.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: damien24
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many hotels, and I have to say this was the worst experience I have ever had. The front desk staff were rude and slow. It took forever to check in. And they won't let you check in until 4pm but their check out time is 10am. Does it really take 6 hours to clean up a room? For the price they charged per night you'd think they allow you a late check out, but they wouldn't. And the rooms were old with design stuck back in the sixties. I'll never stay at this hotel again. And I don't recommend anybody else to stay here either.

Reviews.Title: “Trieing a different hotel”
Reviews.Author: CandyKitchenFan
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the carousel. We thought it was a wonderful hotel till the next day. We didn't have room service till 5:00. We had to call room service. What we hated was the used pillows that gave a family member of ours lice. EWWWWW right? :[[[ The outside bar and grill gave me diarea i got really sick, i ordered a hamburger which was RAW. we never ate at the hotel accept for breakfast for 2 days. I hated that cliff, i fell a few times. The people beneath us always threw stuff to the birds they made soooo much noise. What about the air conditioning it was SO loud. The ice skates were SOOOO smelly my kids feet still smell. The sofabed was really lumpy. In the pool you needed to be 15 or older to go in. My kids are really good swimmers and r above 5 feet tall but not over 15. The water was also so green. Then I saw a kid that always disrespected his parents. He then always worried about his lane which was a circle where he put all his sand toys in. He then made a circle which these two couples were sitting in. The hotel wasn't even near any thing good like mini golf or the boardwalk. So i think our family will try a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “nothing special, that's for sure”
Reviews.Author: Marylandmama
Reviews.Content: We booked a one bedroom condo/suite with three beds and upon arrival at the hotel was informed there were none, and we would instead have to be in a regular hotel room with two double beds...would be fine except there were five adults and a baby! after much argument we still ended up in that room and it was on the ground floor (noisy next to ice rink) and had the mustiest nasty smell. the only good thing was it looked right out onto the pool so we didn't have to fight for a table at the bar/restaurant at the pool, instead, just grabbed food and ate on our deck next to the action. The bartenders at the bar were exceedingly rude, one basically flipped my husband off because he made it a point to let them know (nicely) that they were serving people way out of order. the pool is just ok, nothing special. the beach was nice, but so is the whole beach at any hotel in ocean city. the ice show was cute, i'd never watched good ice skating so up close. i guess i had high expectations after staying at the hilton the year before which was exquisite, but booked for our weekend. i wouldn't recommend this hotel for a family stay.

Reviews.Title: “not quite a "resort" hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fuller5
Reviews.Content: We would definitely not stay here again. The couch had stains on it and the pull out was lumpy and uncomfortable for the kids to sleep on. The bathroom shower was horrible. Hot was cold and cold was hot, not to mention when you would pull out on the faucet the whole thing seemed like it was going to come out of the wall. The slider door to the balcony was horrible...you needed bruit force to get it open and closed. The pool inside and out was murky and green. The breakfast buffet was o.k., but stay away from the food outside at the bar...$4 for a hot dog!! The beach was o.k., but there was a giant cliff to climb down to get to the water. Oh and not to mention hardly anyone working at the hotel spoke english very well!!

Reviews.Title: “The Waitresses Tip Themselves.....watch your credit card.”
Reviews.Author: Assawoman
Reviews.Content: Simple and to the point....my husband and other family members decided to attend the bar outside this hotel. We were just coming off the beach; there was five of us total. We sat down and a waitress walked up to us and in broken English said "Bar B Que". We all looked around at each other not knowing why she just mentioned Bar B Que so we decided to just ignore it and place our drink order. She again blurts out Bar B Que and starts ripping off green bands and points to a buffet. We all go sure why not. Now in Northern Virginia during happy hour the local bars to attract people will have with a purchase of two beers you get a steak and baked potato. This practice is not uncommon some places have nacho night or even pizza night. So we were under the assumption that was what was happening....... buy a drink get a cheeseburger. So we get the bill and for five cheeseburgers we paid 13.00 a piece. Well needless to say we were upset. Number one we just wanted a drink she pushed the buffet. Number two why not say we have a buffet for $13.00. We even went as far as to look on the buffet thinking a sign was posted saying $13.00 for a dry cheeseburger... nope....not a sign in sight. All you get is a waitress coming up to you in broken English "Bar B Que". So my husband complained .......the waitress argued .......my husband got mad. So he decides not to leave a tip. We get back from the beach and my husband goes over expenses and sees that there is an extra charge to that particular bill he does the math and figures out that Tatiana the waitress in question decided to add 20% tip without our authorization. Now I have a problem with that. So my advice is pay in cash when you go there because the waitresses apparently think they have the right to add whatever they want to the bill. So check your bill thoroughly ....they got us with the Bar B Que and now they got us a second time with adding their own tip without authorization. That was just an hour spent there ..I can not imagine a whole week.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation Resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: dantheman38
Reviews.Content: The Good: It was a GREAT family vacation resort! indoor ince rink is fabulous for kids and COOL for parents coming off a hot day at the beach. Starbucks located onsite was great in the morning and also checking email in the cafe with their wireless was great. Drinks from Tiki bar were absolutely refreshing and knowing a new drink to make (sex-on-the-boarwalk) was great to know for future reference. I noticed that when my g/f and i came in after 10 pm that the ENTIRE hotel was QUIET QUIET QUIET that you definitely could have heard a pin drop on the carpet thats for sure. Security made itself VERY present at night. nice and secure. Location was great for shopping at grocery store, beer and wine store, bar - "the Green Turtle", 7-11 store, and bustops every ten minutes or SOONER in front of hotel - (across street for all) - all in all.. great location on 118th street in Ocean City. Md. Take the Bus to Everything you want to do near boardwalk for $2 per person all day... the ride at night is entertaining with the intoxicated people but if you are a family looking to use the bus id say ride back by 10pm. (lol... trust me) The hotel gets 'cleaned' every day with employees present everywhere running vacuums and doing maid service during the daylight hours - new towels, washcloths and handtowels every day!.. they keep this hotel as clean as they quite possibly can and they do a great job at it for as BUSY that this place is during the summer months at peak time of year. plenty of parking especially in a parking garage located next to the hotel and i recommend parking in the garage do to it being soo hot during our stay that it made it nice to jump into a cool vehicle IF we were to use our vehicle so thats really nice. The Bad: not much to tell you. the hotel u can tell gets USED but that goes with the whole deal. You see that it needs paint here and there but, It is a family oriented BUSY BUSY and a VERY popular hotel so they must be doing things right. It is a busy busy place then its relatively very quiet at night after 10 pm with security making its presence known to you if you choose to come in late-night. Points of Interest: the Boardwalk - (A huge chunk of metal debris from the Twin Towers is permanently place at a 'tribute' for Fireman the world over on the Boardwalk - people were in awe of this piece and touched it one by one. DEFINITELY a POINT OF INTEREST!) Boardwalk Boardwalk Boardwalk it people. everything to see, do, eat, drink, ride, play and shop. Nightlife? Club it up! look for local "Beachcomer" flyer in the hotel for all nightlife of your choice. THE BEACH!! yeah beach it up and get in the water too. its refreshing after sitting in the how sun for 30 minutes. The food!! Seafood Buffets everywhere! look for coupon books and specials located in the hotel restaurant as well. Check out the Bayside. go for a walk and check out the real estate for sale. you'll be amazed not only by the properties but the prices as well. LOL!! take a late-night walk on the beach.. sit in a lifeguards chair and listen to sounds of the sea. ahhhh... so nice. In Conclusion: Id recommend this place to ANY first-time family vactioners looking to visit Ocean City, Md. The only reason that myself, my family and my g/f stayed there was due to our week at our chiropractors condo rental was NOT available for that week (we stayed 7-16 to 7-18 /2007) so we went with an internet search and i came up with " Ocean City's Favorite Family Hotel - The Carousel Hotel Resort and Condominiums". I googled Ocean City Hotels and thats what i got. If you Google it or whatever you will come up with "the Carousel" as well. welp.. thats really all i got to say about the Carousel. I hope should you entertain the idea of going to Ocean City, Maryland that you would consider "the Carousel". Im actually hoping that The Carousel sees this review, contacts me and gives me a few free nights for this review thats how much i liked staying there. ( LOL!! yeah right.) I asked my mom if shed stay there again and she said that she would have NO problem staying there again. I'll let it at that. the pic of the hotel was taken FROM the beach on a weird but kewl day. this fog/haze came in from the ocean that afternoon sooo much that the lifeguards pulled EVERYBODY out of the water. it was weird but its a neato pic of the hotel from the beach.. take a look... hope u can get some kind of idea of what the hotel looks like from the beach?... oh and about the fog?... it went away at about 4 pm and then we were allowed to go back in the water - refreshing!.. later.. dantheman

Reviews.Title: “nightmare on 118 street”
Reviews.Author: evicted
Reviews.Content: my family vacavtion at this hotel was a true nightmare. I will try to condense this as much as possible. We stayed on the 6 floor ina 2 bedroom condo. it overlooked the roof with 6 very loud air conditioning units, the morning brought used condoms and empty beer cans in front of our balcony thrown from over head condos, some even blown into balloons, the plunger beside the toilet was a nice touch we needed that OFTEN, our toilet gurggled when another room would use theirs,the fruniture was torn and worn, fire alarm sounded and had to evacuate everyone,room was not ready on time 4:00,employees on the roof at any time working on a.c. units or just "picking up" . We were contacted by the hotel to up grade to this?I tried to get our "upgrade money" back and was told in no uncertain terms i was too sensitive to noise and for the condoms they have no control over what other guest do. The beach? it was completely washed away i have never seen a beach like this you had to climb down a cliff to get to it. we will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than all of the horrible reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: triplej181
Reviews.Content: Ok, I wasn't thrilled to see all of the horrible reviews AFTER I had already booked the room. At the last minute some friends of the family invited us (my 4 year old daughter, husband, and myself) to come down for the weekend, this was the only "hotel" that was available on such short notice. We left PA around 8 and checked in at 1am...no problem, i just called them while we were on the road to let them know we are still coming so please hold the room. When we arrived I was relieved to walk into a CLEAN room...clean bathroom, clean sheets, clean carpet! Slept like babies both nights, no fire alrams!!! When taking showers, washing face, brushing teeth, temperature of water remained constant. Just like some of the good reviews say, there was always someone cleaning something. The hotel staff was very courteous, each staff member i passed on the way out everyday said hello or good morning. The pool looked very nice although we unfortunately did not have time to try it out. The best part was the location. It's not so close to the noisy part of the boardwalk you can't sleep at night and it's a 10 minute drive down Coastal 1 to get to the amusement park on the boardwalk. Just steps away from the beautiful beach. I was nervous going down and now i am anxious to go back. :)

Reviews.Title: “condos are great!”
Reviews.Author: manda32
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews I was nervous but we stayed in a condo here and I was pleasantly surprised. It was clean, large and had a beautiful view (don't pick a low floor). the hotel staff was friendly. Very helpful on check in, the bellhops even help you unpack if you like. We were able to check in early, when we arrived at 11:30 they had us ready within an hour. The ice rink was a crowd pleaser and where can you skate for $5??, the beach is beautiful and the hotel provides 2 beach chairs complimentary. The pool grill was nice, had live entertainment and the atmosphere throughout was very family friendly. the hotel lobby was constantly being vacuumed (no sand). the condos have a large bayside balcony which was perfect for having dinner and watching the sunset. Only thing I would say could use improvement were the pools. they were cloudy, but then again, lots of kids with lotion. We also had friends in the hotel portion who did say they could use a face lift. All in all the condo's were great (they do vary unit to unit, but you can view online and pick the one you like) and the recreation sections were fun!

Reviews.Title: “Aftyer 3rd visit, won't return”
Reviews.Author: hc6245
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying here. Unfortunatley it will be our last. I can deal with some problems that this Hotel may have, but not the attutude that the Hotel staff has when you voice a complaint. On the last day, I had to call 3 times to have our room made up. It wasn't done untill 5:00pm. After returning from the beach, the glass elevator got stuck with me in it. It road up and down for 10 minutes before anyone could stop it. After that wnet to room the shower and there was no hot water. After talking with the front desk and having to finally demand to talk with the manager to request an adjustment on the bill, I was told that they were very sorry and that there was nothing that they could do. Seems like from reading other reviews here that the main theme of this Hotel is customer no servce at all times. Oh they did offer me a comp night in January of which I declined, who would want to drive 6.5 hrs for this!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: ldmaem
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carousel for Father's Day weekend. We were on the third floor, ocean front in a hotel style room. We found all the employees to be extremely pleasant, friendly and helpful - from the front desk, to the restaurant to the outside pool/bar area. Even the young gentlemen manning the doors were pleasant and helpful. The game room and the pools were great, parking was never a problem and we had a great time. The only issue I had with the room was the A/C unit - when it kicked on it was loud and made sleeping difficult. The second night we turned the temp. down so it would run all night and just slept bundled up - worked like a charm. My kids had fun and dad had a nice weekend at the beach. We would stay at the Carousel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: snook3133
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a high rise offering hotel rooms on the first 4 floors. The remaining 20 floors above this are condominiums. It has a very family oriented theme. I recently stayed here on the 19-21 of May. I will not be returning ever in my life. I have the following complaints. - Employee's are not hospitable and are downright rude. - Pool Maintenance extremely loud & annoying - Hotel room door broken jammed (safety issue) - Showers scalding hot (took a cold shower) - Arrived at 4p.m. (my room was not ready until 7pm.) - Fire Alarm at 1AM (Entire Building Evacuated) - I will be disputing the first nights charge on my credit card. However the second night I paid cash unfortunately. I agree with the other guests when they suggest booking a condominium as these properties are managed by another company i believe. I have always stayed in the hotel section though. Bottom line for $250.00 a night i should not have been more stressed out when i left then when i arrived. You can not provide second class service and charge first class rates. On my next visit to O.C. I will avoid this place like the plague and look for a holiday inn, or hampton inn.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: krissynita
Reviews.Content: I just have to post a positive review on the Carousel after hubby and I stayed for 3 nights on an improptu beach get away - we actually extended our stay an extra night because we were so pleased and enjoying ourselves, despite the windy beach weather. I was expecting much less after reading the other reviews posted here. Our room was super, had a jacuzzi tub, mini-fridge and microwave, couch, table and a balcony with ocean view. The staff was super-friendly and helpful. The Carousel is definitely a family oriented hotel so we might not stay there again but we would certainly recommend it for families.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this joint. Hotel run for the staff's convenience.”
Reviews.Author: beeblebrox7
Reviews.Content: We took the kids here for a spring break romp. Advertised pool out of order - we were directed to another hotel's pool - it was absolutely disgusting. Pool repaired on the day we left. I asked to purchase late checkout so kids could swim. Request was dismissed in a most obnoxious manner - she mumbled something about being too close to season. Hotel was no way near full - three story garage was empty. She did not care about pool problems etc. and was unable to produce a manager for me to speak with. I asked that manager call me - no call. I wasn't going to twist an arm to get my way, I just believed that competant management would want to hear about this guest's experience. Silly me. Beds were horrible - hard and pitted. Have stayed here before but will not do so again. Maintenace is not being performed on the facilities and we've experienced an increasing number of problems with visits. Like last time when the toilet chose to overflow in spite of the fact that it had not been flushed. While it was occupied. I wasn't standing at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Never will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: erinhatfield12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked in for new years. This hotel was loud, dirty, old and full of kids.. Kids are fine however when thats all you can hear from your room, it sucks. i had an oceanfront room which was great but it was on the 3rd floor and my door faced the ice rink. So all you can hear is the loud music and kids because the rooms are sooo old and there is no insulation. I complained to the front desk so they said they could move me to a no view room but they wouldnt give me any refund for the diffrence. We stayed the whole time, we will never ever stay there again. I contact the Better Buisness Bearu and I have taken a settlement from them.

Reviews.Title: “Find another location”
Reviews.Author: JTone_and_the_Mrs
Reviews.Content: Ok, the only reason we stayed at this hotel was because we were on a convention. But even for a convention...there MUST be better locations! It was dirty, run down, staff was upleasant. If the elevator broke down while we were on it, it wouldn't have surprised me. I remember years ago when we moved to the Eastern shore of MD the Carousel was in the news. It was shut down for some time...If I recall it was because their sprinklers were horribly outdated. The fire marshal eventually shut them down to force them to do upgrades. Too bad they stopped at just the sprinklers. Find another hotel!!! There are some wonderful ones in OC for the same price. If you want to ice skate go there to do that, you can just go there to skate too. (even the ice skating rink isn't all that, and not always open either).

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Enterprise20
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I didn't read the reviews before booking my trip but this hotel was old and the stay was bad. I booked a room at patio level with ocean view, little did I know that our room faces the little bar and grill area. Needless to say we couldn't open the curtains to our room because the patrons eating at the grill could look directly into our room. So much for privacy. The room itself was okay but the bathroom needs major renovation. Since we were on ground level, there was a lot of noise coming from the ice skating area. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not horrible, but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: cjp2
Reviews.Content: This was the headquarter hotel for a trade expo that I attended for work. Luckily, I wasn't on vacation with family and paid a lot of money or I would have been really disappointed. The staff seemed very helpful and were pretty easy to work with. My room [headboards] shared the wall with the elevator shaft, so whenever I was in the room, all I heard were elevators constantly going up and down. Very unpleasant. So avoid any room with the last two digits 21, e.g. 321, 421, etc. as these all share the wall with the elevators. Also, while my room was, in theory, ocean view, the majority of the view was made up of the ice skating rink roof. Everything else seemed pretty standard and ok. Colleagues had a room on the fourth floor that looked out over the parking lot and seemed pretty quiet, so there are decent rooms here. Location is pretty convenient. There's a grocery store, emergency care facility, Burger King, liquor store and restaurant/bar (Green Turtle) immediately across the street. Like the title says, not horrible, but definitely not spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Tripadvisor reviews got this one right... it stinks.”
Reviews.Author: icem2829
Reviews.Content: Unfourtanatly I did not read the reviews on here before staying, although I probably still would have stayed here since our friends were already booked in the same hotel. This was the kind of place where I got a bad feeling right from the start. It looked old , run down and creepy from the outside. The lobby was similar, and very noisy with kids running everywhere. We got to the hotel around 1 pm , and checked in with a women who was quite unfriendy. She said check-in time was 4pm ( in a very snappy way) and made almost no attempt to see if any room was available or to try to make on avialable. I cant ever remember the last time I was not able to check into a hotel after 1pm, especially one this large. But thats ok, I can deal with that. We came back around 4pm to check back in and were told our room was ready. I had paid an extra 30.00 for an ocean view room, and was given a room on the first floor with a view of a concrete wall and a closed down tiki bar. Real nice. Not to mention the fact that to get to our room you have to drag your stuff through the crowded ice rink . Our room was located about 3 feet from where people congregate before getting on the ice.. it could not have been in a worse location. I went back in to the front desk and ecountered the same rude women who told me there was no way to change my room, which was an obvious lie. She just had no desire to do it. The buffet looked horrible, and our friends confirmed that after trying it for breakfast. I really didnt see any redeeming quality about this place. Every aspect of it was subpar. Take my advice and try somewhere else. The only people I could ever see enjoying this place are familes with small children who love to ice skate. Thats about it.

Reviews.Title: “Big Let Down”
Reviews.Author: blazeafyre
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay. We rented a condo for a week one summer which was great. This vacation was an end of beach season weekend. We picked this hotel for the indoor pool and indoor ice skating. Not only was everything in the hotel barely open, the skating rink was closed starting Sunday. No one told us. When I complained to the front desk that no one told us and that we missed our chance to skate because we did other activities Saturday, the manager couldn't have care less. Not even an apology. This may be a great summer vacation, but for a fall stay, they don't care. It is almost like they want you to go home so they can close! If you need to extend check out time, forget it. They charge a half day rate even when the hotel is empty. This was our last stay.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly but Hotel needs a Face Lift”
Reviews.Author: amqtravel
Reviews.Content: We booked the Carousel Hotel after leaving another hotel in Ocean City which was horrible. We were very satisfied with the Carousel. The staff was very courteous and helpful to us. The room needed a facelift and the furniture was very 70's. However, the room and bathroom were both clean which was very important. We always saw a staff memeber cleaning some part of the hotel at all times. We loved the little snack stand/ice cream bar in the lobby. It gave us the option of having a bagel or donut in the morning. We also really liked the patio grill by the beach. We loved getting hot dogs their for lunch. Both the indoor and outdoor pool were clean and well kept. The skating rink was a great feature. The beach area was very crowded probably because the Carousel was surrounded by other large hotels/condos. The room was very expensive, but the hotel itself had a lot of appeal -- it just needs a face lift.

Reviews.Title: “Carousel - Worst Hotel Ever !!!”
Reviews.Author: dianejade
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe this hotel stays in business. The hotel staff are rude and most don't understand English. From our check-in to our check-out I cannot think of one positive thing to say. When checking out I asked to speak to the hotel manager to politely state our disappointment but there was no manager on duty. For $250 a night this place was a disaster. The room(s) were dirty and the common areas were run down. The place so bad that we checked out early. Please don't waste your money staying at this hotel. I wish I would have read the other comments on this website before booking rooms at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommendable! Not Worth The Price!”
Reviews.Author: RDStrip
Reviews.Content: VERY DISAPPOINTING! NOT WORTH IT AT ALL! We reserved on-line (and confirmed by a return e-mail) a $250/night oceanfront 2-queenbed plus sleeper sofa room. Upon check-in, we were given instead a 1-kingsize plus sleeper room on the first floor with a no-privacy patio that was next to a noisy and crowded kiddie pool, with no-ocean view. The hotel should say on its website that ground-floor oceanfront rooms in the hotel were pool/pool-bar view only. We asked to be moved to a higher- floor for patio-privacy and good view of the ocean, but was unsympathetically denied by the reception desk. Hotel staff was not friendly and helpful, pizza in the atrium tasted like it was stored in the freezer for months, the starback coffee was washed down with water, the arcade had outdated video games, the smell of the indoor pool was unusally strong, the atrium was loud and noisy, and food in the breakfast atrium and Seasons Restaurant was horrible! For the price we paid, we were better off getting a non-ocean front room in some other 3-star hotel! Definitely not to be recommended to friends.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst I Have Ever Been to”
Reviews.Author: JAG4
Reviews.Content: Where o where to begin.............. * Dinner at the hotel was an absolute nightmare. The waiter either quit or was fired. we sat at our table for almost an hour. as we were about to leave someone came to us and apologized. The martini was asked with lemon twist, was served w / a lemon wedge, there-fore martini with lemonade. Yy wife ordered lobster, served with burned broccoli, potato floating in water, could ot eat veg. no loboster fork given, had to fight with table fork an knife. Raw oysters, ordered 6 gave twelve, were warm, not served on ice, did not eat, not sure it was good. on top of all this they billed us for the returned drinks and the extra oysters not ordered. Breakfast, eggs were to be sunny up and were raw. Ceiling plaster was falling on thhe bed, kids up stairs were throwing water on every one down below and could not sit on balcony. The lamp was partially disassembeled and if a child touched it .... good-by. The bathroon mirror, when you showered steamed up, of course, and behold, there displayed what looked like semen was on the mirror. If you wanted to use the ladies rest room by the restaurent, don't.. they were not clean, defication and urine on the seats as well as plugged up. "STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE"

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend for the money”
Reviews.Author: ddbalto
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Carousel for 3 nights, with 2 children ages 2 and under. I would not recommend the Carousel for the money they charge. Our room was very,very dirty. Within 15 minutes of walking in bare feet in our room, our feet were black. From then on we had to walk around in socks or shoes. There was sand in our bed. The room is very outdated, dilapidated ie. wallpaper falling off the wall, exposed pipes, carpet filthy and ripping. The bathroom is extremely small, I am an average size person and my 2 year old kept coming in the bathroom with me, but we couldn't even get the door open if we were standing there together. The worst part of the trip was 2 of the 3 nights that we were there, the fire alarm went off at 3:00 a.m. The first night, we were scared, thinking there was a fire and had to evacuate(very scary with little kids). Then talking with another hotel guest the next day, they said someone told them it happens all the time due to a malfunction. Sure enough the third night, the alarm went off again at 3:30 a.m. If this is a regular occurence, the hotel should do something about it. It is very annoying to spend that kind of money to be awaken 2 nights out of 3 at 3:00 a.m. with two small children. Also, do not waste your time at their restaurants, the food is not good at all. They have a breakfast buffet for $10, kids eat free, that we planned on doing each day. After the first day at the breakfast buffet, we did not go back, it was terrible. It appears to me that management is letting the hotel get run down and does not care about taking care of it. Our room was very outdated and run down. In addition, many of the amenities were broken. Wireless network not working, kids rides not working, stamp machine broken, etc. As others wrote in reviews, they make you sign a paper when you check in that you cannot get a refund if you leave early. I can see why, I am sure they have people trying to leave before their checkout date and go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Resort prices for motel styled rooms”
Reviews.Author: boogieboardin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is way over priced! We did not enjoy our stay here! It was a very unrelaxful time there. The room although clean, is VERY OUT DATED! The lighting is poor, the carpets are very worn, the tiled entrance had a crack and a huge chunk missing. The room had no style or Cozy, homey feeling to it. The amenities are not many. The outdoor pool is very small for the amount of guest's that they accommodate. The water was murky and yellow on both day's that we were there. There was a maintenance problem on one of the day's and they decided to shut down the pool and have everyone leave the premises, which was a big inconvenience to most guests' as the majority just wanted to wait around and sun bathe while the problem was resolved. The staff at the pool were rude as well.The smoke detector in our room kept going off in the middle of the night and they could not fix it. We really just could not wait to check out at this point! Since we payed so much money, we could not check out sooner because they have a waiver that you sign when you check in, and we would have lost all our monies. They should be ashamed to call themselves a resort. Immediately upon arrival, we knew this is no resort! It looks more like a huge high rise apartment building with motel styled rooms. Ocean City, maryland is a beautiful place. This hotel is close to the beach, yet very far from the boardwalk. We will love to visit OC again, but have found other hotels that actually look like a resort with the same prices in which we will try.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, way over priced”
Reviews.Author: cmdr
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the potential for being a great hotel. The view from the oceanfront rooms is beautiful, but the rooms are in very bad shape. The carpet is worn and stained, the furniture is old and falling apart, the mattresses are terrible, and the bathrooms are poor at best. I would say it has been at least 10 years since this hotel has been refurbished and updated. The first night we had water flooding into our bathroom, apparently from the bathroom above us, and at 6am in the morning it took two calls to the front desk and 45 minutes before I could get anyone to come up and stop the water flow. The staff is poorly trained in customer service and don't really seem to care about the guests at all. Basically, there is no customer service. The two redeeming factors about this hotel are the oceanfront view and the patio grill. Will not go back to this hotel....way over priced for the extremely poor conditios.

Reviews.Title: “Relax'n At The Carousel”
Reviews.Author: parasoks
Reviews.Content: What a great family-friendly hotel to stay at - you just can't get any closer to the beach. The staff was friendly and the hotel had everything you needed. The ice skating rink is such a unique addition to the hotel's ammenities. There is an ice skating show nightly - FUN TO WATCH. The hotel has live musicians singing and playing by the outdoor pool - FUN AND UPBEAT. I do not travel to Ocean City on a regular basis, but I would definitely make the Carousel my place to stay in Ocean City in the future.

Reviews.Title: “great place- going back”
Reviews.Author: Sabredog1235
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the carousel the week of july 9,2006. i was nervous about seeing the place after booking online and then reading all of the not so good reviews. we were very impressed when we got there. the staff was very friendly and the hotel was very clean. everytime u turn around there was a staff member cleaning. the maid service was hard to understand but not a big deal. we are looking to book the same hotel and vacation this fall.

Reviews.Title: “Too old, too expensive, terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The condo was $430/day for a two bedroom. We stayed in a condo on the 10th floor with my elderly parents, but we have stayed in the hotel as well. Both are in terrible condition. Two elevators to get to 10th floor required wait in line everytime. The hallway outside the elevator smelled of urine. The place was filthy. The condo had no maid service. The furniture was old and dingy, the windows were filthy. Bathrooms too small and dingy. The second bedroom beds very old and uncomfortable. The bed pushed up against the closet so we couldn't access. Windows in the bedroom broken and would not close entirely. The airconditioner only worked in the living room and was very loud. The electricity went out twice. Fuse blew everytime we tried to dry our hair. The water went off during our stay. The fire alarm went off both times we've stayed at this hotel. The staff were not attentive. The restaurant was overpriced and service was poor. The quality of this hotel was extremely poor. AAA rates this hotel a two star, that is generous. We will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for kids, but you should know . . .”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent three days at the Carousel Hotel and found it to be a very nice family resort hotel. There is a coffee and ice-cream shop in the atrium, an outdoor bar and grill between the hotel and the beach and a reasonably-priced restaurant in the hotel. The pools and outdoor area (with very nice playground) are beautifully maintained. It's only steps to the beach, and all lifeguard stands were staffed. Parking can be tough in Ocean City, but between the large lot and indoor garage, parking during our time was plentiful. The stay was nice and, although we did, there was little need to leave the hotel for anything.. While our experience was positive, it's only fair to point out the not-so-positive things. When we made a reservation for an ocean-front room, the reservationist said that she should point out that the ocean view from our first-floor room would be partially blocked by dunes. What she didn't point out was that the dunes were blocked by an outdoor restaurant and tiki bar, with tables no more than eight feet from our patio door. The umbrella tables were so close to our room, that during a brief storm, the wind knocked one of the tables on its side, hitting our door. Sitting on a chair on our patio, we had people at the closest table no more than three feet away. The other door to the room opened directly into the activity in the atrium. At one point, the theme from "Space Odyssey" from the front door and the sounds of a duo performing "Rollin' Down the River" from the patio door were a cacophony so loud that we couldn't hear each other talking in our room. All we could do was laugh. The point is, don't take a first-floor room if you want privacy and to watch the quiet ocean. There have been a number of reviews about service and cleanliness at this hotel. Our experience was that the the room and grounds appeared clean. The hotel did seem to be short staffed, and a number of them had difficulty with English, but those who were there were friendly and helpful. There should be no major complaints for guests who are self-sufficient, but if you're looking for a luxury, high-end hotel, with personalized service, this is not the place. If we were looking for fun excursion, would we stay at the Carousel again? Yes. It's an entertaining, very affordable getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy with the Carousel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Requested non smoking ocean front six months in advance of arrival. Was given only room left at checkout... smoking ocean front. front desk said sorry, someone put wrong info in computer. was correct on paperwork and my confirmation but not in computer so had to sleep on pillows and sheets that reeked of cigarette smoke. hello...how can computer not match confirmation it printed out? bathroom was horrible. small, dingy, condensation drops all over ceiling of shower that dripped on you as you took a shower. poorly lit. screen door to patio would not budge. moved ot non-smoking room next day. bathroom same. poorly lit, condensation all over shower ceiling again, dingy....but this one had no phone line and a loud noise when air conditioner ran.... maintenance tried to help but the rooms on the second floor need to be updated. rooms were clean and view of ocean is great.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, good time”
Reviews.Author: bubbak
Reviews.Content: From the looks of the reviews its seems like its feast or famine at The Carousel. Our three night stay in April at $100/night was more of a feast. The first impression someone might get as they arrive is "Wow the parking lot is packed. They must have something going on." And I think that they do. Our Oceanfront 3rd floor room was clean and comfortable. The kids loved the ice skating rink and at $5 for a skate rental its a deal. The beachfront lcation is great. Kites will stay up all day. The pool was a bit cloudy but as a pool owner I can forgive that. I've stayed here once before so obviously I think that it is a reasonable deal. The kids had a great time and everyone was happy. Don't expect the Hyatt or Hilton at the Carousel - just a good time at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Very dirty carpets, not treated well”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked an oceanfront room that indeed was oceanfront but overlooking a restaurant roof. The carpetting in the room was horribly stained and ther staff not at all accommadating, especially in the restaurant. I would not recommend this motel to anyone. It was very overpriced and has poor management.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time and money!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 ocean-front rooms in the hotel. After seeing pictures of the beautiful high-rise in the photos, I was really looking forward to having nice oceanfront rooms. What they don't tell you is that the hotel section of the Carousel is the bottom 4 floors only, and the ocean-front rooms are in a very old part of the building. The baths were tiny with terrible lighting, there wasn't even a real closet to speak of (just a recessed area in the wall), and our "view", while it did face the ocean, also looked directly down at the lower floors decks in front of our rooms. My bathroom ceiling leaked water 3 seperate days and I had to call maintenance to "fix" it each time. I asked for some kind of credit for the inconvenience, even a ticket for free drinks would have been ok, but the desk manager never bothered to get "back" to me as she promised. The a/c and ventilation is lousy. Housekeeping did do a nice job keeping it clean. The deli staff was rude. The inside pool was murky and dirty, you couldn't see your feet, there were old bandaids in the potted palms, and my kids kept bringing up hairbands, money, etc from the bottom of the pool. The last night I moved to a non-oceanfront room because that was how my reservation had been set up, and found that these rooms were in the "new" part of the building and were actually quite nice. So I paid a lot more for a dumpy room. Maybe the condos are nicer, but I doubt I'll go back to find out. The breakfast buffet was good and a nice value, and the building is in a great location with shopping centers across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Would never go back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the worst, most enraging, and rudest place I have ever had the misfortune of spending 4 days at. My friends and family rented 4 rooms over Easter weekend 06. We choose the hotel for all the activities for the kids, we had 5 with us. Unfortunately all the free activities were closed down so the only thing the kids had to do was ice skate and play video games. One at a time we were going down to the front desk to find out when the pool, hot tub, sauna, and weight room would reopen. We kept being told different stories as to why and when. At no time were the 4 of us told the same thing. On the 2nd day after I finally asked to speak to the manager we were finally informed that another hotel would allow us to use there pool, but we were never told like I said and the whole time this was available to hotel guests. We were never rude just asked about the pool, but after learning about the other pool I asked to be compensated even if it was only free ice skating for the kids. No compensation we ever made. I realize that things break down, my beef is how can 4 different people get 4 different answers to the same question? Beside after 20 years of dealing with the public one thing I have learned is just be honest with your customers and treat them with respect. There is no communication between management and staff. This whole situation could have been avoided with a simple sign on the pool doors explaining that the other pool across the street was available. There was a hand written sign saying pool area closed until further notice, so its not like they could not re-write the sign. I was down there with a back injury, taking pain killers and xanax, by the time I got done talking to the manager I was shaking all over, so much for a nice relaxing weekend like my doctor suggested.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to go to Getaway!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ocean City has become an annual trip. We have been coming here and staying at the Carousel since 2003. This is our fourth year spending Labor Day weekend at the Carousel. We love it so much that this year we are staying there for Memorial Day weekend and Labor Day weekend. The three bedroom condos are beautiful, spacious and very clean. The staff here couldn't be nicer or more helpful. The breakfast buffet is huge and everything is so clean. We look forward to our annual trip every year. It's not a great getaway unless you stay at the Carousel.

Reviews.Title: “over priced!”
Reviews.Author: goOC_24
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty good but this year it is more expensive than the Hilton! The pools are fairly good and the view is great. There is even a table on the balcony! Over all this hotel is great for you rich people out there but I highly reccomend the Hilton over the Carousel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Beach Front Suite”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are a local couple looking for a romantic getaway, while we had company staying at our house. I had heard about the Carousel, and decided to give it a try. We stayed off season, but I was suprised at how busy it was there, I think there was a convention. On site, they have a pool, skating rink (small but still fun if you don't go skating much), hot tub, restaurant, and saunas in the bathrooms. We didn't really use many of these, because our room was so awesome! In our room, there was a jacuzzi and a ocean front deck with table. It was too cold to spend much time outside, but the view was breathtaking, and it was a nice place for my gentleman to smoke (room was non smoking) without going too far. We LOVED the jacuzzi, it was huge and very relaxing. The staff was friendly and answered any and all questions we had. Very clean room, and if were staying longer, we would have definitely taken advantage of the fridge and the microwave in the room (not to mention the room service- walking by the restuarant smelled heavenly!)!! The prive was very reasonable, I think we stayed for under $100 for a Saturday night. We WILL be back!

Reviews.Title: “Not for a Quiet Romantic Weekend”
Reviews.Author: areview28
Reviews.Content: Rooms at the Carousel surround an atrium where loudspeakers blare music for the skating rink crowd until 10 p.m. There isn't enough soundproofing in the rooms to eliminate the racket. Families with kids seem to love the show, but it doesn't make for a particularly pleasant stay for couple, so be warned. The skating rink draws a large crowd of teenagers, so the atmosphere in the lobby is raucous, like a weekend at a shopping center. The parking lot was quite crowded compared to other hotels in the area. We paid for a room with an ocean view which was spacious and comfortable, with two queen beds and a convertible couch. It had been renovated and was pretty much standard issue beach hotel pastels. The bed was uncomfortably firm. The bathroom was comparatively small, but adequate, with a nice assortment of toiletries. Overall, it seemed like a good beach hotel spoiled by one bad noise problem.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for business and was very shocked that the hotel not only did not have high speed internet access but had the nerve to charge you to use their machines which were located in the lobby of the hotel. I also could not believe how strange the staff were at the hotel. When I checked out of the hotel not only did they not put a receipt of my bill under my door like most hotels do the morning that you are leaving, BUT, they were very surprised when I asked several times for a copy of my bill after I checked out of the hotel. The woman kept telling me that the charges would be on my credit card and I kept telling her that I needed a receipt of my ENTIRE hotel bill in order to get reimbursed by my company. The worst thing about my stay besides the outdated room was that I could actually smell the fumes of gas coming from the cars parked in the lot which my room faced even though my window in my room was closed. The knob for the heating and air conditioning button that lets you adjust the temperature was also broken. Michelle

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced but decent”
Reviews.Author: mark91178
Reviews.Content: This is without a doubt the most overpriced hotel in Ocean city. While I have never had any problems that other have stated, I agree that there is alot of room for improvement seeing the rates here. I booked a king/jacuzzi room for an anniversary weekend at 250 per night. Now, the room was one of the biggest and nicest I've seen, with a HUGE patio almost right on the beach, but again, anything $200+ you might as well be burning the money. The room we had was again, very nice ,no problems. They claim an ice skating rink, but it's really not much bigger that your room. Very small, plus you have to pay to rent skates. There is a larger indoor pool here as well, but it was very crowded, i don't think we gave it a shot. There was a bar on the first floor by the ice skating "rink", but we didn't check that out either. The staff here weren't the nicest, considering what you pay. All in all, I'd stay away. Unless they offer some kind of amazing special, you will not get what you pay for...

Reviews.Title: “What a OVER PRICED DIRTY HOLE IN THE WALL -”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the last person who wrote a review. Here is a question for you - Why is it that you never see a picture of the rooms??? We stayed at the hotel for a a weekend and our room did not have a view. The hotel was expensive to stay at and the room we stayed in has not been updated since 1976 - the year it was built. The bath tub was dirty. Mold around the windows, the windows were dirty. The tables were dusty and we can back to our room at 11:30 at nigth and found a cock roach on the floor. The tub drained so slow that by the time you were done you were standing in 3inches of your own filth. This was the MOST disgusting place I have ever stayed at. I've stayed in a bungalow in the rain forest in Costa Rica for 30.00 a night and that was cleaner than this 175.00 a night room. To top off the weekend some kind sole hit my car in the carousel parking lot (and no they did not leave a note.) When we checked out we told the Desk Manager all of the problems and she asked us why we didn't call the front desk to allow them to fix the problems and the since we didn't there was not much she could do. What happend to customer service???? And it is not like our problems just happened when we showed up. All of the problem we had was a result of an old dirty run down hotel. I didn't realize that I should of spent my weekend -------- to the hotel staff of the problems or that I should of called them to the room at 11:30 at night to kill a cock roach.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carousel over Labor Day weekend this year. We were not particularly thrilled with the shabby outdated decor but tried to make the best of it. Once in our room we were disgusted with the unkept and unmaintained bathroom with a cheap tub surround that was falling off the walls and every corner filled with mold and grime. We tried to close our eyes and take our showers but found that difficult when the bathroom ceiling caved in on my daughter while in the shower. We called the front desk who gave us another room but never apologized, offered any help or even mentioned my daugther who the ceiling caved in on. We spent the entire morning dealing with this mess and moving our stuff. When we tried to check out the bellboys had all of the carts and would NOT let us use one. I asked the desk who said call a bell boy, I stated that the Carousel would not get any more of my money and I would move out myself. They refused to let me use a cart and I called the bellboy, had them move it and did not pay them. I heard other families arguing to use a cart to check out, the carousel was trying to take one last advantage of families by not letting them use a cart while four bellboys stood there holding them, "empty"!!! We intend to follow this up with the president of the organization who we looked up online, as the desk manager would not give us the information!!! Does she think were total imbeciles, you can get anything online!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five night stay at the Carousel. Like many others I had read the reviews and arrived expecting the worst. I was pleasantly surprised. We had booked a non smoking, two queen bed room overlooking the ice rink, and that is exactly what we got. We were on the second floor, our room was huge in comparision to most hotels rooms. The fridge, microwave and sink came in handy for quick breakfasts for the kids. It had a huge closet as well. The kids really enjoyed watching the nightly skate show from the balcony, which was also very nice. It was carpeted, very clean and had a chair with an ottoman. We did not encounter any rude staff members. We let our children (ages 6 and 8) attend Camp Carousel one evening and they begged to go back. It was a good deal for only $12 per child. The food at the outdoor grill was very good. My husband and I ate at Seasons while the children were at Camp Carousel and were very pleased with the buffet. We all had the breakfast buffet one morning and it seemed to have something for everyone. The beach is very clean, the complimentary beach chairs were nice. If I had to think of a complaint it would be that we were overcharged for ice skating. It was supposed to be $5 per child, and we were charged the "public" rate of $7. It is a nice, clean decent hotel. Close to everything and far enough from the board walk to be less congested. We will probably return. We all had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dguiter
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week's stay at the Carousel. I was scared to death after reading the reviews on this web-site, but I must say I was pleasantly surprised. We travel a lot and have stayed in many hotels over the years and this was no disappointment. It was very clean, the foliage outside near the beach was beautiful. The beach bar was lovely, the restaurants adequate (not the only restaurants on the island). There are many staff members who are constantly sweeping, hosing down sandy areas, cleaning glass, etc. I must say that the front desk staff may be a little bit snappy and indifferent, however everybody working at the hotel is very nice. My kids loved this hotel, there is plenty to do and extremely well-maintained. We will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great experience!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We read some of the reviews of the Carousel AFTER we had made our reservations. I was really nervous that we were going to have a bad experience. To the contrary, we had a great experience. We did not run into one rude employee. We requested some extra towels one evening, and within 5 minutes, they were at our door! The room was clean, and had the promised bedding for 6 people (2 adults and 4 kids). We took advantage of the free beach chairs... and they were just fine. After thinking hard, our only complaint would be, they shouldn't charge hotel guests to use the ice rink. We would gladly stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'd sleep in my car before staying here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were told we had a suite, but somehow were booked in a two bedroom room. The hotel staff insisted we had a non-smoking room, but the stench was sickening. They begrudginly gave us another room. (Not a suite). At the so called "breakfast buffet" the staff apologized for not having any of the entrees we requested--but did nothing about it. Our boy only wanted a box of Apple Jacks and had to wait for 20 minutes while they went to "find one". We had four adults in our rooms, but were only given towels for two people. We requested an extra pillow that never came. Overall for a so called three star hotel, it was crummy and shabby. Our room did not even have a nightstand or a mirror, or closet doors. The whole place seemed run down. We booked the place off of the great pictures seen on the website - do not be misled!!! We were, but thank God we were only there three nights!!!

Reviews.Title: “Situated in the middle of Tacky OC”
Reviews.Author: DNewYork
Reviews.Content: The Carousel is fine. The rooms are clean, the service was actually very pleasant, and the setting on the beach is terrific. The public areas could use a bit of a makeover. The dirty carpeting in the elevator, the tired décor, and the freezing atrium, which must be kept at what seems to be about 55 degrees for the ridiculous ice-skating rink, were all things that need to be improved. I would strongly suggest an ocean-view room, which is well worth it, considering that the other rooms either look into the interior atrium or the parking lot. Also, try and avoid the long lines at Saturday check-in and do not expect any added-extras. When I left the weight room with my workout towel, I was admonished to return the towel “right now.” That sort of treatment would not happen at most hotels. The real issue here, to be very frank, is Ocean City itself. For a weekend filled with kitsch and crabs, it is ideal, but do not expect an incredible resort town. The boardwalk and strip-mall Coastal Highway are reminiscent of everything that is wrong with beach towns like OC; things got built far too quickly without any adherence to the beauty of the setting. I would recommend the Carousel, but would not recommend the area. Unless, of course, you are a golfer. Checkout the Lighthouse Sound Course (about fifteen minutes away). Unbelievable link-style course that is a pleasant distance from the chaos of OC.

Reviews.Title: “rip off”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would not reccomend this hotel to anyone. The people in reservations were very ignorant. I got into a nasty arguement with the front desk staff after they raised the price of my room after I was quoted a lower price over the phone, and on top of that, they ignored the request of the type of room I was promised over the phone also. It seemed they did not care once they had your money and you were in the palm of their hands. The rooms were nice, but who wants to argue with anyone while on vacation and be treated like an old dish rag. I will never stay there again. also... I almost forgot, beware of the flies in the resturant, they will carry you away as their prey. they were all over, and the buffet is way over priced.

Reviews.Title: “yuk”
Reviews.Author: speck91854
Reviews.Content: I was not a happy camper at this Hotel. Way below the high ratings as far as I am concerned. Door broke, never saw a maid cleaning room, no dishes, no response from front desk when needing anything. Requested towels, never came. Half the time TV did not work. It use to be a great hotel, NOW DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible beyond horrible!”
Reviews.Author: gks
Reviews.Content: After moving 4 times from rooms with mold, excessive noise, and standing water in the carpet we settled for an exterior room facing both the ocean and a 'courtyard roof'. They even charged us more for this travesty!! To make a long story short, the room was disgusting, dirty and terribly outdated & tacky. The couch was stained in a way I couldn't even explain and the bathroom was so small you had to back in to shut the door. Suffice it to say I wouldn't let the kids walk barefoot in the room. After hours - the fun really started with loud patrons, open drunkeness and so much ciggarette smoke coming from the non-smoking room next door we slept with the slider open to breathe. Management was non-responsive at best. When I suggested we might just check out early and be free of the discomfort I was strongly reminded that there were no refunds for early check-out. Never again is all I can say.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed....wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: mamasanlrn
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from a one-night stay at this hotel and it sucked!! We had a room with 2 double beds instead of a king. When we requested a king bedroom, we were told there were none available. The only good thing about the room was the size. This room was located directly across the hall from the "maid's quarters". We were awakened by loud women chatting in another language at 6am!!! I decided to get up at that point and proceeded to take a shower in a tub that had a steep dip in the floor...I had to hold onto the shower curtain the entire time I bathed. Then, the people above us decided to take a shower after us and the annoying sounds of the pipes generating their water was UNBELEIVABLE!!!!!!! It sounded like a tornado coming through the ceiling. Oh, I forgot to mention the dumpsters that were located directly across the street from our side of the building were dumped at 5am...VERY LOUD!!! DO NOT SPEND YOUR MONEY HERE!!!!!!!!! I can't imagine staying here and having to pay for a room. Luckily our room was paid for by someone else. I have no idea what they charge for a room like this, but to me it was worth 20 bucks a night just to have some where to sleep until 5 in the morning!!!

Reviews.Title: “Kids, Kids, Everywhere!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I should have known that the ice rink and carousel would spell out “bad weekend” for me. My sister and I stayed at the Carousel during a last minute weekend trip. I do not recommend this hotel for anyone trying to avoid noisy children. The lobby was always total chaos. The hotel is located on a major bus route so we were able to leave the car parked for the entire trip - that was nice. The room was okay. My skin didn't crawl. Having a refrigerator was a plus. The staff was not very friendly and checkout was a nightmare. There were several people at the front desk complaining about the noise level. I guess we missed the “in room” noise because we were never in the room. All in all, if I stumbled upon a discounted room here I would consider staying here again just to shower and sleep. I will never pay full price again – it just wasn’t worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: treki999
Reviews.Content: Beautiful condos and fanastic ocean front views. I loved the fact that I could tour the condo online before selecting. Large bedrooms, kitchen and balcony. Furniture is cabana type but not cheap looking. Full Washer and Dryer. Large indoor pool. The outdoor pool is small, but it is large enough to serve it's purpose. Confortable lounge chairs. Clean and short access to the Ocean. Rental chairs and lifeguard stand directly in front of building. Two resturants----O.K. Eat in or Eat out. No high speed in the condo, only in the rink area. Condos have dial up.

Reviews.Title: “Fire Hazzard”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the 22nd Floor Penthouse with 8 people in all on New Year's Eve 2004. Fire alarm went off around 12:30 AM and we quickly found out there was no Emergency lighting in the Hallways or Stairwells. (However, electric did function in our penthouse) We traveled 22 flights in total darkness. Children where crying, and elderly people where very distraught. Outside we let the Fire Marshal know the situation and he was very upset and said he would take action. The worst part was when we confronted the General Manager, he really didn't care at all. Stay at your own risk, but at least pack a flashlight!!

Reviews.Title: “Guess I Lucked Out.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived in OC to find my original reservations with Comfort Inn not where I thought they would be. I was able to cancel with no deposit lost. Now to find a room on the ocean during peak season (second week of August) for four days. After about an hour of my friend and I running our cell phone bills skyhigh we were able to get a suite at the Carousel for $325.00 a night,'bayview'. Well I was really grateful just to get a room. We were told that some one had checked out sooner than expected (after reading all these stories I can only imagine). Yes the elevators were slow and the only real problem we had was that the power went out in our room when I plugged in my hair dryer. After two calls maintanance finally fixed it. I did not eat here at all. Was the room worth over $300 ? NO WAY! Was it worth it to get to stay on such short notice? YES!

Reviews.Title: “Go after Labor Day”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to the Carousel and will return again next year but be advised....only after Labor Day. Rates are way too high "in season" for what you get and the area is too crowded June - August. We stayed for 4 nights 9/20 - 9/23 for $69 per night. The weather is still very nice, high 70's/low 80's and the water is very warm. The beach is still quite nice at the Carousel but is even nicer as you get closer to the boardwalk. Stay away from Dewey Beach...the beach has erroded completely away! The hotel itself....nothing special. The ice rink is a major attraction but be advised you still have to pay $3 to skate and another $1 rental if you don't have your own. The ice is poorly groomed and is full of deep ruts...not much fun. The rooms are nothing special and it appears that it has been many years since they were updated. For $69 a night it is more than acceptable but in season it is over $200...hardly worth it.

Reviews.Title: “12th floor Ocean Front Condo”
Reviews.Author: RedEyeMike
Reviews.Content: Having first booked the condo and then reading the reviews I was very concerned. However all my concerns were for nothing as my wife and I hade one of the best ocean vacations. I did a lot of research before booking and it paid off. Carousel has both a hotel and a condo. The hotel is in front of the condo so you need to get at least above the tenth floor for good views. The standard 2 bedroom condo has a smaller balcony and is cheaper, however we opted for the deluxe unit with 30 foot balcony and master bedroom overlooking the water. The lobby and public areas are well maintained but the units are dated. There are plenty of great restuarants in the area and the beaches are very clean. We stayed one week from 9/11 through 9/18/2004 - right between two hurricanes and had beautiful weather. The air conditioning units on the atrium between the hotel and condos were noisy and covered up the ocean sounds, but was tolarable. The Seasons restuarant, on the property had a limited menu but the food was good. They also have an early bird special were kids can eat free.

Reviews.Title: “SAVE YOUR MONEY!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? Well here goes......There is absolutely no customer service. Everyone acts as if you are bothering them when you have legitimate concerns. I am one of the many posters that did not get what they were promised. I bought a condo, facing the ocean. I received a small, bug infested, funky room facing the parking lot. By the way, they called it a "bayview, " but the only thing you are viewing is the parking lot and the strip mall across the street. The mattress had springs poking me in the back. The bathroom had cakes of black hair around the toilet and behind the door. There was evidence of used toothpaste in the sink. There were water stains on each wall of the room, along with cracking drywall on the ceiling, and by the way, does everybody smoke in this hotel? I went home smelling like an old tobacco plant, and something else, that probaly can't be printed on this website. I will never go to this Stink Trap again!

Reviews.Title: “What a vacation..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What an excellent vacation. The hotel staff was friendly, the swimming pools were wonderful. We had a wonderful time

HotelInfo.Name: Carousel Resort Hotel & Condominiums
HotelInfo.Address: 11700 Coastal Highway, Ocean City, MD 21842
